Consumer complaint narrative:
Heres the updated credit dispute letter with the Equifax information included : -- - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Georgia XXXX Subject : Dispute of Charge-Off Account - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Equifax , I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy of a charge-off on my credit report associated with XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX According to my credit report, the account in question is listed as a charge-off, which I believe to be inaccurate and misleading. 

The reporting of this charge-off violates several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Specifically : 1. **15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 4 ) ** : This law mandates that consumer reporting agencies ensure maximum possible accuracy in the information they report. The charge-off status of this account does not accurately reflect my payment history and account status.

2. **15 USC 1681 ( e ) ** : This provision requires that agencies provide consumers with a clear explanation of their rights. XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX has failed to provide me with the necessary documentation to substantiate the charge-off, thereby violating my rights under this law. 

3. **15 USC 1681 ( 6 ) ** : This law prohibits the reporting of inaccurate information. As the charge-off does not accurately represent my dealings with XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX it constitutes a violation of this statute. 

I request that you conduct a thorough investigation of this matter and remove the inaccurate charge-off from my credit report. 

Please ensure that all communications regarding this dispute are directed to my address provided above. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your response within the time frame specified by law. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I am filing this complaint to demand accountability for the blatant disregard of my rights by the credit bureaus, who have willfully ignored their obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, Section 605B. As a documented victim of a data breach, with proof of compromised personal information, I provided the required evidence and formal identity theft report to have fraudulent entries removed from my credit file. Despite my compliance, the bureaus have refused to block the inaccurate information, resulting in severe damage to my financial standing and personal reputation. This is a clear and unlawful violation of consumer protections, and I demand immediate corrective action by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). If these egregious violations are not addressed promptly, I am fully prepared to initiate litigation to hold the bureaus accountable and recover full damages for the harm inflicted upon me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Illinois, XXXX Dear Experian, This letter is being sent to you in response to a recent charge of {$600.00} that was made on my credit report that I do not recognize. 
Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested.

This is NOT a request for " verification '' or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. 
At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Late Payment Account Dear Experian, I am writing to formally dispute a late payment entry on my credit report that I believe to be inaccurate. This entry is associated with XXXX XXXX Account # ( XXXX ), and it does not accurately reflect my payment history. 

The reporting of this late payment violates several provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically : 1. **15 USC 1666 ( b ) ** : This section requires that creditors provide accurate information regarding the payment history of consumers. The late payment reported on my account does not align with my records and is not a true reflection of my payment behaviors.

2. **15 USC 1637 ( a ) ** : This provision mandates that creditors must provide clear and accurate disclosures regarding the terms of credit, including payment schedules. I believe that the late payment reported is not compliant with these requirements, as it misrepresents my payment history.

I kindly request that you investigate this matter and review the evidence I have enclosed to support my dispute. I believe that upon review, the inaccurate late payment will be removed from my credit report. 

Please direct all communications regarding this dispute to my address provided above. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and look forward to your response within the time frame specified by law. 

Thank you for your assistance. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
[ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ] [ XXXX, NY, XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX ] Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by Experian Dear CFPB, I am submitting this formal complaint against Experian for its failure to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) during the dispute process for inaccurate information reported on my credit report. Below, I have detailed the specific violations and my concerns regarding Experians handling of my dispute concerning the account with XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX ( Account # XXXX ). 

On [ XX/XX/XXXX ], I filed a dispute with Experian regarding inaccuracies in the reporting of the above-referenced account. I waited over 35 days for a resolution, only to receive a response claiming the information was accurate, without proper investigation or correction of the errors I identified.

Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) ) : Experian is required to conduct a reasonable investigation of disputes. Despite providing detailed evidence to demonstrate inaccuracies in the accounts payment history, balance, and status updates, Experian failed to reasonably investigate or address the errors. The ongoing reporting of incorrect information indicates negligence in fulfilling this obligation.

Failure to Provide Results of the Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) :
Experians response to my dispute did not include the necessary details regarding their investigation. They failed to explain how the disputed information was verified as accurate or provide supporting evidence from the furnisher XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Failure to Correct or Delete Inaccurate Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ) : The investigation results did not lead to the correction or deletion of the following inaccuracies : Payment history inaccurately shows delinquent activity in XXXX, despite the account being charged off in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Balance updates as recent as XX/XX/XXXX suggest re-aging of the debt, a practice prohibited under the FCRA. 

Discrepancies in the reported balance ( {$520.00} ), past due amount ( {$520.00} ), and highest balance ( {$580.00} ).

Failure to Consider Consumer-Provided Evidence ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) ( B ) ) : I provided supporting documentation highlighting these inaccuracies, which Experian appears to have ignored during their investigation. This failure to consider or forward relevant information to the furnisher violates the FCRA. 
Continuing to Report Disputed Information Without Proper Verification ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) ) : Experian continues to report inaccurate information despite its failure to properly verify the validity of the disputed account details. This practice further undermines the reliability of the credit reporting process.

I request the CFPBs assistance in ensuring Experian complies with its legal obligations under the FCRA. Specifically, I ask that Experian : Conduct a thorough and reasonable investigation into my dispute. 

Provide a detailed explanation of the steps taken to verify the disputed information and include supporting documentation from XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Correct or delete all inaccurate or unverifiable information related to the disputed account. 

Implement measures to prevent future violations and ensure compliance with the FCRA.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I trust the CFPB will investigate Experians actions and ensure they fulfill their obligations under the law. Please feel free to contact me if additional information or documentation is required. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ] [ XX/XX/XXXX ] [ XXXX ]

Consumer complaint narrative: I have many unauthorized transactions on my Bank of America account coming from fanduel. This has been going on from XX/XX/XXXX until I went to file a fraud claim XX/XX/XXXX. I do have a fanduel account which I do make deposits on but there were hundreds of transactions on my Bank of America statement that were not me. The unauthorized transactions started in small amounts which gradually gotten bigger over time which is how I noticed. I have spoken to Bank of America fraud department several times the first phone representative I spoke to put in a random amount I did not give him specific transactions, and of course that was denied. Bank of America told me to compare my bank statement to my fanduel statement and write out which transactions I did not do. After I did that I filed a new claim with the correct fraudulent transactions, and the phone operator told me so send my proof and documents to an email with my claim number on it, just to find out they gave me a business account email so they never received it, he also told me I would receive temporary credit in XXXX business days. I never received credit so I called and I was told that was inaccurate information. I reopened my fraud claim and went to a Bank of America XXXX XX/XX/XXXX so they can fax my documents over to the correct fax number and the fraud department didnt even take time to review them because they denied my claim again, only hours later. I dont know if my only option left is to make a police report, Bank of America keeps denying my claim, stating that these transactions are probably me or a friend that I allowed to use my card, which is completely false, I have been short {$4200.00} since XXXX and I dont know what to do, I did my part and sent my proof, it should be a priority for a bank I been banking with since XXXX to help me, this is the first time I ever had an unusual pattern in my bank account history and they will not help me. I spoke to at least XXXX different operators since XXXX which I keep getting passed around false information and not receiving the correct help. The documents I sent in are proof of my fanduel statements that show exact times, dates and amounts of money I have deposited into fanduel each month.

This company is reporting inaccurate information on my credit report. This company Violated the United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) Recently I checked my credit report and noticed multiple billing errors under 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ( 4 ) The creditors failure to reflect properly on a statement, a payment made by the obligor or a credit issued to the obligor.

( 5 ) A computation error or similar error of an accounting nature of the creditor on a statement. 

As I know the creditor didnt notify me 21 days before with a statement so there should be no late payments on this account. I demand to see hard solid proof from the creditor bank account that I didnt pay and was marked late, because this is clearly a billing error. 

The items below should all be updated to paid as agreed on my consumer report. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX.

XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX As a consumer by law these accounts on this letter must be updated or deleted immediately or I will seek monetary compensation for violation of my rights in small claims court in my city and state under 15 USC 1681n civil liability because Ive been violated.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request to Block and Delete Accounts Due to Identity Theft Pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally notify you that I have become a victim of identity theft as a result of a recent data breachOF XXXX. In accordance with my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you block and permanently delete any fraudulent accounts, inquiries, or information associated with the identity theft from my credit report. 
I am also attaching proof that I was a victim of the XXXX XXXX breach, and I kindly request that this information be considered as part of my claim. 
I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER:XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within FOUR business days. 
To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} I am also including an FTC Identity Theft Report with the reference number XXXX to further support my claim of identity theft. This report provides additional documentation of the fraudulent activity linked to the XXXX data breach. As mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, upon receiving this identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are required to block and delete any information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days.

Please find enclosed the following documents to support my claim :. 
I request that you confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with a written statement once the accounts and information have been blocked and deleted, as required by law. Please ensure that I receive an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that you will act quickly to resolve this issue in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to immediately initiate arbitration proceedings due to your willful noncompliance with applicable consumer protection laws, specifically under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Despite my prior efforts to resolve this matter amicably, your actions or lack thereof in addressing my concerns have led to clear violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned statutes. These violations include, but are not limited to : FCRA Violations : Your failure to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timely reporting of information to credit reporting agencies has resulted in irreparable harm to my creditworthiness. 

FDCPA Violations : Your aggressive and deceptive debt collection practices, including [ specify actions such as harassment, threats, false statements ], violate my rights as protected under the FDCPA. 

Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to enforce my rights through legal action, including arbitration, which will be pursued immediately as per the terms of our agreement and the applicable laws. Your actions have left me no choice but to move forward with arbitration to seek the remedies I am entitled to by law. 

15 U.S.C. 1666b - Timing Of Payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

REMOVAL OF ALL LATE PAYMENTS IMMEDIATELY - UPDATE ACCOUNT " PAID AS AGREED " Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Experian is inaccurately reporting this payment as late, which constitutes a material misrepresentation of the account status. Conversely, both FICO and XXXX are not reflecting this payment as late, which further substantiates the claim of erroneous and misleading credit reporting. This disparity in reporting suggests a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates the accurate and timely reporting of credit information. '' This version incorporates references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is relevant to disputes regarding inaccuracies in credit reporting. 

15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) Disclosure to consumer ( A ) In general Except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), a person may not procure a consumer report, or cause a consumer report to be procured, for employment purposes with respect to any consumer, unless ( i ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes ; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. 

Removal AND DELETE Of Unauthorized Hard Inquiry - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent an
d willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Phone Number : XXXX SSN : XXXX XXXX : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Experian Dispute Department XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX TX XXXX Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Removal of Fraudulent Accounts Identity Theft Report To Whom It May Concern : Experian I am submitting a formal dispute under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) concerning the following accounts appearing on my credit report : XXXX. XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Original Creditor XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Type : Charge Card Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Status : Closed, charged off ; {$320.00} written off ; {$120.00} past due as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
Contact : ( XXXX ) XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, NV XXXX Fraudulent Nature of the Accounts These accounts were opened fraudulently as a result of identity theft. As proof, I have included the following : Police Report : XXXX Police Department ( Incident Number : XXXX ). 
FTC Identity Theft Report : Report Number : XXXX. 

Legal Violations Identified In addition to disputing the validity of these accounts, I am notifying you of the following legal violations that pertain to my case : 1. Failure to Remove Fraudulent Information ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( a ) ) : Under federal law, disputed fraudulent information must be blocked or removed within four business days of receiving sufficient evidence.

2. Failure to Comply with Verification Standards ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Any verification methods used appear inadequate or flawed.

3. Negligent Non-Compliance ( 15 U.S.C. 1681o ) : Failure to investigate thoroughly and promptly constitutes negligence.

4. Willful Non-Compliance ( 15 U.S.C. 1681n ) : Ongoing reporting of fraudulent accounts despite sufficient documentation demonstrates willful disregard of the law.

5. Defamation of Character : The inclusion of fraudulent accounts has negatively impacted my creditworthiness and reputation.

6. Negligent Enhancement of Identity Fraud : Failure to address these inaccuracies perpetuates harm caused by identity theft.

7. Violation of FDCPA Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : Reporting unvalidated accounts breaches permissible purposes and obligations under the FDCPA.

Demand for Immediate Action I hereby request that you : 1. Block and remove the fraudulent accounts as required under FCRA 605B.

2. Provide me with a detailed explanation of any investigation conducted, including all documentation used to verify these accounts.

3. Supply a copy of the full method of verification and any supporting records.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to comply with this dispute in accordance with the FCRA and FDCPA will result in escalation. Specifically, I will file complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and seek damages of {$1000.00} per violation in small claims court.

Metro 2 Format Submission This document is formatted to meet Metro 2 standards. Should additional details be required for processing, please notify me immediately. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter. I expect a resolution and confirmation of removal within 30 days, as mandated by federal law. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX XXXX Phone Number : XXXX Enclosures : FTC Identity Theft Report Police Report

Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to immediately initiate arbitration proceedings due to your willful noncompliance with applicable consumer protection laws, specifically under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Despite my prior efforts to resolve this matter amicably, your actions or lack thereof in addressing my concerns have led to clear violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned statutes. These violations include, but are not limited to : FCRA Violations : Your failure to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timely reporting of information to credit reporting agencies has resulted in irreparable harm to my creditworthiness. 

FDCPA Violations : Your aggressive and deceptive debt collection practices, including [ specify actions such as harassment, threats, false statements ], violate my rights as protected under the FDCPA. 

Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to enforce my rights through legal action, including arbitration, which will be pursued immediately as per the terms of our agreement and the applicable laws. Your actions have left me no choice but to move forward with arbitration to seek the remedies I am entitled to by law. 

15 U.S.C. 1666b - Timing Of Payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

REMOVAL OF ALL LATE PAYMENTS IMMEDIATELY - UPDATE ACCOUNT " PAID AS AGREED " Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Experian is inaccurately reporting this payment as late, which constitutes a material misrepresentation of the account status. Conversely, both FICO and XXXX are not reflecting this payment as late, which further substantiates the claim of erroneous and misleading credit reporting. This disparity in reporting suggests a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates the accurate and timely reporting of credit information. '' This version incorporates references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is relevant to disputes regarding inaccuracies in credit reporting. 

15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) Disclosure to consumer ( A ) In general Except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), a person may not procure a consumer report, or cause a consumer report to be procured, for employment purposes with respect to any consumer, unless ( i ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes ; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. 

Removal AND DELETE Of Unauthorized Hard Inquiry XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I looked at my Experian credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act by Experian Dear Sir/Madam, I write to formally lodge a complaint against Experian concerning the erroneous and misleading reporting of an account linked to Police and Fire FCU ( Account Number : XXXX ) on my consumer credit report.

**Factual Background** : - Experian has persisted in representing this account as accurate, notwithstanding my successful dispute with XXXX, which culminated in the removal of said account from my credit profile. 
- This inconsistency raises substantial concerns regarding the reliability and validity of Experian 's verification process.

**Legal Basis** : - Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i, consumer reporting agencies are mandated to expeditiously delete any disputed item that has been determined to be inaccurate or unverifiable. 
- The conflicting results from the same financial institution signify a potential failure in Experian 's compliance with the statutory obligations established under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), which necessitate that consumer reporting agencies uphold standards of accuracy and integrity in reporting.

**Impact on Consumer Rights** : The ongoing reporting of this inaccurate account has inflicted significant harm upon my creditworthiness and overall financial well-being. Such conduct contravenes the principles enshrined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which underscores the necessity for fairness, impartiality, and consumer privacy. 

**Demand for Remedial Action** : I hereby demand the immediate expungement of this erroneous account from my Experian credit report. Enclosed, please find pertinent documentation from XXXX that corroborates my assertions. 

I respectfully implore the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to undertake a comprehensive investigation into the practices of Experian in this matter. I anticipate your prompt and thorough response to address my concerns. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this pressing issue.

This misreporting is causing significant harm to my consumer profile and is severely limiting my ability to secure credit and financing opportunities. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I have attached the following supporting documentation to this complaint for your review : 1. A copy of my divorce decree.

2. A copy of my ID.

3. Proof of address.

4. A copy of the disputed account reporting to XXXX and Experian. 

I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that these timeshare accounts are promptly removed from my consumer credit reports as they no longer pertain to me under the terms of my divorce decree. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX  XXXX. Account # : XXXX Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy. 

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, Mohela sent mailed communications to a lender ( myself ) that their 4 direct subsidized and 4 unsubsidized federal loans have been placed on an administrative forbearance due to the federal court injunction blocking the Saving on a Valuable Education ( SAVE ) plan ( i.e., a forced forbearance out of the lender 's control ). The lender ( myself ) had been put on the SAVE plan previously and therefore this is NOT a processing forbearance. The communications clearly stated that no interest would accrue during this ( forced administrative ) forbearance. 

On XX/XX/year>, the lender ( myself ) received a mailed communication from Mohela with a reminder that interest will continue to accrue on all loans under forbearance. However, the communication showed all 8 loans with a 0 % interest rate, and yet also listed an unpaid interest balance totaling {$68.00} for all 8 loans. 

During this entire period between the first communication on XX/XX/year> and up to the present day of XX/XX/year>, the Mohela website loan details show the interest rate of all 8 loans to be at 0 % interest rate. 

When the lender attempted to call Mohela on XX/XX/year> between XXXX XXXX  XXXX and XXXX XXXX  XXXX to obtain clarification on whether or not their loan is indeed accruing interest despite the prior communications, Mohela deflected and disconnected all call attempts.

Product: Student loan
Consumer complaint narrative: I have student loans through Mohela. Under this company I placed an application for the save plan about 6 months ago. Secondary to the injunction placed, the application has been put on hold and they have begun requesting payments. With that they have a temporary way to place accounts in forbearance for 60 days to give time for application processing. I had done this twice but when further questioning the process I was told that I did not have to call and this would automatically be placed. This was concerning because after 60 days went buy mohela emailed me again saying my payments are due. So I took the time to call and I notice in the recording of the customer service call line it clearly states to ignore these bills as they are false. That being said I waited, trusting that when the due date came it would automatically be placed in forbearance. At the due day however that did not happen, my account went into past due. Based on this, I started calling the customer service starting with the call back option that is offered which never occurred. The next day I called again with an estimated wait time of 84 minutes and waited for about 3 hours in which I got connected to a customer service rep that agreed my account should be in forebearance but they had to transfer me. They transferred me to and I stayed on the phone another 4-5 hours until it was late at night when the call disconnected. I attempted a few other times between there where I could never even get to talk to the first person because the wait time were so long. I finally was able to get through the process in which I talked to 4 different reps, who were able to place my account in forbearance. I finally asked for a supervisor to talk about the poor quality and concerns about collections. The supervisor said that yea there recording says ignore your bills but she advised against that because if I would have listened to that recording and 90 days passed that I would have been at that time reported to credit companies and it would have impacted my credit. She also told me that there is nothing she can do to fix my account because this isnt a perfect world and that many other people are also not properly getting placed in forbearance. She also said there is nothing she can do about being on hold for 15+ hours yet again its not a perfect world. All this being said, this is worrisome and questionable collection practices. I am very worried by the fact that I would have had a ding on my credit if I would have listened to my lenders customer service line to ignore my bill. I am also highly concerned that my ability to get my questions answered about what is going on and fix it took me 15+ hours. A collection agency such as Mohela needs to be held to higher standards.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Consumer complaint narrative: Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX, Consumer Social Security Number : XXXX, Consumer Date of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX, Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency , block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a personal EDUCATIONAL account opened at U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, an EDUCATIONAL account opened at U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, a EDUCATIONAL account opened at U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, and a EDUCATIONAL account opened at U.S. DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$2600.00} that appears related to the aforementioned personal loan account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # ( private case number ) as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint Subject : Second Dispute of Charge-Off Account : Failure to Properly Investigate and Verify Under FCRA Sections 1681b ( 2 ), 1681b ( 5 ), and XXXX * XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Complaint Details : I am filing this complaint because I am dissatisfied with the outcome of the investigation conducted by [ Experian ] regarding a charge-off account reported under [ XXXX ]. Despite my initial dispute and your subsequent response stating the account was verified, I still believe that this charge-off entry is inaccurate and does not meet the standards outlined under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

On [ XX/XX/year> ], I disputed the charge-off with Experian. However, after reviewing your response, it is clear that the investigation was insufficient and does not meet the legal requirements for accuracy or verification as outlined in the FCRA. Specifically, I dispute that the charge-off is valid, and I am requesting that this account be removed from my credit report if the creditor can not provide adequate verification. 

I am citing the following sections of the FCRA to support my position : XXXX. Section XXXX ( XXXX ) The FCRA mandates that all information reported to credit reporting agencies must be accurate. Despite the claim that the information has been verified, I have not been provided with sufficient documentation to substantiate the charge-off. 
XXXX. Section XXXX ( XXXX ) This section requires that the credit reporting agency and users of consumer reports ensure that the information is used for a permissible purpose and is accurate. The charge-off in question XXXX have been reported in error and lacks proper verification from the creditor. 
XXXX. Section XXXX This section requires that credit reporting agencies conduct a thorough investigation into any dispute within 30 days. Given that my initial dispute was not properly investigated, I am requesting that you reinvestigate the charge-off, paying particular attention to whether the creditor has adequately verified the account. 
Under Section XXXX of the FCRA, if a charge-off can not be properly verified, the credit reporting agency is obligated to delete the inaccurate information from my credit report. 

I am requesting the following actions from the credit reporting agency : * Proof of verification from the creditor, including account statements, payment history, or any other documents supporting the charge-off. 
* If the creditor is unable to provide adequate verification of the charge-off, I request that the entry be immediately deleted from my credit report. 
I am also requesting that the CFPB intervene to ensure that my rights under the FCRA are upheld and that my credit report is accurate and free of any misleading or incorrect information. 
Failure to properly address this dispute and verify the charge-off entry violates my rights under the FCRA and XXXX result in further legal action if this matter is not resolved promptly. I request that the CFPB help ensure compliance with the FCRA and prompt resolution of this issue. 

RESOLUTION * Ensure the charge-off is verified or deleted in compliance with FCRA Sections XXXX ( XXXX ), XXXX ( XXXX ), and XXXX. 
* Ensure that the credit reporting agency conducts a proper and timely reinvestigation and resolves this issue within the XXXX period outlined in the FCRA. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a resolution within the XXXX period stipulated by the FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action. Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! du
e to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Subject : Request for Method of Verification Dear Experian, I am writing to formally request the method of verification used for the information listed on my credit report, as provided by your agency. I believe that my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) entitle me to this information, particularly in regard to the accuracy and integrity of my credit profile.

Dispute Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ACCOUNT # XXXX I recently reviewed my credit report and noticed some discrepancies that I would like to investigate further. In accordance with the FCRA, I am requesting that you provide me with the following : 1. The specific information that was used to verify the accuracy of the items in question.

2. The name and contact details of the entities that furnished this information to your agency.

3. Any documentation or records that substantiate the verification process.

I kindly ask that you respond to this request within 15 days of receipt, as stipulated by the FCRA. Please send your response to the address listed above or via email at XXXX Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response.

Consumer complaint narrative: My accounts was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights.

And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 1681B ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

The identity of the entity/entities responsible for carrying out this verification. 
Any documentation or evidence used to support the accuracy of the disputed items. 
I am fully aware of my rights under the FCRA, and I expect full compliance with this request. If you can not provide verifiable proof for these items.

This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a personal credit card account opened at XXXX  on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, an auto loan account opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, a personal loan account opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX, and a collections account opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$2300.00} that appears related to the aforementioned personal loan account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # ( private case number ) as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act by XXXX XXXX XXXX  To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally report a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by XXXX XXXX XXXX According to the FCRA, specifically Section A, a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe the information is inaccurate. 

Additionally, under Section B, it states that a person shall not furnish information to any consumer reporting agency if they have been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and the information is indeed inaccurate. 

I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit reporting. Unfortunately, the representative I spoke with was unhelpful and did not address my concerns adequately. I emphasized that credit card accounts remain on a credit report for seven years and that I have maintained this account in good standing for over a year. Despite this, XXXX XXXX XXXX has not updated my information with all three credit bureaus without correcting the inaccuracies. 

I kindly request that your offices investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX for their non-compliance with the FCRA. It is essential for consumers to be protected from inaccurate reporting that can negatively impact their creditworthiness. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15
U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to immediately initiate arbitration proceedings due to your willful noncompliance with applicable consumer protection laws, specifically under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Despite my prior efforts to resolve this matter amicably, your actions or lack thereof in addressing my concerns have led to clear violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned statutes. These violations include, but are not limited to : FCRA Violations : Your failure to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timely reporting of information to credit reporting agencies has resulted in irreparable harm to my creditworthiness. 

FDCPA Violations : Your aggressive and deceptive debt collection practices, including [ specify actions such as harassment, threats, false statements ], violate my rights as protected under the FDCPA. 

Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to enforce my rights through legal action, including arbitration, which will be pursued immediately as per the terms of our agreement and the applicable laws. Your actions have left me no choice but to move forward with arbitration to seek the remedies I am entitled to by law.

15 U.S.C. 1666b - Timing Of Payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

REMOVAL OF ALL LATE PAYMENTS IMMEDIATELY - UPDATE ACCOUNT " PAID AS AGREED " Account : XXXX  XXXX Account XXXX Experian is inaccurately reporting this payment as late, which constitutes a material misrepresentation of the account status. Conversely, both FICO and XXXX are not reflecting this payment as late, which further substantiates the claim of erroneous and misleading credit reporting. This disparity in reporting suggests a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates the accurate and timely reporting of credit information. '' This version incorporates references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is relevant to disputes regarding inaccuracies in credit reporting.

15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) Disclosure to consumer ( A ) In general Except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), a person may not procure a consumer report, or cause a consumer report to be procured, for employment purposes with respect to any consumer, unless ( i ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes ; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. 

Removal AND DELETE Of Unauthorized Hard Inquiry - XXXX XXXX - Inquired on XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX

Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility. Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by the IRS. Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report the canceled debt as gross Income on your tax return. The IRS Clearly defines a charge-off as Gross or Ordinary Income. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. I am a victim of Identity Theft. I have NOT opened, benefitted, or authorized anyone to open any accounts in my name. 
CXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I looked at my Experian credit report on XX/XX/year>, and noticed some incomplete and inaccurate things. Also, the Credit Bureau is reporting fraudulent accounts on my profile. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about who the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to15 USC 1681 1i5 they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate of unverifiable information ( A ) In general, if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

According to 15 USC 1681s-2, they are supposed not to furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
Exhibit XXXX - My company XXXX XXXX XXXX has a mortgage with Lendsure based on a Term Sheet dated XX/XX/XXXX. 

Exhibit XXXX - We secured the loan for {$650000.00} of which {$82000.00} was set aside as Construction Holdback. We paid points amounting to {$16000.00} for the full amount of the loan, reflected on the Settlement Statement Exhibit XXXX - We paid for a full year, interest only at a rate of 10.999 % Exhibit XXXX - We applied for a loan modification wherein the original note shall be extended for 6 months and a {$50000.00} additional amount will be added to the loan, bringing the outstanding loan to {$700000.00} due by XX/XX/XXXX. 

Exhibit XXXX - Lendsure sent a mortgage statement with a Draw XXXX from the Construction Holdback amounting to {$22000.00} as payment for the loan extension. 

Exhibit XXXX - We sent a request for a release of Construction funds by XXXX but Lendsure deducted XXXX payment from the Draw XXXX amounting to {$29000.00}. On an email by Lendsure, they explained that only {$59000.00} was approved as construction funds. 

Exhibit XXXX - A mortgage statement for XXXX shows the current interest rate of 10.999 % and monthly due as {$6100.00}. Our total Draw was {$22000.00} leaving {$59000.00} as available funds Exhibit XXXX - A mortgage statement for XXXX shows the current interest rate of 10.999 % and monthly due as {$6100.00}. The total Draw was {$52000.00} to include the XXXX rent and release of funds. We still have {$29000.00} as remaining holdback funds. 

This is where the problem arises. We wanted to use the remaining Holdback Funds of {$29000.00} as rent payment for the remaining month since we are selling the property. At the rate of 10.999 % and {$6100.00} per month, these funds are enough to cover payments until XXXX. 

Exhibit XXXX - A mortgage Statement for XXXX shows current rates at 10.999 % and the same monthly amount due. Total Holdback is still {$52000.00} Exhibit XXXX - A mortgage Statement for XXXX shows interest rate is 24 %, and Holdback funds totaling {$82000.00}. Our monthly amount due is now {$14000.00}. We did not receive any other notice for the default rate being applied. 

Exhibit XXXX - We sent an email to question the default rate application, and the holdback funds not being applied to cover XXXX thru XXXX payments, like they did last XXXX. 

Exhibit XXXX - Lendsure sent a Pay off amount, demanding total payment of {$740000.00} and showing a {$14000.00} since XXXX. They also charged me {$14000.00} from XXXX and XXXX using the unused Holdback Funds of {$29000.00} No other notices were sent to tell us of this rate adjustment. In fact, their mortgage statements from XXXX thru XXXX shows a rate of 10.999 % and only {$6100.00} per month. 

Exhibit XXXX - XXXX mortgage statement showing default rate Exhibit XXXX - We paid Lendsure a total amount of {$750000.00} to fully satisfy the loan. We should have only owed {$700000.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX, and should be charged only default rate of 24 % effective XXXX when the original note expired.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a copy of my credit report that your company publishes and after reviewing it I found a few items on the report that are inaccurate. The accounts in question are listed below XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Please send me copies of the documents that you have in your files as of this date that you used to verify the accuracy of the accounts listed below. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of this request concerning the accounts that you are reporting in my credit report. Please dont respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified. Send me copies of the documents that you have in your files that were used to verify them. 

If you do not have any documentation in your files to verify the accuracy of these disputed accounts then please delete them immediately as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ). By publishing these inaccurate and unverified items on my credit report and distributing them to 3rd parties you are damaging my reputation and credit worthiness. 

Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified accounts must be promptly deleted. Therefore, if you are unable to provide me with a copy of the verifiable proof that you have on file for each of the accounts listed below within 30 days of receipt of this letter then you must remove these accounts from my credit report.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> at approximately XXXXXXXX XXXX I attempted to make a purchase at a liquor store for my business, XXXX XXXX XXXX, located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The total amount of the purchase was {$1500.00}, and I was using my Bank of America virtual debit card, which had a balance of {$2000.00}.

During the transaction, Bank of America flagged the purchase as an unusual transaction and blocked my card. The purchase was declined multiple times. I immediately called Bank of America customer service and explained the situation. They assured me they had unlocked the card, but despite being told this repeatedly ( around 30 times ), the card remained locked. 

The customer service representative asked me multiple verification questions, all of which I answered correctly. However, they were unable to resolve the issue and claimed they did not know why the card could not be unlocked. This entire process took around 30 minutes.

I have a recorded phone message documenting this interaction, which clearly demonstrates Bank of Americas failure to unlock my card despite multiple assurances. 

Because of this failure to unlock my card, I was unable to complete the purchase, resulting in significant financial loss for my business. I could not restock liquor for the night, forcing me to close the bar early, which led to lost sales and dissatisfied customers.

This incident highlights Bank of Americas failure to provide reliable service, causing direct harm to my business operations.

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: These following accounts do not belong to me and reports were made already. My identity was stolen and I have tried several attempts to get these accounts removed as they do not belong to me. I have asked for proof that they belong to me and it was not given. I have attached an identity theft report with further details. The credit companies are also breaking several laws which I will include in here. Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, open date XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX. Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, open XX/XX/year>. These are XXXX of the same account that dont belong to me. I would like proof that these accounts belong to me from the company reporting them. Account XXXX XXXX, open XX/XX/year>. These accounts do not belong to me and was involved in my identity being stolen. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, also known as the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), consumers have the right to request validation of debts. This statute requires that debt collectors provide the debtor with certain information to validate the debt upon request. Specifically, the creditor must provide evidence that the debt is accurate and confirm that it is indeed associated with the consumer in question. If this information can not be provided, the items should be removed immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX FL XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter is regarding accounts XXXX  XXXX XXXX, which you claim I owe {$1400.00} as a duplicate collection. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which you claim I owe {$2800.00}, {$3200.00}, and {$5700.00} on XXXX different collection accounts. This is a formal notice that your claim is disputed. I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, along with the corresponding local state laws. Please note that I am requesting " validation '' ; that is, competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay you. Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ) from your company is a violation of the FCRA & FDCPA ; therefore, if you can not validate the debt, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry. Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take no action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports. 

Failure to respond within XXXX  days of receipt of this certified letter may result in small claims legal action against your company at my local venue. I would be seeking a minimum of {$1000.00} in damages per violation for : - Defamation- Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud- Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( including but not limited to Section 807-8 ) - Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( including but not limited to Section 623-b ) Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. My contact information is as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX FL XXXX Last XXXX of XXXX : XXXX P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney General 's Office CC : Better Business Bureau

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX  XXXX. Account # : XXXX Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

XXXX XXXX and Experian is showing a late payment for the month of XXXX in XXXX and XXXX is showing a late payment for the month of XX/XX/year>. How can this be? And if credit reporting for a Principal 's account must be 100 % accurate, fair, and complete, why is there an inaccuracy on the Principal 's credit report? The Principal is seeking new credit for personal, family, and household purposes and is being denied due to this error. I am seeking redress, to be compensated for damages in the amount of {$1000.00} for this error, and for the late payment information to be permanently deleted from the Principal 's file with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and for the tradeline information to be updated with the credit reporting agencies to show that the " account '' is " payed as agreed ''.

Subject : Illegal Credit Report Inquiry by XXXX XXXX XXXX  FCRA Violation Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX  XXXX XXXX  for unlawfully accessing my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ). Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, companies are required to have a permissible purposesuch as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer, a court order, or a business transaction that requires access to my credit informationto lawfully pull my credit report. I have no such relationship or outstanding debt with XXXX XXXX XXXX  that would justify this inquiry. 

This unauthorized credit pull has negatively affected my credit score and caused undue stress. As such, I am seeking the following : 1. Statutory Damages : Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( a ), I am requesting statutory damages in the amount of {$1000.00} for willful noncompliance with the FCRA.

2. Actual Damages : I have suffered harm, including emotional distress and potential damage to my credit standing, due to this unlawful inquiry. I reserve the right to seek actual damages in addition to statutory damages. 

Please investigate this violation of my consumer rights and take action against XXXX XXXX XXXX  to prevent future illegal activities. I also request that the unauthorized inquiry be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your timely response. 

Sincerely

Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.
