XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 
1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions. 
2. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act by Experian Dear Sir/Madam, I write to formally lodge a complaint against Experian concerning the erroneous and misleading reporting of an account linked to Police and Fire FCU ( Account Number : XXXX ) on my consumer credit report.

**Factual Background** : - Experian has persisted in representing this account as accurate, notwithstanding my successful dispute with XXXX, which culminated in the removal of said account from my credit profile.

**Legal Basis** : - Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i, consumer reporting agencies are mandated to expeditiously delete any disputed item that has been determined to be inaccurate or unverifiable. 
- The conflicting results from the same financial institution signify a potential failure in Experian 's compliance with the statutory obligations established under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), which necessitate that consumer reporting agencies uphold standards of accuracy and integrity in reporting. 

**Impact on Consumer Rights** : The ongoing reporting of this inaccurate account has inflicted significant harm upon my creditworthiness and overall financial well-being. Such conduct contravenes the principles enshrined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which underscores the necessity for fairness, impartiality, and consumer privacy. 

**Demand for Remedial Action** : I hereby demand the immediate expungement of this erroneous account from my Experian credit report. Enclosed, please find pertinent documentation from TransUnion that corroborates my assertions. 

I respectfully implore the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to undertake a comprehensive investigation into the practices of Experian in this matter. I anticipate your prompt and thorough response to address my concerns. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this pressing issue.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report.

Request I request an immediate investigation into the listed inquiries. Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I looked at my Experian credit report on XXXX XXXX XXXX and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally request an investigation into the procedures employed by the major credit reporting agenciesTransUnion, XXXX, and Experianregarding the accuracy of information reported on my credit file. I am concerned about certain inaccuracies that I have identified and the subsequent failure of these agencies to provide adequate responses and documentation, which I believe constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Background Recently, I submitted complaints to XXXX, XXXX, and Experian regarding incorrect information reported on my credit reports. Despite my efforts to address these inaccuracies, I have not received satisfactory responses or valid proof of the claims made by these agencies. Most importantly, I have repeatedly requested to review the " Procedures of Accuracy '' that these agencies claim to use to verify the information in my reports. Thus far, I have not received any meaningful information or documentation in response to my requests. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) The FCRA outlines specific responsibilities for credit reporting agencies, including the requirement to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Below are specific violations of the FCRA that I believe warrant your investigation : 1. Section 607 ( b ) - Reasonable Procedures : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. I have doubts that XXXX, XXXX, and Experian have adhered to this requirement in my case, as the inaccuracies I reported have not been corrected nor explained. 

2. Section 611 - Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy : Upon receiving my dispute, these agencies are mandated to conduct a reasonable investigation of my claims within 30 days. I submitted my dispute to all three agencies, but they have failed to provide the required investigation results or documentation supporting the accuracy of the reported information. Their lack of response is a clear violation of this section.

3. Failure to Validate Debts : When I identified the inaccuracies, I requested that the agencies provide validation of the debts and the procedures they used to verify the informations accuracy. Under the FCRA, they are obligated to provide this information and their failure to do so represents another violation of my consumer rights.

4. Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - Duty of Furnishers of Information : Any entity that provides information to consumer reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy of that information. If the information provided is found to be inaccurate, the furnishers have a duty to correct it. I am concerned that the agencies are not holding these furnishers accountable for the inaccurate reporting. 

XXXX. Lack of Adequate Consumer Responses : The agencies have not provided timely or useful responses to my inquiries, which I believe underlines a broader failure to protect consumer rights as mandated by the FCRA. 

Request for Action Given the collective issues I have faced, I respectfully ask the CFPB to conduct a thorough investigation into the practices of XXXX, XXXX, and Experian regarding how they handle inaccuracies and disputes. Furthermore, I urge your office to compel these agencies to provide their " Procedures of Accuracy '' and ensure they are compliant with the FCRA requirements. 

As a consumer, I have the right to accurate credit reporting, and the current situation jeopardizes my financial health and fundamental rights. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your timely response. 



I am writing to you to formally request a copy of the procedure your company followed in order to ensure that the information reporting for account XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX is completely accurate.It 's strange, you did a full investigation to verify the accuracy of this account due to the fact that you continue to report the wrong information. 

It is frightening to think that you did not do as you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act andthat other consumer might be affected Having this type of information on a person'sa credit report is unfortunate and severely damaging, but having incorrect damaging information ona person 's credit report is unacceptable. 

Please forward to me the name of the person you spoke with atINQUIRY, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, INQUIRY, INQUIRY, INQUIRY and the date that you spoke with them. I also want a confirmation of the address and phone number for the company. 

INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX As I have said, this account is incorrect and should be deleted entirely. Please send me anupdated credit report along with the investigation procedures. 

FYI, I DO NOT want a generalizedresponse stating what you typically do in an investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Immediate Blocking of Fraudulent Accounts Pursuant to FCRA XXXX XXXX Complaint Details : My name is XXXX XXXX, and I am submitting this complaint regarding fraudulent accounts that have appeared on my credit report due to identity theft. I request that these accounts be blocked under my rights outlined in Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ).

Details of the Issue : I am a victim of a data breach, which resulted in the theft of my Social Security number and other personal information. I became aware of this identity theft after being denied credit by my bank. The fraudulent accounts impacting my credit report are as follows : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts are not mine, and I have no connection to them. 

Actions Taken : I have submitted a formal dispute with Experian, including : A copy of my government-issued ID and Social Security card for verification.

A copy of my FTC Identity Theft Report.

A copy of my original dispute letter detailing the fraudulent accounts.

Legal Basis for Request : Under FCRA Section 605B, credit reporting agencies are required to block information resulting from identity theft within four business days of receiving the dispute and supporting documentation. Furthermore, 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ) mandates the exclusion of fraudulent information from my credit report and communication to furnishers of the fraudulent accounts regarding this action.

Contact Information : Please contact me at [ Your Contact Information ] for any follow-up. I expect prompt resolution as stipulated under the law. 

Supporting Documents : I have attached the following : Copy of my FTC Identity Theft Report Copy of my government-issued ID and Social Security XXXX XXXX dispute letter Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

They also told me that there was nothing else that can be done to safeguard my file during this process, which is disheartening to say the least.

Thursday, XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX SSN : XXXX | DOB XX/XX/XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), you are required by federal law to verify through the physical verification of the original signed consumer contract any and all accounts you post on a credit report. Otherwise, anyone paying for your reporting services could fax, mail or email in a fraudulent account. 

I demand to see Verifiable Proof ( an original Consumer Contract with my Signature on it ) you have on file of the accounts listed below. Your failure to positively verify these accounts has hurt my ability to obtain credit. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed and if you are unable to provide me a copy of verifiable proof, you must remove the accounts listed below. 

I demand the following accounts be verified or removed immediately : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX, XXXX. ) Account Number : XXXX Reason : I dont recognize this account Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Reason : Inaccurate Payment History Account Name : XXXX  XXXX XXXX Account Number  : XXXX Reason : Inaccurate Payment History Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Reason : Inaccurate Payment History Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Reason : Inaccurate Payment History Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Reason : I dont recognize this account By the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act of 1970 15 U.S.C 1681 et seq. I demand that these items be reinvestigated and deleted from my credit record. Please send me the names and addresses of the companies that you contacted so I may follow up.

Under the terms of the Section 168li of the Act, you have XXXX  days from receipt of this letter to verify that this disputed information. In the event you fail to verify this data, or fall to respond to this request altogether, the disputed data must be deleted in the entirety.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute several unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ).

I have previously submitted a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for this complaint is XXXX, filed on XX/XX/year>. 
After reviewing my recent credit report, I have identified the following inquiries that I do not recognize or authorize : Disputed Inquiry : Click or tap here to enter text.

1. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report. 
Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report. 
Request I request an immediate investigation into the listed inquiries. If it is determined that these inquiries were made without my authorization or in error, I ask that they be removed from my credit report. I also request that you provide me with an updated copy of my credit report once the necessary corrections have been made. 
Enclosed is a copy of my identification to verify my identity. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and keep me informed of the progress of your investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request to Block Fraudulent Information on Credit Report Pursuant to FCRA Section 605B and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ) Complainant : XXXX XXXX Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint to demand prompt action under Section XXXX of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ). Being a victim of identity theft due to a data breach, I am invoking my rights to have inaccurate information removed from my credit file.

Nature of the Issue : As a result of the data breach and subsequent misuse of my Social Security Number ( SSN ) and other sensitive details, I identified unauthorized accounts and transactions on my credit report. These fraudulent entries have harmed my credit profile, as demonstrated by a recent credit denial from my financial institution. 

The items I am disputing and requesting to be blocked are XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Supporting Documentation : I have included the following documentation to substantiate my dispute : A copy of my original dispute letter sent to XXXX, XXXX and Experian. 

A copy of my government-issued ID and Social Security XXXX for identity verification. 

A copy of my Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report. 

Legal Basis for the Request : Under FCRA Section 605B, credit reporting agencies must block the reporting of information linked to identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days after receiving the consumers dispute and accompanying evidence. Additionally, 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) requires these agencies to ensure such data is excluded from the consumers credit report and that furnishers of the fraudulent accounts are notified of the block.

If further information or action is needed from me to resolve this issue, please inform me right away. 

Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, Illinois, XXXX This letter is being sent to you in response to a recent charge of {$200.00} that was made on my credit report that I do not recognize. 
Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested.

This is NOT a request for " verification '' or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you.

At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the 3 major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character.

If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately.

Subject : Request to Block and Delete Accounts Due to Identity Theft Pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally notify you that I have become a victim of identity theft as a result of a recent data breachOF XXXX. In accordance with my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you block and permanently delete any fraudulent accounts, inquiries, or information associated with the identity theft from my credit report. 
I am also attaching proof that I was a victim of the XXXX XXXX breach, and I kindly request that this information be considered as part of my claim.

I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER:XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within FOUR business days.

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} I am also including an FTC Identity Theft Report with the reference number XXXX to further support my claim of identity theft. This report provides additional documentation of the fraudulent activity linked to the XXXX data breach. As mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, upon receiving this identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are required to block and delete any information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days. 
Please find enclosed the following documents to support my claim :. 
I request that you confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with a written statement once the accounts and information have been blocked and deleted, as required by law. Please ensure that I receive an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that you will act quickly to resolve this issue in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Please not that I have opted out in writing to your forced arbitration terms and am willing to seek legal relief.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
S

ECOND ATTEMPT, EXERCISING CONSUMER RIGHTS OF12 CFR 1006.34 - Notice for validation of debts. To whom it may concern : I am responding to the letter you sent dated about a debt you are trying to collect. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( g ). This claim is being disputed and a debt validation is requested. I also have reason to believe that you are in violation of 15 USC 1692e. False or misleading representations as defined ( 3 ) The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section.After the case with XXXX XXXX XXXX , the Consumer Federal Protection Bureaus ( CFPB ) took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX to their illegal debt collection and credit reporting practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect on disputed debts using unlawful collection letters and misrepresentation. The CFPB stated that XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debt that was NOT substantiated after consumers disputed the validity of the debt conducted an investigation and found that XXXX sent collection letters to consumers who DISPUTED the validity or accuracy of their purported debts, even though XXXX had NOT obtained substantiation for the debts. As a debt collection, the CFPB states you are required to have a reasonable basis for assertion that a consumer owes the purported debt if a dispute is submitted. As a result, the CFPB required XXXX XXXX XXXX to pay redress to affected consumer and pay a {$1.00} XXXX penalty to the CFPBs victim relief fund.

The CFPB outlined a list of requests we, as consumer, can ask for when we are seeking proper validation of debt to ensure you are ethically seeking debt legally. I have requested a proper validation of debt for the past 2-3 months YET you have not provided me with the substantiated information the CFPB outlines and you continue to have this alleged account reported on my consumer report? A PROPER validation of debt address EACH item of validation that I am requesting. You can find each request listed below.

The account in question is listed below : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - Under 15 US Code 1681n Civil Liability for willful noncompliance- Please remove this account. You are in direct violation of the FCRA for reporting this account on my credit profile without conduting a proper investigation. Per 15 US Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance, as a consumer I have sustained grave damages as a result of your negligence. As a result, I have grounds to sue you for these damages up to {$1000.00}.

Please provide me with a proper validation of debt. If you can not provide me with the documentations I am request, please request to have this account permanently remove from my credit report and the debt permanently discharge.

I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed.

Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Please provide verification by line item ( with explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the alleged items was, were the goods/services received, what were the goods/services received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor.

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from.

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay?

If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay.

The obligation between you and I that allows you to collect on the alleged debt and any transactions between your company that binds me to an agreement to pay your company any money that you claim I owe.

Proof of photo identification ( i.e., drivers license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) that was presented to you at the time of incurring this alleged debt.

Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Please show me proof that this debt was actually sold to you. ) The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor.

State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was.

If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law.

If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated.

In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law.

Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent.

Identify the date of the last payment made on this account.

Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt.

I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state?

If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license.

( Enclosed is a copy of the list of your licenses. I found this document on the XXXX database. I dont see FLORIDAon this list. How are you legally attempting to collect this alleged debt, in a state that youre not licensed in, that you havent properly validated after numerous request- yet still reporting to the credit bureaus which further affects my credit profile and credit score? This sounds to me like Aggravated Identity Theft, per 18 US Code 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft ) If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license.

I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In hindsight, your agency willing took on this debt willingly that you have not properly validated with me as a LAW ABIDING consumer. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. If a proper validation is not provided, you can not recover this debt to try and collect from me per volenti no fit injuria.

PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT.

PLEASE PROVIDE ME WITH PROPER DEBT VALIDATION BASED ON MY REQUESTS IN THE COMPLAINT ABOVE. I AM ASKING FOR A WET SIGNATURE BINDING MYSELF AND YOUR BUSINESS AS WELL AS A CONTRACT THAT I SIGNED AGREEING TO ANY TERMS AND CONDITIONS YOUR COMPANY HAS SET. IF YOU CAN NOT PROVIDE THIS INFORMATION, PLEASE REMOVE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORT. PLEASE NOTE THAT I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER AND AS A LAW ABIDING CITIZEN I WILL EXERCISE THAT RIGHT. THANK YOU FOR UNDERSTANDING.

PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER.

IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute several unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ).

I have previously submitted a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for this complaint is XXXX, filed on XX/XX/year>. 
After reviewing my recent credit report, I have identified the following inquiries that I do not recognize or authorize : Disputed Inquiry : Click or tap here to enter text. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX : XX/XX/year> Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report.

Request I request an immediate investigation into the listed inquiries. If it is determined that these inquiries were made without my authorization or in error, I ask that they be removed from my credit report. I also request that you provide me with an updated copy of my credit report once the necessary corrections have been made.

Enclosed is a copy of my identification to verify my identity. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and keep me informed of the progress of your investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

I have attached a copy of the police report in this regard. 

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) this creditor has violated my rights under 15 USC 1681 section 602 states : I have the right to privacy.

15 USC 1681 section 604 a section 2 also states : a consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without my written instructions.

Under 15 USCS 1666b : a creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose. No information was mailed to me at all and specifically no information was mailed to me within 21 days. 

The reporting of these late payments are not only a violation of various federal protection laws but they also have severely abused and harmed my reputation and ability to obtain credit from various lenders which has caused me to injury in various ways. 

Please remove this account from all of my reports. I have written to all XXXX credit reporting agencies multiple times stating that I do not recognize how the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  account is reporting on my credit reports, I do not recognize the account number, the account status, the account high balance, nor do I recognize the late payments associated with it, everything reported here does not meet the FCRA. Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am filing a formal complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of an account on my credit report, which I am requesting be removed entirely. The account in question is a XXXX  account, where I was listed as an authorized user. Below are the account details : Account Name XXXX XXXX  Account Number : [ If available, you can include the last XXXX digits of the account number here ] Reported Balance : {$5200.00} Last Reported Date : XX/XX/XXXX Credit Limit : {$2100.00} Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Account Closed : XX/XX/XXXX The issue at hand is that this account was reported as closed with a balance of {$5200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, despite my role as an authorized user and not the primary account holder. Furthermore, the dispute resolved status showing " subscriber disagrees '' is entirely inaccurate. As an authorized user, I do not hold responsibility for the balance, and the statement is misleading. 

I request the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. The account has been inaccurately reported, and its inclusion is harmful to my XXXX XXXX and financial well-being. 

Legal Basis for Request : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section XXXX ( a ), furnishers of credit information are required to provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. The current reporting of this account violates the FCRA in the following ways : Inaccurate Reporting : The account was reported as a closed account with an outstanding balance. As an authorized user, I have no legal responsibility for the balance, and this should be reflected in the reporting. 

Dispute Status : The " subscriber disagrees '' status is inaccurate and misleading. This indicates a dispute that I did not initiate or resolve, which is a violation of the FCRA 's requirement for accurate information. 

Failure to Correct Information : The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies and furnishers correct any inaccuracies in a timely manner. The failure to accurately report the account as authorized user status rather than primary account holder is a violation of this obligation. 

Due to these violations, I am requesting that this entire account be removed from my credit report. The incorrect reporting of this account has caused significant harm to my credit and financial standing. 

Potential Legal Action : Should this matter not be resolved in a timely manner, I will consider pursuing legal action for damages under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as I have suffered harm due to inaccurate reporting. Under the FCRA, I am entitled to seek compensatory damages, including actual damages, statutory damages, and punitive damages for the failure to accurately report my credit information. 

I will also explore the option of engaging an attorney who specializes in consumer protection law and credit reporting disputes. A law firm such as The Law Offices of XXXX XXXX XXXX, which specializes in credit report disputes, FCRA violations, and consumer protection, can assist with this matter and pursue appropriate legal remedies if necessary.

I am listing accounts and inquiries below that have been reported inaccurately on my credit report. In compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act and as a gesture of respect to the Federal Trade Commission Committee on accuracy and completeness of credit information I am formally writing in today to dispute negative information appearing on my credit. Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX says the balance on the vehicle loan is {$13000.00} however to replace the transmission on my own would have cost me over {$4000.00} and I don't have that kind of money and is unable to keep up. I asked what else could be done since I could no longer drive the car since the transmission went out and I could no longer keep up with the payments due to financial hardship. XXXX said there was nothing they could do and allowed the car to sit outside of my house for 3 months on purpose so they can put it on my credit as a repossession and put a negative impact on my credit report. After going back and forth with XXXX I asked for my 1099-C to show the debt has been cancelled on their end and they wrote it off as income. When I finally received the 1099-C it does not have my correct address on it. I called XXXX to get answers they told me that I can put the 1099-C on my taxes however they did not mail me a new 1099-C with my correct address which would cause issues. XXXX told me I still owed the debt and the 1099-C form really doesn't mean anything anymore and it can not be used to remove the negative mark on my credit report and the 1099-C is only for my records. I have never lived at the address listed on the 1099-C. The date of identifiable event on the 1099-C is incorrect ; XXXX has XXXX as XX/XX/XXXX however they came and got the none working vehicle in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is identifiable event code ( G ) meaning XXXX made the decision to discontinue collection to pursue payment. XXXX never changed the address on the 1099-C because I never received an updated one which causes a discrepancy with the credit bureaus when I submitted the 1099-C to Experian, XXXX, and XXXX and filed disputes XXXX all three credit bureaus told me they spoke to XXXX and XXXX told them not to remove the negative mark and all the information on the 1099-C is accurate and that is not correct. I just checked my credit reports and all three credit bureaus have the XXXX negative mark to fall off XXXX of XXXX and it says Paid Off. Which means they came and got the vehicle in XXXX ; because XXXX will be 7 years and by law the credit bureaus have to remove it from my credit report. FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information.

in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4.

business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer.

( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report.

( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( 1 ) that the information may be a result of identity theft.

( 2 ) that an identity theft report has been filed.

( 3 ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( 4 ) of the effective dates of the block.

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind.

( 1 ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions.

( 2 ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer.

shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i.

( a ) ( 5 ) ( B ) of this title.

( 3 ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew.

or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block.

( d ) Exception for resellers.

( 1 ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller.

( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft.

( 2 ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information.

( 3 ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( 2 ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting.

agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale.

( e ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negatable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning 4 business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( 1 ) through ( 3 ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section.

1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft.

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding the inaccuracies in the reporting of my account by Experian. The inaccuracy constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as articulated in 15 U.S. Code 1681e, which mandates consumer reporting agencies to maintain the maximum possible accuracy of the information they disseminate.

The current reporting of my account is erroneous and necessitates immediate CORRECTION. Specifically, it must be UPDATED IN COMPLIANCE WITH 26 CFR 1.6050P-1, which governs information reporting for discharges of indebtedness by specified entities. I have fully settled the account in question, AS PER THE CREDITORS POLICIES. I have submitted Form 1099-C for YOUR REVIEW AS PHYSICAL PROOF, which clearly indicates THE PREVIOUS BALANCE AS DISCHARGED AND REFLECTS a NEW balance of {$0.00}. Therefore, I formally demand that all three consumer reporting agencies rectify my account to accurately reflect its status as paid in full with a XXXX balance. 

The misleading nature of the current reporting not only contravenes applicable IRS regulations but also jeopardizes my creditworthiness and financial standing. Should this matter not be resolved expeditiously, I will have no choice but to explore legal remedies available to me under the FCRA, including the possibility of pursuing a lawsuit for damages resulting from this inaccurate reporting. 

I urge you to prioritize the correction of the account to reflect its accurate status as paid in full. I expect a prompt response and resolution regarding this matter. 

Thank you for your immediate attention to this critical issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I received a physical piece of mail from Experian, indicating that I had submitted a credit dispute and that the results were approved. The results of this credit dispute were apparently updating my telephone number. The telephone number that was listed on my new credit report and account with experience was not my cell phone number, I called Experian to indicate that I had received this dispute and that the dispute was incorrect and someone likely has hacked my account with experience and is trying to change the cell phone number. They indicated I should go online and log into my account change my account information and save it. I did all of this, XXXX days later on XX/XX/year> I received an automated email from Experian saying that my account information was updated. I tried to log into Experian to see what was changed with my Experian account and was unable to log into my account because someone had hacked my account and changed my phone number associated with my Experian account. Since my phone number associated to my experience account was updated to a number that was not my cell phone number, I was unable to access my account which has multifactor authentication set up with an SMS text to verify before allowing someone to log into my account. At this point I had no way to access my Experian account because someone had hacked my experience account. Over the course of the next few days, I started to receive calls from various credit unions around the country asking me if I was in fact trying to open up a line of credit with their agencies. In each case I indicated no, and that I believed my account had been hacked. I tried calling Experian using the phone numbers they provide on their website and and all I can say about trying to get someone on the phone through their phone is it was, and continues to be, the single worst customer experience I have ever had in my entire adult life. It took numerous attempts and a combination of random buzz words for me to finally get through to someone at Experian when I explain the situation that I had received a dispute from them, which I did not file, that my account had been hacked, and I was currently having someone using my credit information that they stole from the Experian site to contact various credit unions trying to open up an account in my name, and that this all resulted from somebody hacking my experience account. They said all they could do was put a credit freeze on my account and put a credit fraud alert on my account, there was nothing the representatives could do to fix my account. After a few days I received an email for my support call asking if I was satisfied with the service they provided. I of course replied no and gave them a low rating for the customer satisfaction score. Days later, I again called Experian and was told that I needed to talk to a different department, the member services department, because the issue was with my account and not with my credit report. When I spoke to somebody in the member services department, again took 20 to 30 minutes of trying to navigate their phone tree, which no way shape or form made it easy or possible to speak to somebody about my current issue, I was told that the only way that they could unlock my account was by providing them with certain information : a copy my Social Security card, a copy of my drivers license, and a copy of a current bill with my current address on it. I started searching online to see if anybody else has had this issue with Experian and found numerous online threads with people that had experienced the same problem with Experian 's security settings on their accounts. Most of the post indicated that after calling back multiple times, they were finally able to talk to somebody that would reset their account over the phone so they could access it and change their information to avoid the hackers from having access to their experience account. Again, I tried calling them and pleading with them and continuing to provide all the details of what happened : timelines and specific details of what was happening on my account, they again said theres nothing they can do unless I either mail, fax, or upload those three documents their team for review. I first attempted to upload the documents through their web portal. Each time I uploaded the documents their web portal indicated that the format of the documents was not correct and that I should try different file type or size. I communicated over email with Experian telling them that I could not upload the documents to the web portal they provided because it was continuously getting rejected. They also provided me with guidance on different file types or file sizes to use to upload the documents, I tried every combination of file size and file type that they provided. None of these worked. The support claim I had open indicated that I could also physically mail these documents or fax these documents. I mailed and faxed these documents to the team on XX/XX/year>. I did get a tracking number or anything for me to confirm that they received the documents, but I did get a confirmation from the fax machine that it was received to the number they provided. Since XX/XX/year>, I have followed up weekly on my claim via email asking if theyve received these documents. Every time I get the same response, we havent received them yet or we dont know if we received them yet and they might be in processing. At this point its been over a month since I first noticed fraudulent activity on my experience account, they have done nothing to try to make this process easy or to try to resolve my issues over the phone. Despite the fact I can provide them with any piece of information they need to verify my identity, and I have to imagine with their online system they have logs to indicate what the previous phone number and email address were on my account and what the updated phone number and email addresses are on my account now. Im incredibly frustrated that their security protocols allowed a hacker to access my Experian account to have access to all of my credit information, and the hacker made numerous attempts to open lines of credit in my name. Yet they are unwilling to do anything to assist me other than continuing to push me to upload documents ( which doesnt work ), fax documents ( which I already did ), or mail documents ( which I already did ). I am beyond frustrated with lack of Customer Service and the lack of urgency on their behalf of trying to fix a clear security vulnerability with their system that is currently impacting my account and my credit.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Sub-issue: Credit card company won't increase or decrease your credit limit
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am reporting Capital One employees for using age discrimination to deny me an increase of credit. Age discrimination refers to the unfair treatment of an individual based on their age, particularly in employment contexts. The Age Discrimination in Employment Act ( ADEA ) of 1967 is the primary federal law that prohibits this type of discrimination against individuals who are 40 years of age or older. The ADEA protects these individuals from being treated less favorably in various aspects of employment, including hiring, firing, promotions, job assignments, compensation, and benefits.

The Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) explicitly prohibits discrimination in credit transactions based on various factors, one of which is age. This means that lenders can not refuse to extend credit or impose different terms on applicants solely because of their age, provided they have the capacity to contract. The ECOA aims to ensure that all individuals, regardless of age, have equal access to credit opportunities.

This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the information being reported about my Bank of America account ending in XXXX, including the alleged amount of XXXX, as permitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
This account is inaccurate and associated with identity theft. Specifically : 1. False credit disputes beginning in XX/XX/XXXX have been made in connection with this account, apparently to manipulate the alleged, unverified alleged debt back onto the associated checking account for financial gain. 
2. The alleged debt is unknown as to how it occurred, and still unverified at this time of writing. 
3. On my XXXX credit report, the account contains a " Resolved '' Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) dispute notation, despite me never filing a dispute under FCBA.

4. On my XXXX credit report, a " Consumer disputes after resolution '' comment has been added, even though no true resolution was reached, as the fake disputes were never adequately investigated by Bank of America despite my multiple written requests.

5. The account is not notated as being in litigation across XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX, which it currently is. 
Bank of America has not acknowledged suspicious activity related to this account that I did not initiate nor did XXXX and XXXX XXXX. their attorneys. Despite this, my attempts to address these issues directly with Bank of America and their legal representatives, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, have resulted in repeated delays and insufficient action. XXXX and XXXX have agreed to pause legal proceedings pending further investigation, but the negative impact on my credit continues. I have also called XXXX times requesting the last contract on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, I had under this account. This of which still has not been sent to me, and with the first XXXX requests being past 30 days of not receiving. Also, in the first CFPB complaint I did - XXXX in XXXX the accurate reporting letter sent to me was in error as I never did this dispute on the alleged balance, nor this account directly to Bank of America , nor have I did a dispute on the alleged balance, and account in XX/XX/XXXX to return all alleged charges to the associated checking account. Twice this year, I have requested a sworn affidavit or declaration in regards to the account both in XX/XX/XXXX via USPS, with tracking numbers to both Bank of America - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and, XX/XX/XXXX to Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Both of which past 30 days to date in both requests from both companies after being shirked in regards to the identity theft. 
I have enclosed the following documents to substantiate my claims : 1. FTC Identity Theft Report.

2. Police Report and associated case number provided by Bank of America that is : XXXX. 
3. Illinois Attorney General Identity Theft Affidavit.

4. Correspondence between myself, Bank of America, and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. 
5. The final checking account statement from Bank of America, the last XXXX card statement ( ending in XXXX ), and Bank of America notices showing fraudulent disputes on the account.

6. XXXX dispute information, along with XXXX and XXXX credit reports showing the aforementioned inaccuracies. 
7. A response from the Illinois Attorney General regarding this matter to XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. 
This situation of identity theft has caused significant harm to my reputation and credit health. The failure to investigate and resolve these inaccuracies constitutes negligence under the FCRA. 
I request the following actions from your agency : 1. Remove the Resolved FCBA notation and the Consumer disputes after resolution comment from my credit reports, as they are inaccurate and misleading.

2. Update the reports to reflect that I am actively disputing this account on this date of receipt, with supporting documentation provided.

3. Add a notation that this account is associated with identity theft.

4. Add a notation indicating that this account is currently in litigation.

5. The last contract I had with Bank of America as I still have not received it yet.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Since XX/XX/year>, I have had multiple promotional balances on my CareCredit account, each with deferred interest terms and varying expiration dates. My goal has always been to pay off these balances in the order of their expiration dates to avoid deferred interest charges. To achieve this, I set up automatic payments of {$140.00} per month and later increased my payments significantly, with a payment of {$770.00} in XX/XX/year> and {$570.00} in XX/XX/year>. Despite this, CareCredit allocated my payments proportionally across all promotional balances, rather than prioritizing the earliest expiring balances. 

For example : - XX/XX/year> XXXX of {$770.00} : Under CareCredits allocation method, this payment was split across multiple balances, leaving {$410.00} unpaid on the balance expiring XX/XX/year>. Had this payment been applied in full to the earliest expiring balance, it could have been completely paid off, ensuring I avoided deferred interest charges on that balance. 

- XX/XX/year> Payment of {$570.00} : This payment was also divided proportionally. By this point, the XX/XX/year> balance was finally cleared, but only after multiple months of missed opportunities to fully pay it off earlier. 
CareCredits proportional allocation method has left me at risk of deferred interest charges, even though I made sufficient payments to cover the earliest expiring balances. Furthermore, their statements lack transparency, as they do not clearly show how payments are applied to individual balances, making it difficult for me to verify whether payments are being applied effectively. 

When I contacted CareCredit to request that my payments be allocated to the earliest expiring balances, I was told this was not possible unless I manually requested reallocation after each payment had posted. This process is burdensome and impractical, as payments take 3-5 business days to post, and reallocating payments requires contacting customer service each month. As a busy individual relying on automatic payments, I believe this process is intentionally designed to make avoiding deferred interest charges unnecessarily difficult. 

I have attached statements from XX/XX/year> through XX/XX/year> to provide evidence of my payment history, how payments were allocated, and the lack of transparency in CareCredits monthly statements. These statements highlight the issues Ive described and support my request for a resolution.

XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, This letter is being sent to you in response to a recent charge of {$840.00} that was made on my credit report that I do not recognize. 
Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g stating your claim is disputed and validation is requested.

This is NOT a request for " verification '' or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. 
At this time, I will also inform you that if your offices have reported invalidated information to any of the XXXX major credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX or XXXX ) this action may constitute fraud under both Federal and State Laws. Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of any information to a credit reporting repository that could be inaccurate or If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 30 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my credit file and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 
1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions. 
2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX did not issue a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations XXXX to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading. Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting. 
3. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 
I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1. The absence of a 1099-C form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt.

2. The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

3. The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXX of Events : XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * XXXX XXXX stated they had requested updates to the CRAs for the following information : date of last activity, last payment date, and payment history. However, these updates were either not made or remain inaccurate. Despite providing extensive supporting documentation, including a copy of my drivers license, Social Security card, and highlighted credit reports detailing the errors, XXXX XXXX falsely claimed that my correspondence " does not provide sufficient information to investigate your dispute. '' XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * A dispute letter was sent and received by XXXX XXXX, signed by XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). No substantive action was taken to resolve the inaccuracies.

XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * A pre-arbitration notice was sent, reiterating the ongoing inaccuracies, breach of contract, and adverse actions. XXXX XXXX received this notice on XX/XX/XXXX, signed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
Violations : XXXX. Inaccurate Reporting to CRAs : * XXXX XXXX continues to furnish inaccurate information to the CRAs, including incorrect dates of last activity, payment history, and other key account details. This is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
XXXX. Failure to Investigate Disputes : * Despite receiving all necessary documentation to locate and verify my account, XXXX XXXX falsely claimed insufficient information to investigate my disputes. This constitutes willful noncompliance with the FCRA ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
XXXX. Breach of XXXX : * XXXX XXXX breached its agreement by initiating legal action against me before compelling arbitration, as stipulated in our agreement. This breach has caused defamation of character, harassment, and adverse actions. 
XXXX. Adverse Actions : * XXXX XXXX actions have caused adverse effects, including defamation of character, financial harm, and emotional distress.

To Whom It May Concern : I am sending this letter to you in response to a collection notice I received from you on XX/XX/year>. 

Please be advised that this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 US Code 1692g that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you regarding the following account number ( s ) : WAKEFIELD & ASSOCIATES Account Number : XXXX Please provide me with the following : Agreement with the original creditor that authorizes you to collect on this alleged debt and/or verification that this alleged debt was assigned or sold to you. 
The agreement bearing my signature stating that I have agreed to assume the debt Valid copies of the debt agreement stating the amount of the debt and interest charges Proof that the Statute of Limitations in Tennessee has not expired Complete payment history on this account along with an accounting of all additional charges being assessed Proof that you are licensed to collect in my state ; and Your license numbers and Registered Agent or Agent of Service. 
This will also serve as your legal notice under the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), to cease all communication with me concerning the alleged debt referenced above. Do not contact me, members of my family, employers, or any other third parties regarding this debt. 

This includes all communication by telephone or electronic communications, such as email or texts made by your company, representatives, or agents. If your offices, representatives, or agents attempt communication with me, members of my family, employers, or any other third parties, it will be considered harassment and I will bring this matter before a judge. 

All future communications with me MUST be done in writing via USPS and sent to the address noted in this letter. 

Your non-compliance with my request will also be construed as an absolute waiver of all claims to enforce the debt against me and your implied agreement to compensate me for court costs and attorney fees if I am forced to bring this matter before a judge. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
