Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I looked at my Experian credit report on XX/XX/year>2024 and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding a debt reported on my credit report by Midland Credit Management. The debt, which originated with XXXXXXXX XXXX, has been placed in collections, and I have made multiple attempts to verify the accuracy and legitimacy of this debt. Despite my formal requests to the debt collection agency, they have failed to provide sufficient documentation or evidence to support their claim, violating my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Specific Issues Include : Failure to Provide Documentation of Authorization or Agreement I have requested documentation proving my authorization for this debt, such as a signed agreement or contract, but the collection agency has not supplied this information. 
Lack of Proof of Ownership or Right to Collect I requested proof that Midland Credit Management has the legal right to collect this debt, including the agreement or assignment from the original creditor ( XXXXXXXX XXXX ), but no such evidence has been provided. 
Failure to Validate Key Account Information Despite my requests, the collection agency has not provided critical details, such as : The date of first delinquency. 
The date of last payment. 
The date the account was charged off by the original creditor. 
Potential Inaccurate Reporting to Credit Bureaus Without adequate validation, I am concerned that the debt may have been reported inaccurately to the credit bureaus, negatively affecting my credit score and financial standing. 
Requested Resolution : I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter to ensure Midland Credit Management complies with federal debt collection and reporting laws. 
I ask that the collection agency be required to provide all requested documentation proving the validity of this debt, their right to collect it, and its accurate reporting. 
If they can not provide such evidence, I request that the debt be removed from my credit report and that all collection activity be ceased immediately. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to the resolution of this issue in accordance with my consumer rights.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America offered a settlement agreement to resolve my account for less than the full balance. The agreed-upon settlement amount was {$3500.00}, to be paid in three installments : {$1100.00} on XX/XX/XXXX {$1100.00} on XX/XX/XXXX {$1100.00} on XX/XX/XXXX This settlement offer was clearly discussed, and I began fulfilling my part of the agreement by preparing for the first payment. However, despite repeated requests, Bank of America has refused to provide this settlement agreement in writing. Additionally, I was charged a late fee, even though my understanding was that this account was covered under the agreed-upon settlement terms. 

Issues : Bank of America has failed to provide written confirmation of the settlement terms despite my repeated requests. 
A late fee was unfairly applied to my account after the settlement was offered. 
This behavior is misleading and creates unnecessary confusion for consumers attempting to resolve their accounts in good faith. It has caused me stress and financial uncertainty, as I am unsure whether my payments will be applied correctly or whether the terms of the agreement will be honored.

Resolution Sought : I request that Bank of America immediately provide a written confirmation of the settlement agreement terms as outlined above. 
I request the removal of the late fee and any associated penalties applied after the settlement agreement was made. 
I ask that Bank of America honor the settlement agreement and apply all payments made accordingly. 
I believe this issue violates fair consumer practices and request the CFPB 's assistance in resolving this matter promptly.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX Subject : Formal Complaint Against Capital One Charge-Off and Non-Issuance of 1099-C To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Capital One regarding a charged-off account reported on my credit file. I have repeatedly contacted Capital One to request the issuance of a Form 1099-C, as required under the Internal Revenue Code, but have not received any resolution despite multiple attempts over an extended period. 

Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Fair Credit Reporting Act ), consumers are entitled to accurate and fair reporting of credit information. Furthermore, under IRS guidelines, when a debt is charged off, the creditor is typically required to issue a Form 1099-C if the debt meets specific thresholds for cancellation. This failure to provide a Form 1099-C has caused considerable personal and financial stress, as I need this documentation for my tax filings. 

Additionally, I have observed that Capital One continues to report late payments on this charged-off account each month. Once an account is charged off, the addition of late payments contradicts accurate reporting practices and unfairly penalizes my credit standing, further exacerbating my difficulties. 

This unresolved issue has had a profound and stressful impact on my life, preventing me from moving forward with purchasing my first home for my family. I request the CFPBs assistance in ensuring Capital One complies with its legal obligations by : 1. Issuing the Form 1099-C for the charged-off debt.

2. Ensuring the account is accurately reported on my credit file without further monthly late payment notations. 



I respectfully request a resolution to this matter within 15 days from the date of this letter. Please let me know if further information is required to expedite this process. 

Thank you for your assistance in this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 
1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions. 
2. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate NAVY FEDERAL CREDIT UNION practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Shellpoint/New Rez Mortgage began foreclosure proceedings on my property As a result I was assessed legal fees totaling {$4300.00}. I have attempted, unsuccessfully on numerous occasions to obtain proof of non payment. This is because I have a {$0.00} cent balance on the principal. Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue while managing or servicing your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
Upon speaking with the Vermont Attorney Generals Office, I was advised to contact you to submit this formal complaint to bring to your attention the inhumane and unfair practices of Wells Fargo Mortgage Service, which have caused significant distress and hardship following my husbands passing. 

My husband and I have held several mortgages with Wells Fargo in the past. Our most recent mortgage was taken out in XX/XX/year>. At that time, we were advised by the institution not to include my name on the mortgage note, as I was not working. Trusting their guidance, we proceeded. However, our attorney at the XX/XX/year> closing expressed concern about this arrangement, particularly regarding potential issues if anything were to happen to my husband. At his insistence, I signed the mortgage during the closing, and my name is also on the deed. We believed this resolved any concerns. 
For nine years, we paid the mortgage without issue. After my husbands passing, I continued to make payments via the online account. However, in XXXX, after paying the XXXX installment, I called Wells Fargo to ask a question and mentioned my husbands passing. I was transferred to the " Life Events '' department and informed that I no longer had access to the account. 
This marked the beginning of an ongoing nightmare : 1. Locked Out of Online Access : Despite my continued payments, my online access was revoked, and I was directed to call the Life Events department. They promised to send information on my options, but this was either not sent or sent to an outdated address, despite my efforts to correct my contact information. 

2. Insensitivity and Miscommunication : Representatives repeatedly called my late husbands phone, leaving messages for him. When I expressed frustration, I was treated with a lack of empathy, accused ( in a loud and harsh tone ) of using my deceased husband to access his account, and subjected to condescending remarks.

3. Unreasonable Fees for Mortgage Assumption : The initial several phone calls led me to believe that assuming the mortgage would simply require me to qualify and assume the same rate. It wasnt until much later that I was informed that I could assume the mortgage for a nominal fee. After being very evasive and hearing multiple stories, this turned out to be over {$11000.00}. I was also offered the option to refinance at a significantly higher interest rate, which I declined as it was financially unreasonable.

4. Inaccessibility of Payment Options : Without online access, I was told to pay in person at the nearest Wells Fargo branchover three hours awayor mail payments, which my attorney strongly advised against due to concerns about check fraud. On multiple occasions, I drove over six hours round trip to make payments in person, only to encounter errors in how the payments were applied. XXXX payment is already wrong, and funds have repeatedly been misapplied to different months and the principal. Without access to an online account, it is impossible to keep track of the payments and confirm they have applied they have been applied correctly. 

5. Rude and Unhelpful Customer Service : A bank rep asked me on the phone whether or not I could even pay the mortgage in a condescending tone and told me to just pay it off at once, which is not her place. During one visit, a representative assured me the payment was correctly applied but later admitted it was not, requiring a case to be opened. The lack of attention to detail and accountability has been deeply frustrating and time-consuming.

The treatment I have received as a grieving widow and senior citizen is unacceptable.

The death of a spouse is one of the most difficult life events, and Wells Fargo has compounded my distress through mismanagement, lack of transparency, and disrespect.

Additionally, I am concerned about possible fraudulent practices. Our copy of the mortgage documentation indicates that I signed the mortgage ( see the provided XXXX  - XXXX ), but Wells Fargo appears to have obscured this information. This raises serious questions about their integrity and compliance. 

Attached to this complaint, you will find documentation supporting my claims, including evidence of my signature on the mortgage, records of my payments, a copy of a check I made for a second down payment on the home, and correspondence with Wells Fargo representatives. 

Vermont is a right-of-survivorship state so long as the couple is married and residing together in the home at the time of death, which was the case with my husband and me at his time of death. 

I am simply asking for reasonable and consistent access to make payments on my mortgage without the undue burden of excessive fees or unnecessary travel. Wells Fargos conduct has caused me significant emotional stress, and I urge the CFPB to investigate these practices. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Product: Debt collection
Debt collection
Sub-issue: You told them to stop contacting you, but they keep trying
Consumer complaint narrative:
Cease and Desist Letter From : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX Subject : Cease and Desist for Violations of FDCPA and Demand for Deletion of Inaccurate Reporting Dear XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX This letter serves as a formal notice to cease and desist from further violations of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and to address your continued unlawful actions concerning the alleged debt you purchased from Capital One National Association . 

Details of the Alleged Debt : Original Creditor : Capital One National Association Amount Alleged : {$800.00} Account Number : [ Provide account number if applicable ] Violations : Harassment and Violation of FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692d ) : Your repeated reinsertion of this alleged debt into my consumer credit reports, despite prior disputes and removals, constitutes harassment under 15 USC 1692d. Your actions are abusive, causing me significant emotional distress and financial harm.

Failure to Adhere to the Arbitration Clause : By purchasing this debt, you are now bound by the original Capital One credit card agreement, which includes a binding arbitration clause. Your failure to honor this agreement is a breach of contract and a clear disregard for the terms governing this account. 

Furnishing Inaccurate Information in Violation of the FCRA : Despite your claims, the information you are furnishing to the credit reporting agencies remains inaccurate, misleading, and damaging. On XX/XX/XXXX, you stated that you asked the CRAs to update information, yet the inaccuracies persist, causing significant harm to my reputation and financial standing. 

Harm Caused : Your actions have resulted in : Defamation of Character : Inaccurate reporting has negatively impacted my reputation. 

Emotional Distress : Your continuous violations have caused anxiety and undue stress. 

Financial Harm : Inaccurate reporting and harassment have adversely affected my ability to secure credit and financial opportunities. 

Legal Basis : Your actions violate the following : FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692d ) : Prohibits harassment and abuse in debt collection.

FCRA ( 15 USC 1681 ) : Requires accurate and fair reporting of consumer credit information.

Breach of Contract : By failing to adhere to the arbitration clause of the Capital One credit card agreement. 

Case law such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) confirms that debt collectors are held to strict compliance with FDCPA requirements, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) underscores the harm caused by inaccurate reporting under the FCRA. 

Demand : To resolve this matter, you must : Immediately Cease and Desist : Stop all collection activities, including reporting this account to consumer reporting agencies. 

Delete the Trade Line : Remove this account from all credit reporting agencies and confirm permanent deletion. 

Acknowledge Breach of Contract : Confirm in writing that you will adhere to the arbitration clause moving forward. 

Compensation : Pay {$10000.00} for the defamation, emotional distress, and financial harm your actions have caused. 

This demand must be fulfilled within XXXX  days of the date of this letter. Failure to comply will result in arbitration proceedings under the terms of the Capital One credit card agreement. Please note that initiating arbitration will incur substantial costs for your company, including over {$3000.00} in filing fees, legal expenses, and potential damages. 

Next Steps : You may contact me in writing at the address listed above or via email at XXXX to confirm your compliance. This letter serves as notice of my intent to protect my rights and pursue legal remedies as necessary. 

This communication is sent in good faith and without waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses available to me under applicable law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Account # : XXXX Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX and Equifax are reporting inaccurate information on my credit report. And continue to violate 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION. This erroneous information is ruining my credibility, and I would like it removed entirely from my credit report. List of inaccurate information : the reporting of XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX is inaccurate and must be deleted as INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes the reporting of these accounts Inaccurate. Once again, 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting Information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency If the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the data is inaccurate. Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility. Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by the IRS. Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report the canceled debt as gross Income on your tax return. The IRS Clearly defines a charge-off as Gross or Ordinary Income. INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes your reporting of this account Inaccurate. Both XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX are inaccurate and must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative: XX/XX/XXXX, I received a text message from my phone carrier saying my autopay didnt go through. my bill is due on the XXXX so thought it was slightly odd but it was directly from my cell phone carrier ( XXXX  ). i clicked the link and paid my bill manually. 10 minutes later received another message from my cell phone carrier saying my sim card was inserted into a new device. I tried to call XXXX  but it was immediately disconnected. so i drove to the nearest XXXX  store and got a new sim card. at this point someone was making modifications to my cell phone account without my knowledge since i logged in to pay my bill. XXXX  store gave me a new sim card, once the new sim card was inserted i received a message from my PNC online banking saying my password was reset. so i go across the parking lot to pnc saying please freeze my online banking. the local pnc person then proceeded to print new debit cards and we changed my password together. In the middle of saying thank you to the PNC rep at my local branch i received another txt message from XXXX  saying my sim card was inserted into another device. run back across the parking lot to XXXX. receive another sim card for my phone. shortly after after inserting another txt message from pnc saying my PNC password was reset. so back over to the bank, and its closed. i call pnc phone number and wait the 30 minutes it took to finally talk to a rep, they said oh, your other phone number is receiving the 2FA the other phone number listed on my bank account was my fiances phone number. the hacker completely removed her phone number from my cell phone account and put it on a seperate account. now XXXX  wont authorize me to have it back. while on the phone with pnc rep, he removed the phone number from the account but by this time it was to late. the hacker had already stolen the phone number, logged into my pnc account. took a cash advance of {$1200.00} on my PNC credit card to my checking account. tried to use my XXXX to send it to themselves at {$50.00} transfer. my XXXX stopped the payment so then the hacker created a new XXXX  account with my fiances name and phone number that they had stolen and transfered {$1200.00} to theyre email address with the name " XXXX XXXX ''. i go back to the bank the next day to find out what to do about all this and she disputed the transactions. few days later i receive a letter from pnc saying the dispute was cancled because i authorized the cash advance and transfer. so back to the bank i go. dealing with the same person at PNC since she witnessed the whole thing unfold. she disputes it again with details referring to the event. few days later receive a letter again stating my dispute was denied since the other person listed on my account did the access. i again tell the reps at pnc the phone number was stolen and PNC allowed continuous password resets and several times for a new device ( being the hackers phone that now has our phone number ) they tell me theres nothing i can do about it and because i had filed a police report we will just let the police resolve it. they also told me to just make normal payments of this new balance transfer at 30 % plus charges of the cash advance. meanwhile .... i was payed 3 days prior to the event had plenty of money in my account total higher then the cash advance so there was absolutely no need for me to make a cash advance. during all these phone calls with PNC one rep states they know the devices location was outside of my normal location by XXXX miles somewhere in the state of florida, i live in pennsylvania so that means they have evidence that my device was in pa, then florida 10 minutes later on a new device, then 10 minutes later back in pa, then florida again 40 minutes later finaly ending in pa, also the 2nd phone number listed on my pnc account was able to also be in pa then withinin minutes be in florida where we then canceled the phone number the following day. PNC is still trying to charge me for this fraud transaction even though i was at the bank saying please stop everything within 10 minutes. Had the pnc bank manager froze my account like i asked that night all of this would have been prevented. PNC failed me multiple times that night, allowing unauthorized access by password reset several times, allowing unknown device to make transactions, allowing a new location to make transactions.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/2024 XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX FL XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter is regarding accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX, which you claim I owe {$1400.00} as a duplicate collection. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which you claim I owe {$2800.00}, {$3200.00}, and {$5700.00} on XXXX different collection accounts. This is a formal notice that your claim is disputed. I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, along with the corresponding local state laws. Please note that I am requesting " validation '' ; that is, competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay you. Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including XXXX, TransUnion, and XXXX ) from your company is a violation of the FCRA & FDCPA ; therefore, if you can not validate the debt, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry. Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take no action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports. 

Failure to respond within XXXX  days of receipt of this certified letter may result in small claims legal action against your company at my local venue. I would be seeking a minimum of {$1000.00} in damages per violation for : - Defamation- Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud- Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( including but not limited to Section 807-8 ) - Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( including but not limited to Section 623-b ) Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. My contact information is as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX FL XXXX Last XXXX of XXXX : XXXX P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney General 's Office CC : Better Business Bureau

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute several unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ).

I have previously submitted a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for this complaint is XXXX, filed on XX/XX/year>. 
After reviewing my recent credit report, I have identified the following inquiries that I do not recognize or authorize : Disputed Inquiry : Click or tap here to enter text. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/year> Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report. 
Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report. 
Request I request an immediate investigation into the listed inquiries. If it is determined that these inquiries were made without my authorization or in error, I ask that they be removed from my credit report. I also request that you provide me with an updated copy of my credit report once the necessary corrections have been made. 
Enclosed is a copy of my identification to verify my identity. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and keep me informed of the progress of your investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am filing a formal complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of an account on my credit report, which I am requesting be removed entirely. The account in question is a XXXX  account, where I was listed as an authorized user. Below are the account details : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : [ If available, you can include the last XXXX digits of the account number here ] Reported Balance : {$5200.00} Last Reported Date : XX/XX/XXXX Credit Limit : {$2100.00} Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Account Closed : XX/XX/XXXX The issue at hand is that this account was reported as closed with a balance of {$5200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, despite my role as an authorized user and not the primary account holder. Furthermore, the dispute resolved status showing " subscriber disagrees '' is entirely inaccurate. As an authorized user, I do not hold responsibility for the balance, and the statement is misleading. 

I request the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. The account has been inaccurately reported, and its inclusion is harmful to my XXXX XXXX and financial well-being. 

Legal Basis for Request : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section XXXX ( a ), furnishers of credit information are required to provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. The current reporting of this account violates the FCRA in the following ways : Inaccurate Reporting : The account was reported as a closed account with an outstanding balance. As an authorized user, I have no legal responsibility for the balance, and this should be reflected in the reporting. 

Dispute Status : The " subscriber disagrees '' status is inaccurate and misleading. This indicates a dispute that I did not initiate or resolve, which is a violation of the FCRA 's requirement for accurate information. 

Failure to Correct Information : The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies and furnishers correct any inaccuracies in a timely manner. The failure to accurately report the account as authorized user status rather than primary account holder is a violation of this obligation. 

Due to these violations, I am requesting that this entire account be removed from my credit report. The incorrect reporting of this account has caused significant harm to my credit and financial standing. 

Potential Legal Action : Should this matter not be resolved in a timely manner, I will consider pursuing legal action for damages under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as I have suffered harm due to inaccurate reporting. Under the FCRA, I am entitled to seek compensatory damages, including actual damages, statutory damages, and punitive damages for the failure to accurately report my credit information. 

I will also explore the option of engaging an attorney who specializes in consumer protection law and credit reporting disputes. A law firm such as The Law Offices of XXXX XXXX XXXX, which specializes in credit report disputes, FCRA violations, and consumer protection, can assist with this matter and pursue appropriate legal remedies if necessary.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to immediately initiate arbitration proceedings due to your willful noncompliance with applicable consumer protection laws, specifically under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Despite my prior efforts to resolve this matter amicably, your actions or lack thereof in addressing my concerns have led to clear violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned statutes. These violations include, but are not limited to : FCRA Violations : Your failure to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timely reporting of information to credit reporting agencies has resulted in irreparable harm to my creditworthiness. FDCPA Violations : Your aggressive and deceptive debt collection practices, including [ specify actions such as harassment, threats, false statements ], violate my rights as protected under the FDCPA. Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to enforce my rights through legal action, including arbitration, which will be pursued immediately as per the terms of our agreement and the applicable laws. Your actions have left me no choice but to move forward with arbitration to seek the remedies I am entitled to by law. 15 U.S.C. 1666b - Timing Of Payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. REMOVAL OF ALL LATE PAYMENTS IMMEDIATELY - UPDATE ACCOUNT " PAID AS AGREED " Account : XXXX  XXXX Account number:XXXX Transunion is inaccurately reporting this payment as late, which constitutes a material misrepresentation of the account status. Conversely, both XXXX and XXXX are not reflecting this payment as late, which further substantiates the claim of erroneous and misleading credit reporting. This disparity in reporting suggests a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates the accurate and timely reporting of credit information. '' This version incorporates references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is relevant to disputes regarding inaccuracies in credit reporting. 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) Disclosure to consumer ( A ) In general Except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), a person may not procure a consumer report, or cause a consumer report to be procured, for employment purposes with respect to any consumer, unless ( i ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes ; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. 

Removal AND DELETE Of Unauthorized Hard Inquiry - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Account # : XXXX Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
ARBRITRATION WILL BE FILED IMMEDIATELY IF THIS IS NOT RESOLVED WITHIN 4 BUSINESS DAYS. 

Transunion has removed XXXX and XXXX XXXX  Account from report, but not XXXX. These accounts are a resulto INSTRUCTIONS : PROVIDE METHOD OF VERIFICATION XXXX XXXX, Has Attached FTC Identity Theft Report # : XXXX & Transunion File Number : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. 

Consumer rights have been violated per 15 U.S. Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance & the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. INSTRUCTIONS : PROVIDE METHOD OF VERIFICATION XXXX XXXX, Has Attached FTC Identity Theft Report # : XXXX, and Transunion report showing proof of claim that 2/3 accounts were removed from the Identity Theft Report. 

We are inquiring to know what does XXXX considered to be a reasonable procedure when investigating your disputes? What steps are taken when a dispute comes through to your company? Is your team looking for the verification and tangible evidence? 

Provide a complete copy of all of the information that was transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. Explain what your representatives uncovered to lead them to believe that you are reporting this item as it legally should be reported. What certified documents were reviewed to conclude your investigation? Has the Consumer been informed of any steps to take in order to further protect their identity or prevent future fraudulent activities from appearing on their credit report? Did you speak directly to any agent of the company that is reporting the information to confirm the accuracy of what is reporting due to identity theft? As such, the Consumer is exercising their rights under 605B of the FCRA to request the removal of fraudulent items from the consumer report.

I have reached out to the Federal Trade Commission and lodged a complaint, which is enclosed for vour reference. XXXX credit report contains fraudulent ACCOUNTS and INQUIRIES that are not associated with me. All necessary documentation is included in this packet, and copies have been sent to your agency both via fax and through Certfied mail. In addition, I request the immediate removal of the following fraudulent ACCOUNTS and INOUIRIES from my credit report. ACCOUNT : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Transunion XXXX and XXXX are reporting inaccurate information on my credit report. And continue to violate 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION. This erroneous information is ruining my credibility, and I would like it removed entirely from my credit report. List of inaccurate information : the reporting of XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX is inaccurate and must be deleted as INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes the reporting of these accounts Inaccurate. Once again, 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting Information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency If the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the data is inaccurate. Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility. Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by the IRS. Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report the canceled debt as gross Income on your tax return. The IRS Clearly defines a charge-off as Gross or Ordinary Income. INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes your reporting of this account Inaccurate. Both XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX are inaccurate and must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I see that theres inaccurate information reporting on my consumer reporting that I would like removed. I have sent this request several times. Dear Consumer Department : I have recently reviewed a copy of my consumer report and unfortunately it has come to my attention that some of my personal information is incorrect. If you would please be so kind as to delete this inaccurate information from my credit profile within the next thirty days, I would greatly appreciate it. Ive listed the details on my personal information in which you are inaccurately reporting and must remove right away. 

Please see below : My name is : XXXX XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER NAMES or aliases, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER NAMES or aliases to be retained or reported. If there are any, please DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID which shows the proper and legal spelling of my full name. 

My current address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER CURRENT ADDRESSES, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER ADDRESSES to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID and utility bill which shows my current address and the proper spelling of it. 

You are not authorized to report my Social Security Number on my credit report or sell any information containing my Social Security Number to any company. Reporting my Social Security Number on my consumer report raises a safety issue and opens me up to potential identity theft. Immediately DELETE any and all Social Security Numbers that your company is reporting on my credit report. 

My Birth Date is : XX/XX/year> I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER DATES OF BIRTH, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER DATES OF BIRTH to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite telephone numbers, and I DO NOT desire any TELEPHONE NUMBERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite employers and I DO NOT desire any EMPLOYERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite spouses nor roommates no co-applicants, and I DO NOT desire any TELEPHONE NUMBERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

Thank you, in advance, for honoring my requests. Its my understanding that you have up to thirty days to follow through on my requests so if I dont receive any updates from you within that time frame, then I know that these inaccuracies must be removed automatically. Once you have removed the inaccurate information, I would like my full completed and corrected credit reporting showing these changes mailed to the CURRENT ADDRESS : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Thank you, Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to immediately initiate arbitration proceedings due to your willful noncompliance with applicable consumer protection laws, specifically under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Despite my prior efforts to resolve this matter amicably, your actions or lack thereof in addressing my concerns have led to clear violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned statutes. These violations include, but are not limited to : FCRA Violations : Your failure to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timely reporting of information to credit reporting agencies has resulted in irreparable harm to my creditworthiness. FDCPA Violations : Your aggressive and deceptive debt collection practices, including [ specify actions such as harassment, threats, false statements ], violate my rights as protected under the FDCPA. Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to enforce my rights through legal action, including arbitration, which will be pursued immediately as per the terms of our agreement and the applicable laws. Your actions have left me no choice but to move forward with arbitration to seek the remedies I am entitled to by law. 15 U.S.C. 1666b - Timing Of Payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. REMOVAL OF ALL LATE PAYMENTS IMMEDIATELY - UPDATE ACCOUNT " PAID AS AGREED " Account : XXXX  XXXX Account number:XXXX  Transunion is inaccurately reporting this payment as late, which constitutes a material misrepresentation of the account status. Conversely, both XXXX and XXXX are not reflecting this payment as late, which further substantiates the claim of erroneous and misleading credit reporting. This disparity in reporting suggests a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates the accurate and timely reporting of credit information. '' This version incorporates references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is relevant to disputes regarding inaccuracies in credit reporting. 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) Disclosure to consumer ( A ) In general Except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), a person may not procure a consumer report, or cause a consumer report to be procured, for employment purposes with respect to any consumer, unless ( i ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes ; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. 

Removal AND DELETE Of Unauthorized Hard Inquiry - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act by XXXX XXXX XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally report a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by XXXX XXXX XXXX. According to the FCRA, specifically Section A, a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe the information is inaccurate.

Additionally, under Section B, it states that a person shall not furnish information to any consumer reporting agency if they have been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and the information is indeed inaccurate. 

I contacted XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding inaccuracies in my credit reporting. Unfortunately, the representative I spoke with was unhelpful and did not address my concerns adequately. I emphasized that credit card accounts remain on a credit report for seven years and that I have maintained this account in good standing for over a year. Despite this, XXXX XXXX XXXX has not updated my information with all three credit bureaus without correcting the inaccuracies. 

I kindly request that your offices investigate this matter and take appropriate action against XXXX XXXX XXXX for their non-compliance with the FCRA. It is essential for consumers to be protected from inaccurate reporting that can negatively impact their creditworthiness. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute several unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ). 
I have previously submitted a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for this complaint is XXXX, filed on XX/XX/year>. 
After reviewing my recent credit report, I have identified the following inquiries that I do not recognize or authorize : Disputed Inquiry : Click or tap here to enter text. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/year> Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report.

Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report. 
Request I request an immediate investigation into the listed inquiries. If it is determined that these inquiries were made without my authorization or in error, I ask that they be removed from my credit report. I also request that you provide me with an updated copy of my credit report once the necessary corrections have been made.

Enclosed is a copy of my identification to verify my identity.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and keep me informed of the progress of your investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against TransUnion for their failure to comply with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Federal Trade Commissions ( FTC ) guidance regarding the handling of fraudulent and unauthorized accounts. 

Despite submitting an identity theft report, a copy of my state-issued ID, and other supporting documentation, TransUnion continues to report a fraudulent and unauthorized account on my credit file instead of removing or blocking it, as required by law. I have repeatedly requested documentation showing how TransUnion verified the legitimacy of the account, including a copy of the original credit application with my signature, the address associated with the account at the time it was opened, and the identity of the representative from XXXXXXXX XXXX with whom TransUnion confirmed the account. TransUnion has failed to provide this information. 

Instead, I have been sent multiple identical letterssometimes up to five in a single daystating the account has been verified. These generic responses do not address my concerns or provide any proof of verification as mandated by the FCRA. This demonstrates a clear disregard for the proper procedures required when handling disputed fraudulent accounts and a failure to protect consumers from the impact of identity theft. 

I respectfully request the CFPB investigate TransUnions handling of this matter and take appropriate action to ensure compliance with federal regulations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX claimed they charged off the accounts but also gave me a time frame to make the payments before the accounts went to charge off I have emails and letters to prove this. Also I am writing to formally dispute the reporting and handling of my account with XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : [ Insert Account Number ] ). Your company has reported this account as charged off, yet you continue to send me correspondence demanding payment. Additionally, you have failed to issue a XXXX Cancellation of Debt form, as required when an account is deemed uncollectible or charged off.

This situation raises serious concerns regarding compliance with both federal and Ohio state laws. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ), any information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate, complete, and not misleading. Reporting this account as charged off while simultaneously pursuing payment creates an inaccurate and inconsistent narrative that violates this requirement. Furthermore, failure to issue a XXXX under these circumstances may constitute noncompliance with IRS regulations ( 26 U.S. Code 6050P ), which mandate that creditors report canceled debts of {$600.00} or more. 

Ohios Consumer Sales Practices Act ( Ohio Revised Code 1345.01 et seq. ) prohibits deceptive or unfair practices in consumer transactions. The ongoing attempts to collect on an account you have reported as charged off mislead me and potentially other consumers regarding the true status of the debt. 

In light of these discrepancies, I am requesting the following : 1. Verification of the status of the account. If the account is legitimately charged off, you must cease all collection activities and issue a XXXX form for the canceled debt, as required by law. 
2. Immediate removal of this account from my credit report if you can not verify the accuracy of the charge-off status.

3. A written explanation of why you are continuing to demand payment despite claiming the account is charged off.

Under Section 611 of

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute several unauthorized inquiries on my credit report, in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically sections 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ), 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ), and 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ).

I have previously submitted a formal complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) concerning unauthorized inquiries on my credit report. The reference number for this complaint is XXXX, filed on XX/XX/year>. 
After reviewing my recent credit report, I have identified the following inquiries that I do not recognize or authorize : Disputed Inquiry : Click or tap here to enter text. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/year> Basis for Dispute Section 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) states that I have the right to dispute any inaccurate or incomplete information on my credit report. I request that you investigate these unauthorized inquiries and remove them from my credit report. 
Section 609 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) grants me the right to access all information in my file, including the inquiries made. After reviewing this information, I firmly believe that the inquiries listed above should not be on my report.

Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) defines the permissible purposes for obtaining credit reports. I did not give my consent for these inquiries to be made, and I can not find a permissible purpose under this section that justifies their presence on my report.

Request I request an immediate investigation into the listed inquiries. If it is determined that these inquiries were made without my authorization or in error, I ask that they be removed from my credit report. I also request that you provide me with an updated copy of my credit report once the necessary corrections have been made. 
Enclosed is a copy of my identification to verify my identity. 
I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and keep me informed of the progress of your investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative: I have been disputing the negative mark on my credit report from XXXX XXXX and all three credit bureaus, The transmission went out in my car and I called XXXX to see if they would be able to fix the transmission and I was denied due to the warranty being over by 1 mile. XXXX knew they sold me a lemon to begin with and for them not be willing to fix the transmission and demand the car payments is not right at all. XXXX says the balance on the vehicle loan is {$13000.00} however to replace the transmission on my own would have cost me over {$4000.00} and I don't have that kind of money and is unable to keep up. I asked what else could be done since I could no longer drive the car since the transmission went out and I could no longer keep up with the payments due to financial hardship. XXXX said there was nothing they could do and allowed the car to sit outside of my house for 3 months on purpose so they can put it on my credit as a repossession and put a negative impact on my credit report. After going back and forth with XXXX I asked for my 1099-C to show the debt has been cancelled on their end and they wrote it off as income. When I finally received the 1099-C it does not have my correct address on it. I called XXXX to get answers they told me that I can put the 1099-C on my taxes however they did not mail me a new 1099-C with my correct address which would cause issues. XXXX told me I still owed the debt and the 1099-C form really doesn't mean anything anymore and it can not be used to remove the negative mark on my credit report and the 1099-C is only for my records. I have never lived at the address listed on the 1099-C. The date of identifiable event on the 1099-C is incorrect ; XXXX has XXXX as XX/XX/XXXX however they came and got the none working vehicle in XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  is identifiable event code ( G ) meaning XXXX made the decision to discontinue collection to pursue payment. XXXX never changed the address on the 1099-C because I never received an updated one which causes a discrepancy with the credit bureaus when I submitted the 1099-C to XXXX, XXXX, and Transunion and filed disputes XXXX all three credit bureaus told me they spoke to XXXX and XXXX told them not to remove the negative mark and all the information on the 1099-C is accurate and that is not correct. I just checked my credit reports and all three credit bureaus have the XXXX negative mark to fall off XXXX of XXXX and it says XXXX XXXX. Which means they came and got the vehicle in XXXX ; because XXXX will be 7 years and by law the credit bureaus have to remove it from my credit report. Also, since the credit bureaus have Paid off regarding this account it should not be on my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request to Block and Delete Accounts Due to Identity Theft Pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally notify you that I have become a victim of identity theft as a result of a recent data breachOF XXXX. In accordance with my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you block and permanently delete any fraudulent accounts, inquiries, or information associated with the identity theft from my credit report. I am also attaching proof that I was a victim of the XXXX XXXX breach, and I kindly request that this information be considered as part of my claim. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within FOUR business days. To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} I am also including an FTC Identity Theft Report with the reference number XXXX to further support my claim of identity theft. This report provides additional documentation of the fraudulent activity linked to the XXXX data breach. As mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, upon receiving this identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are required to block and delete any information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Please find enclosed the following documents to support my claim :. I request that you confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with a written statement once the accounts and information have been blocked and deleted, as required by law. Please ensure that I receive an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that you will act quickly to resolve this issue in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX  XXXX XXXX are all inquiries that I did not and never authorized to run my credit, I have not asked for them to be run my credit and have no business with them. XXXX XXXX XXXX has a collection on my credit report and I have no business, nor have Fraudulent Collection Accounts : The following collection accounts have been inaccurately attributed to me and do not belong to me : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Balance : {$460.00} XXXX  XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX and XXXX Balances : {$810.00} and {$210.00} The CRAs failure to remove these unauthorized inquiries and fraudulent accounts, despite my disputes, constitutes a violation of the FCRA Legal Violations : Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : The CRAs are obligated to maintain accurate information on consumer reports. Reporting unauthorized inquiries and fraudulent collection accounts is a direct violation of this requirement.

Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) : Ive asked numerous times to remove any address from my Credit report thats only has my ID and Bill addressed that has not been removed. Upon receiving my disputes, the CRAs were required to conduct a reasonable investigation into these items. Instead, they claimed the information was verified without providing supporting documentation or details of their investigation. 
Unauthorized Inquiries ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : A credit inquiry must have a permissible purpose. The above-listed inquiries were made without my authorization, and the CRAs have failed to validate their legitimacy.

Impact on Me : These unauthorized inquiries and fraudulent collections have caused significant harm, including : A decline in my credit score.

Denied access to credit opportunities.

Reputational damage as a consumer. 
Emotional distress due to financial hardship.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request to Block and Delete Accounts Due to Identity Theft Pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally notify you that I have become a victim of identity theft as a result of a recent data breachOF XXXX. In accordance with my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you block and permanently delete any fraudulent accounts, inquiries, or information associated with the identity theft from my credit report. I am also attaching proof that I was a victim of the XXXX XXXX breach, and I kindly request that this information be considered as part of my claim. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within XXXX business days. To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account # XXXX Amount : {$0.00} I am also including an FTC Identity Theft Report with the reference number XXXX to further support my claim of identity theft. This report provides additional documentation of the fraudulent activity linked to the XXXX data breach. As mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, upon receiving this identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are required to block and delete any information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Please find enclosed the following documents to support my claim :. I request that you confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with a written statement once the accounts and information have been blocked and deleted, as required by law. Please ensure that I receive an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that you will act quickly to resolve this issue in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, has violated my rights.

And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 1681B ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Illegal Credit Report Inquiry by XXXX XXXX XXXX  FCRA Violation Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX  XXXX XXXX  for unlawfully accessing my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ). On XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX performed a credit inquiry without my authorization or any permissible purpose as defined by the FCRA. 

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, companies are required to have a permissible purposesuch as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer, a court order, or a business transaction that requires access to my credit informationto lawfully pull my credit report. I have no such relationship or outstanding debt with XXXX XXXX XXXX  that would justify this inquiry. 

This unauthorized credit pull has negatively affected my credit score and caused undue stress. As such, I am seeking the following : 1. Statutory Damages : Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( a ), I am requesting statutory damages in the amount of {$1000.00} for willful noncompliance with the FCRA.

2. Actual Damages : I have suffered harm, including emotional distress and potential damage to my credit standing, due to this unlawful inquiry. I reserve the right to seek actual damages in addition to statutory damages. 

Please investigate this violation of my consumer rights and take action against XXXX XXXX XXXX  to prevent future illegal activities. I also request that the unauthorized inquiry be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your timely response. 

Sincerely

On XX/XX/year> I was in the process of purchasing a house. From XXXX XXXX  that day until about XXXX that day I was entirely busy. On XX/XX/year> I received an email notification from XXXX ( not the complaint ) that I had an Installment Loan inquiry from XXXX  XXXX. I spent about 2 hours on the phone with XXXX ( not the complaint ) and they removed the inquiry. I then called XXXX XXXX ( previously I had not been able to get into contact ) using a business phone number, and after about an hour of determining what had happened, we found out someone had applied for a Credit Card in my name. The XXXX  XXXX application number is XXXX. The contact number to confirm this information is XXXX option XXXX. I then on XX/XX/year> submitted disputes for both XXXX and TransUnion. I have received nothing so far from TransUnion, who has no option to dispute the inquiry itself online, and all phone service is overseas. XXXX, after less than 24 hours, has left the inquiry on the report, which tells me they did not do any due diligence in determining whether or not this was actually fraudulent. I just moved, so I have not been able to get a police report ( the police department I am in the jurisdiction of is 45 minutes away ). 

The inquiry should be removed from both the XXXX and TransUnion.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XX/XX/year> I submitted a dispute request to TransUnion. The dispute was for the account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, an account that is paid in full and closed. In my dispute with TransUnion, I uploaded proof of payment. 
On XXXX XX/XX/year> I received an email from TransUnion saying that my dispute was complete and that I could view the results online. When I logged into my account with TransUnion the results were not available and I was not able to view any active disputes as that section of the website alternated between showing a loading screen or saying it was fully unavailable. 
After I logged in and could not find the details of my dispute, I contacted TransUnion via phone. I called XXXX times and gave my name and phone number at the beginning of the call, as the request of the agent, in the case we were disconnect, I was told I would receive a call back. XXXX times I was disconnected and never received a call back. 
On my third and final call, an agent informed me that there was an error with the proof of payment I uploaded through their portal. I was never informed of this issue until the call with agent. The call was then disconnected. I did not receive a call back. 

I have paid this account in full. The same dispute has been filed and settled without any issue with the XXXX other credit bureaus within minutes. I feel TransUnion is giving me no recourse to correct a false claim on my credit report and is actively avoiding my calls and requests.
