Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally submit a statement regarding my dispute with TransUnion related to the removal of inaccurate or outdated information from my credit report, as requested pursuant to 12 C.F.R. 1022.142. Despite submitting all necessary documentation and making multiple attempts to resolve this issue directly with TransUnion, they have failed to meet the required timelines for resolving this dispute. 

Here are the relevant details regarding this matter : Dispute Submission Date : XX/XX/year> Certified Mail Receipt by TransUnion : XX/XX/year> Direct Contact with TransUnion : I have personally reached out to TransUnion on the following dates in an attempt to resolve the issue : XX/XX/year> XX/XX/year> XX/XX/year> Despite my efforts, TransUnion has not taken the necessary steps to remove the disputed information from my credit report or provide any valid explanation for the delay or failure to act within the required timeframe. 

In accordance with 12 C.F.R. 1022.142, I expect TransUnion to complete their investigation and correct the inaccuracies on my credit report within the statutory timeframe, which has already elapsed. The delay and lack of response have caused significant frustration and inconvenience, and I am seeking assistance from the CFPB to ensure that my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) are upheld. 

Please find the attached documentation that was submitted to TransUnion I respectfully request that the CFPB intervene and take appropriate action to ensure that TransUnion complies with the regulations and removes the incorrect information from my credit report. I appreciate your timely attention to this matter and look forward to a prompt resolution. 

Thank you for your assistance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to immediately initiate arbitration proceedings due to your willful noncompliance with applicable consumer protection laws, specifically under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Despite my prior efforts to resolve this matter amicably, your actions or lack thereof in addressing my concerns have led to clear violations of my consumer rights under the aforementioned statutes. These violations include, but are not limited to : FCRA Violations : Your failure to ensure the accuracy, integrity, and timely reporting of information to credit reporting agencies has resulted in irreparable harm to my creditworthiness. FDCPA Violations : Your aggressive and deceptive debt collection practices, including [ specify actions such as harassment, threats, false statements ], violate my rights as protected under the FDCPA. Under the FCRA and FDCPA, I am entitled to enforce my rights through legal action, including arbitration, which will be pursued immediately as per the terms of our agreement and the applicable laws. Your actions have left me no choice but to move forward with arbitration to seek the remedies I am entitled to by law. 15 U.S.C. 1666b - Timing Of Payments ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. REMOVAL OF ALL LATE PAYMENTS IMMEDIATELY - UPDATE ACCOUNT " PAID AS AGREED " Account : XXXX  XXXX Account XXXX Transunion is inaccurately reporting this payment as late, which constitutes a material misrepresentation of the account status. Conversely, both FICO and XXXX are not reflecting this payment as late, which further substantiates the claim of erroneous and misleading credit reporting. This disparity in reporting suggests a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates the accurate and timely reporting of credit information. '' This version incorporates references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which is relevant to disputes regarding inaccuracies in credit reporting. 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( 2 ) Disclosure to consumer ( A ) In general Except as provided in subparagraph ( B ), a person may not procure a consumer report, or cause a consumer report to be procured, for employment purposes with respect to any consumer, unless ( i ) a clear and conspicuous disclosure has been made in writing to the consumer at any time before the report is procured or caused to be procured, in a document that consists solely of the disclosure, that a consumer report may be obtained for employment purposes ; and ( ii ) the consumer has authorized in writing ( which authorization may be made on the document referred to in clause ( i ) ) the procurement of the report by that person. 

Removal AND DELETE Of Unauthorized Hard Inquiry - XXXX XXXX Bank XXXX XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX  XXXX ( Bank ) XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX ( Bank ) XX/XX/year> XXXX  XXXX ( Bank ) XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX - Inquired on XX/XX/year> XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Account # : XXXX Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information. 

in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than XXXX. 

business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( XXXX ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer. 

( XXXX ) a copy of an identity theft report. 

( XXXX ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( XXXX ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. 

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( XXXX ) that the information may be a result of identity theft. 

( XXXX ) that an identity theft report has been filed. 

( XXXX ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( XXXX ) of the effective dates of the block. 

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. 

( XXXX ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. 

( XXXX ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer. 

shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i. 

( a ) ( XXXX ) ( B ) of this title. 

( XXXX ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew. 

or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. 

( d ) Exception for resellers. 

( XXXX ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller. 

( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. 

( XXXX ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. 

( XXXX ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( XXXX ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting. 

agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. 

( XXXX ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negatable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning XXXX business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( XXXX ) through ( XXXX ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section. 

1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. 

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter. 

Please send me an updated credit report with deletions of the above accounts removed from my credit report with-in XXXX  days. 

Yours truly, XXXX

Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the XXXX letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within four business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the accounts ( or inquiries ) listed IMMEDIATELY.

Consumer complaint narrative: Transunion XXXX and XXXX are reporting inaccurate information on my credit report. And continue to violate 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION. This erroneous information is ruining my credibility, and I would like it removed entirely from my credit report. List of inaccurate information : the reporting of XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX is inaccurate and must be deleted as INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes the reporting of these accounts Inaccurate. Once again, 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting Information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency If the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the data is inaccurate. Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility. Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by the IRS. Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report the canceled debt as gross Income on your tax return. The IRS Clearly defines a charge-off as Gross or Ordinary Income. INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes your reporting of this account Inaccurate. Both XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX are inaccurate and must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 U.S.C 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. 
To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you

Transunion Credit reporting Agency Violated Congress codes and According to Federal Law, Transunion is required to comply with the codes listed : California Civil Code 1785.26 ( b ) A creditor may submit negative credit information concerning a consumer to a consumer credit reporting agency, only if the creditor notifies the consumer affected. 
15 U.S.C 1681 602 AStates I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 604 A Section 2-Consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years 15 U.S.C 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) - A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency. I requested for the companies to be removed from my Transunion Credit Report due to violations listed above. As a National reporting agency, Transunion is governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) which protects consumers. Businesses paid Transunion and Transunion accepted payment to report information. In addition with the rest of the codes listed above. Accordingly, I request the Companies below must be deleted, and completely removed from my credit file within 7 business days as Transunionis non compliant of the 30 days response. In addition, a copy of such deletion request shall be sent/mailed to me immediately. I will continue to monitor if any action and or credit reporting repository is taken which could be considered detrimental and inaccurate to my credit report. Accordingly, I also request send notices of corrections to who received my credit report in the past 120 days ( 4 months ).

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally request an investigation into the procedures employed by the major credit reporting agenciesTransUnion, XXXX, and XXXXregarding the accuracy of information reported on my credit file. I am concerned about certain inaccuracies that I have identified and the subsequent failure of these agencies to provide adequate responses and documentation, which I believe constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Background Recently, I submitted complaints to TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX regarding incorrect information reported on my credit reports. Despite my efforts to address these inaccuracies, I have not received satisfactory responses or valid proof of the claims made by these agencies. Most importantly, I have repeatedly requested to review the " Procedures of Accuracy '' that these agencies claim to use to verify the information in my reports. Thus far, I have not received any meaningful information or documentation in response to my requests. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) The FCRA outlines specific responsibilities for credit reporting agencies, including the requirement to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Below are specific violations of the FCRA that I believe warrant your investigation : 1. Section 607 ( b ) - Reasonable Procedures : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. I have doubts that TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX have adhered to this requirement in my case, as the inaccuracies I reported have not been corrected nor explained.

2. Section 611 - Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy : Upon receiving my dispute, these agencies are mandated to conduct a reasonable investigation of my claims within 30 days. I submitted my dispute to all three agencies, but they have failed to provide the required investigation results or documentation supporting the accuracy of the reported information. Their lack of response is a clear violation of this section.

3. Failure to Validate Debts : When I identified the inaccuracies, I requested that the agencies provide validation of the debts and the procedures they used to verify the informations accuracy. Under the FCRA, they are obligated to provide this information and their failure to do so represents another violation of my consumer rights.

4. Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - Duty of Furnishers of Information : Any entity that provides information to consumer reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy of that information. If the information provided is found to be inaccurate, the furnishers have a duty to correct it. I am concerned that the agencies are not holding these furnishers accountable for the inaccurate reporting.

5. Lack of Adequate Consumer Responses : The agencies have not provided timely or useful responses to my inquiries, which I believe underlines a broader failure to protect consumer rights as mandated by the FCRA. 

Request for Action Given the collective issues I have faced, I respectfully ask the CFPB to conduct a thorough investigation into the practices of TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX regarding how they handle inaccuracies and disputes. Furthermore, I urge your office to compel these agencies to provide their " Procedures of Accuracy '' and ensure they are compliant with the FCRA requirements.

As a consumer, I have the right to accurate credit reporting, and the current situation jeopardizes my financial health and fundamental rights. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your timely response. 



I am writing to you to formally request a copy of the procedure your company followed in order to ensure that the information reporting for account XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX is completely accurate.It 's strange, you did a full investigation to verify the accuracy of this account due to the fact that you continue to report the wrong information. 

It is frightening to think that you did not do as you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act andthat other consumer might be affected Having this type of information on a person'sa credit report is unfortunate and severely damaging, but having incorrect damaging information ona person 's credit report is unacceptable. 

Please forward to me the name of the person you spoke with atINQUIRY, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, INQUIRY, INQUIRY, INQUIRY and the date that you spoke with them. I also want a confirmation of the address and phone number for the company. 

INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX, INQUIRY - XX/XX/XXXX As I have said, this account is incorrect and should be deleted entirely. Please send me anupdated credit report along with the investigation procedures. 

FYI, I DO NOT want a generalizedresponse stating what you typically do in an investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion and XXXX for their failure to address my disputes regarding the inaccurate reporting of timeshare accounts on my consumer credit reports.

Per my divorce decree, the timeshares listed on my credit reports are to be the sole property of my ex-husband. Specifically, under the section titled ** '' Additional Clauses '' **, the decree states : * '' In regards to timeshares purchased during the marriage, ALL timeshares will become the sole property of ( my ex husband ). ( ex wife, Me ) will be held harmless of any matters regarding these properties. " * Despite multiple
disputes submitted to TransUnion and XXXX, these timeshares remain inaccurately reported on my credit reports. This misreporting is causing significant harm to my consumer profile and is severely limiting my ability to secure credit and financing opportunities. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have attached the following supporting documentation to this complaint for your review : 1. A copy of my divorce decree.

2. A copy of my ID.

3. Proof of address.

4. A copy of the disputed account reporting to TransUnion and XXXX. 

I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that these timeshare accounts are promptly removed from my consumer credit reports as they no longer pertain to me under the terms of my divorce decree.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

With thanks

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

List of Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX 15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX minutes ago ) to me inaccurate and potentially fraudulent information that is being reported on my credit report by TransUnion . I reviewed my credit report on XX/XX/year>, and noticed several discrepancies regarding the following accounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX These accounts are showing inaccurate and incomplete information, including the reporting of late payments for accounts that were closed. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumer reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information reported on an individuals credit file. Unfortunately, the accounts listed above do not comply with this requirement. 

I have already reached out to TransUnion to dispute these accounts directly and requested an investigation into the inaccurate reporting. However, I have not yet received a satisfactory resolution, and the inaccurate information remains on my credit report. 

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) assist in investigating this matter and taking the necessary actions to ensure that the inaccurate and potentially fraudulent information is removed from my credit report. The accounts in question are causing undue harm to my credit score and violating my rights under the FCRA. 

The actions I request include : 1. An investigation into the reporting of the accounts listed above by TransUnion. 
2. Removal of all inaccurate information associated with these accounts from my credit report, including any late payment reports for accounts that have been closed. 
3. Ensuring that the information is corrected to reflect accurate and complete data as required by the FCRA. 

Please find attached a copy of my credit report with the disputed accounts highlighted, as well as any relevant correspondence regarding my previous dispute with TransUnion. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in resolving this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative: My accounts was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with XXXX XXXXXXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
This company is reporting inaccurate information on my credit report. This company Violated the United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) Recently I checked my credit report and noticed multiple billing errors under 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ( 4 ) The creditors failure to reflect properly on a statement, a payment made by the obligor or a credit issued to the obligor.

( 5 ) A computation error or similar error of an accounting nature of the creditor on a statement.

As I know the creditor didnt notify me 21 days before with a statement so there should be no late payments on this account. I demand to see hard solid proof from the creditor bank account that I didnt pay and was marked late, because this is clearly a billing error.

The items below should all be updated to paid as agreed on my consumer report. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late from XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late for XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX through XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX is reporting late for XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX As a consumer by law these accounts on this letter must be updated or deleted immediately or I will seek monetary compensation for violation of my rights in small claims court in my city and state under 15 USC 1681n civil liability because Ive been violated.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Institution Involved : XXXX XXXX : XXXX Nature of the Complaint : This complaint addresses OneMain Financials repeated violations, including inaccurate reporting to the credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ), breach of contract, failure to adequately investigate disputes, and adverse actions that have caused financial and reputational harm. 
XXXX of Events : XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * XXXX XXXX stated they had requested updates to the CRAs for the following information : date of last activity, last payment date, and payment history. However, these updates were either not made or remain inaccurate. Despite providing extensive supporting documentation, including a copy of my drivers license, Social Security card, and highlighted credit reports detailing the errors, XXXX XXXX falsely claimed that my correspondence " does not provide sufficient information to investigate your dispute. '' XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * A dispute letter was sent and received by XXXX XXXX, signed by XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). No substantive action was taken to resolve the inaccuracies. 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * Another dispute was delivered to XXXX XXXX. This correspondence included detailed information regarding the inaccuracies and supporting evidence. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). XXXX XXXX failed to adequately respond. 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * I sent an " Intent to XXXX '' letter, which included an invoice and outlined their continued violations, inaccurate reporting, and adverse actions. This letter was signed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
XXXX. XX/XX/XXXX : * A pre-arbitration notice was sent, reiterating the ongoing inaccuracies, breach of contract, and adverse actions. XXXX XXXX received this notice on XX/XX/XXXX, signed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
Violations : XXXX. Inaccurate Reporting to CRAs : * XXXX XXXX continues to furnish inaccurate information to the CRAs, including incorrect dates of last activity, payment history, and other key account details. This is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
XXXX. Failure to Investigate Disputes : * Despite receiving all necessary documentation to locate and verify my account, XXXX XXXX falsely claimed insufficient information to investigate my disputes. This constitutes willful noncompliance with the FCRA ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
XXXX. Breach of XXXX : * XXXX XXXX breached its agreement by initiating legal action against me before compelling arbitration, as stipulated in our agreement. This breach has caused defamation of character, harassment, and adverse actions. 
XXXX. Adverse Actions : * XXXX XXXX actions have caused adverse effects, including defamation of character, financial harm, and emotional distress. 
Harm Caused : The continued inaccuracies and adverse actions have resulted in : * Denial of credit and financial opportunities. 
* Emotional distress caused by harassment and defamation of character. 
* Financial harm through unnecessary legal proceedings.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncomplian
ce ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs. 
Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

I submitted a complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding inaccuracies on my credit report. If my previous request has not resulted in the appropriate corrections or if you claim that the accounts were " verified, '' I hereby invoke my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 611 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681I ).

Please be advised that you are required to reinvestigate the items in my initial CFPB complaint. You must verify the source of the information that led to your " verified '' response. If you are unable to provide this source, then you must delete all contested items from my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I see that theres inaccurate information reporting on my consumer reporting that I would like removed. I have sent this request several times. Dear Consumer Department : I have recently reviewed a copy of my consumer report and unfortunately it has come to my attention that some of my personal information is incorrect. If you would please be so kind as to delete this inaccurate information from my credit profile within the next thirty days, I would greatly appreciate it. Ive listed the details on my personal information in which you are inaccurately reporting and must remove right away. 

Please see below : My name is : XXXX XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER NAMES or aliases, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER NAMES or aliases to be retained or reported. If there are any, please DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID which shows the proper and legal spelling of my full name. 

My current address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER CURRENT ADDRESSES, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER ADDRESSES to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request to Block Fraudulent Information on Credit Report Pursuant to FCRA Section 605B and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ) Complainant : XXXX XXXX Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint to demand prompt action under Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ). Being a victim of identity theft due to a data breach, I am invoking my rights to have inaccurate information removed from my credit file.

Nature of the Issue : As a result of the data breach and subsequent misuse of my Social Security Number ( SSN ) and other sensitive details, I identified unauthorized accounts and transactions on my credit report. These fraudulent entries have harmed my credit profile, as demonstrated by a recent credit denial from my financial institution.

The items I am disputing and requesting to be blocked are XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  U S DEPT OF ED XXXX Supporting Documentation : I have included the following documentation to substantiate my dispute : A copy of my original dispute letter sent to TransUnion, XXXX and XXXX. 

A copy of my government-issued ID and Social Security card for identity verification.

A copy of my Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report.

Legal Basis for the Request : Under FCRA Section 605B, credit reporting agencies must block the reporting of information linked to identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days after receiving the consumers dispute and accompanying evidence. Additionally, 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) requires these agencies to ensure such data is excluded from the consumers credit report and that furnishers of the fraudulent accounts are notified of the block.

If further information or action is needed from me to resolve this issue, please inform me right away.

Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

I have attached an identity theft report with further details. The credit companies are also breaking several laws which I will include in here. Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, open date XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX. Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, open XX/XX/year>. These are XXXX of the same account that dont belong to me. I would like proof that these accounts belong to me from the company reporting them. Account XXXX XXXX, open XX/XX/year>. These accounts do not belong to me and was involved in my identity being stolen. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, also known as the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), consumers have the right to request validation of debts. This statute requires that debt collectors provide the debtor with certain information to validate the debt upon request. Specifically, the creditor must provide evidence that the debt is accurate and confirm that it is indeed associated with the consumer in question. If this information can not be provided, the items should be removed immediately.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action.

Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! due to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report. 

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/2024, I opened Case XXXX with Paypal to report unauthorized transactions on my Paypal account. All transactions identified in Case XXXX occurred in the past 40 days. It is important to note that I have two Paypal accounts and they have both been compromised. Both of my Paypal accounts show a long history of unauthorized transactions which I have tried to identify and report to Paypal also on XX/XX/2024. Although I opened two other Cases to report the older unauthorized transactions to Paypal, I understand that they are not obligated to investigate unauthorized transactions that appear on statements issued 60 days or more from the date of the reporting.

Paypal claims that all transactions on my accounts have been authorized, the ones that have occurred in the past 40 days and the older transactions. They have not requested any information from me and refuse to budge from their claim.

I have told Paypal multiple times that I have not made the transactions ; that I have not allowed anyone to make them on my behalf ; that I did not give anybody my login information or access to my accounts, and that the transactions must have been done fraudulently.

Paypal has not asked me to provide any information. They closed XXXX XXXX on the same day that I reported the issue and just keep parroting that they have found no evidence of unauthorized use or access of my Paypal account and that the transactions from Case XXXX are consistent with the history of transactions on the same Paypal account. Anytime I bring up the issue of fraud, they completely gloss over it and just repeat the same lines about having found no evidence of unauthorized use or access of my Paypal account.

Paypal clearly does not want to seriously investigate the possibility of fraud. At the same time, they also restricted my accounts after I reported the unauthorized transactions. It has been more than 10 days since I reported the unauthorized transactions to Paypal, they have refused to investigate the fraud on my accounts and they seem to have also refused to refund me.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Unauthorized transactions or other transaction problem
Consumer complaint narrative:
Comprehensive Complaint Document Subject : Fraudulent Transactions, Collusion, and Unlawful Conduct by Robinhood Markets , Inc. and XXXX Summary of Allegations This complaint details incidents of fraud, collusion, and obstruction by Robinhood Markets , Inc. ( Robinhood ) and XXXX. Their unlawful conduct has violated both federal and California state laws, causing significant financial and emotional harm. 

Detailed Allegations XXXX. Widespread Fraud Confirmed by Other Institutions Initial Incident : The complainants phone and wallet were stolen, resulting in unauthorized access to multiple accounts, including XXXX, XXXX, and other services. These incidents were reported to the police and the FTC. 
Financial institutions, including XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) and XXXX, investigated these fraudulent transactions, ruled in favor of the complainant, and refunded the stolen funds. 
XXXX. PayPals Role in Collusion and Admission of Fraud Collusion and Forged Evidence : XXXX initially colluded with Robinhood and XXXX, submitting fraudulent and forged evidence designed to make it appear as though the complainant authorized the transactions. 
The evidence provided contained glaring inconsistencies that were impossible to reconcile with reality, including fabricated transaction details and altered account records. 
These red flags were promptly recognized by XXXX  XXXX XXXX and credit card companies, who flagged the documentation as fraudulent. 
Attempt to Block Access to Evidence : When the complainant pressed XXXX for documentation of the disputed transactions, XXXX attempted to withhold access. 
XXXX falsely asserted that the complainant was not entitled to the documents unless a formal written request had been made. 
The complainant reminded XXXX that such a request had already been submitted. 
Admission of Fraud : XXXX ultimately admitted its role in facilitating fraudulent transactions. During a call, which the complainant conducted through their bank to ensure transparency, XXXX apologized and returned the stolen funds. 
XXXX openly acknowledged that the complainants access to BofA documentation exposed XXXX wrongdoing, with XXXX representatives stating that the complainant wasnt supposed to get these documents. 
XXXX. Robinhood and XXXX Obstruction and Blame-Shifting Failure to Investigate : Despite XXXX admitting to its role in facilitating fraudulent transactions, Robinhood and XXXX refused to resolve the disputed transactions. 
Both companies repeatedly shifted blame onto the complainant, violating Regulation E ( Electronic Fund Transfer Act ), which prohibits transferring liability for unauthorized transactions to consumers. 
Harassment During Investigation : Robinhood representatives called the complainant several times with hostile, unprofessional questioning regarding device access and locations. 
On XXXX date, they claimed fraudulent access had occurred from an XXXX, which the complainant does not own. 
On another date, they referenced a XXXX XXXX XXXX, which the complainant also does not own. 
When Robinhood mentioned a date matching the complainants actual device, the complainant offered to verify their XXXX location history to provide accurate information. Instead of accepting this effort, Robinhood representatives became agitated, demanded the complainant just guess their location, and accused them of being difficult. 
XXXX Threats and Intimidation : XXXX customer support threatened to block the complainant from further assistance, accusing them of monopolizing support resources. 
XXXX repeatedly claimed to have refunded stolen funds but directed those refunds to inaccessible accounts, despite knowing the original accounts were closed. 
XXXX actions directly violate laws requiring refunds to be issued to accounts accessible to the consumer. 
XXXX. Unauthorized Liquidation of Assets by Robinhood Unauthorized Actions : Robinhood liquidated the complainants stocks and cryptocurrency holdings without consent. 
The timing of these sales appeared intentional, as assets were sold at depressed values, maximizing financial harm. 
Avoidance of Accountability : I have provided XXXX the details where to send my money, but they claim they are trying to complay but can only send to the XXXX account. They take days and weeks to responds stating they are waiting on thier " partner '' to inform them what to do. AKA robinhood. This shows clear and convincing evidence of collusion. A felony crime under CA and FED laws. 
Instead of transferring proceeds to an accessible account, Robinhood withheld the funds and created unnecessary delays, compounding financial harm. 
XXXX. Unlawful Contractual Terms Robinhoods user agreement imposes additional liability on consumers, beyond what is permitted under Regulation E.

The company unlawfully required the complainant to meet arbitrary conditions before reimbursing stolen funds. These practices violate federal consumer protections. 
XXXX. Intentional Obstruction and Emotional Distress Robinhood and XXXX refusal to provide timely investigations, necessary documentation, or refunds caused : Prolonged financial instability. 
Significant emotional distress. 
Both companies demonstrated willful intent to avoid accountability and harm the complainant. 
Supporting Evidence Rulings by Other Financial Institutions : XXXX  XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX  all ruled in the complainants favor, confirmed the fraud, and refunded the stolen funds. 
Obstruction by Robinhood and XXXX : Robinhood blocked XXXX refunds and misrepresented facts, falsely citing account closures to delay resolution. 
Both companies manipulated transaction records and provided misleading information to regulators. 
Violations of Regulation E : Both Robinhood and XXXX blatantly ignored consumer protections afforded under federal law. 
Legal Violations Federal Violations Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) : Prohibits transferring liability for unauthorized transactions to consumers. 
XXXX XXXX ( 18 U.S.C. 1343 ) : Fraudulent schemes involving electronic communications. 
Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act ( RICO ) ( 18 U.S.C. 1962 ) : Demonstrated pattern of fraudulent and obstructive behavior. 
California State Violations California Civil Code 3336 : Recovery of damages for wrongful conversion of property.

Unfair Competition Law ( UCL ) : Prohibits deceptive, fraudulent, and unfair business practices.

Consumer Legal Remedies Act ( CLRA ) : Protects against unlawful and deceptive practices in consumer transactions.

Requested Remedies Full Restitution : Immediate reimbursement of all unauthorized transactions and asset liquidations.

Financial Compensation : Compensation for financial losses and emotional distress caused by Robinhood and XXXX unlawful actions. 
Refund Handling Compliance : Require XXXX to process refunds to accessible accounts, as mandated by law. 
Revised Contractual Terms : Termination of unlawful terms in Robinhoods user agreement that shift liability to consumers. 
Transparency in Investigations : Require Robinhood to provide all documentation, evidence, and findings related to the fraudulent transactions. 
Resolution Deadline Robinhood and XXXX must : THE SEC has told them to resolve the claim and inform them of the resolution ; but they both still play games. They have held my my funds froze my accounts. They owe me {$280000.00} for actual damages, punitive and pain and suffering plus interest this has gone on for months now and they refuse to cooperate even with intervention. they laugh at me and mock me. They think this is all so funny. I got an annoynmous call from an ex employee who claimed they do this on purpose to pay for the fines they were issued by the government and they pick on people who they think will go away. I have gotten calls from numbers in washington DC claiming to be XXXX telling me to download and app to my phone so they can protect me but it is clearly a fake name and they have forigen accents. I think it is a trick to try to say it is my fault I fell for scams. They broke every rule in thier investigation and it is totally unfair. 


Conclusion This complaint seeks immediate resolution, restitution, and accountability for the unlawful actions of Robinhood and XXXX. These companies repeated violations of consumer protections warrant comprehensive remedies and further investigation by regulators.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information and Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Permanent Opt-Out To : LexisNexis XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX Dear Representatives, I am writing to address XXXX separate but related matters : XXXX. A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my LexisNexis XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX consumer disclosure reports. 
XXXX. A request for a permanent security freeze and permanent opt-out on my consumer file. 
________________________________________ Part XXXX : Dispute of Inaccurate Information Description : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information contained in my consumer reports from LexisNexis XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
The issues pertain to the following : XXXX. Inaccuracies : Specific inaccuracies in my reports are highlighted in the attached documentation. These inaccuracies affect the accuracy and integrity of my consumer data. 
XXXX. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided.

I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that LexisNexis XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my LexisNexis XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX Report once the corrections have been made.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
From XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, I was the owner of a co-op at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. The mortgage was held by NewRez LLC DBA Shellpoint Mortgage Servicing. " NewRez '' was not able to locate the proprietary lease for my co-op, thereby delaying the closing from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, and causing us to unnecessarily pay {$1300.00} in interest to them through thru XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I verbally accepted an offer to sell this co-op and on XX/XX/XXXX we retained a closing attorney. The atty began working with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), a law firm who represents NewRez in New York XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, my atty provided XXXX with a form I signed authorizing NewRez to locate my stock certificate and priority lease for the closing. NewRez immediately confirmed receipt of that form and warning that turnaround time would be XXXX weeks. 

My atty emailed XXXX for a status of the stock certificate and priority lease on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX responded, saying that they received our file from NewRez but the proprietary lease was missing. 

It took until XX/XX/XXXX for NewRez to confirm they could not locate the proprietary lease. They then prepared a Lost Proprietary Lease Affidavit for approval by the co-op transfer agent. Thus, closing dates could not even be discussed until then and XX/XX/XXXX became the first closing date all partied were available. 

I would like to also note that NewRez 's inability to keep track of my lease also caused me to incur {$1400.00} in co-op fees for the month of XXXX. 

Federal law requires mortgage companies to provide pay-off figures within seven business days of a written request. Thus, I am sure you will agree it is unreasonable that we had to wait *eleven* weeks after alerting New Rez that were selling this co-op to pay off this 8 % mortgage.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information and Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Permanent Opt-Out To : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, SageStream Dear Representatives, I am writing to address two separate but related matters : 1. A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX consumer disclosure reports. 
XXXX. A request for a permanent security freeze and permanent opt-out on my consumer file. 
________________________________________ Part XXXX : Dispute of Inaccurate Information Description : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information contained in my consumer reports from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, and SageStream. Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
The issues pertain to the following : XXXX. Inaccuracies : Specific inaccuracies in my reports are highlighted in the attached documentation. These inaccuracies affect the accuracy and integrity of my consumer data. 
2. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided. 
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I identified the following discrepancy that requires immediate correction : Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX. 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX.

Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXXXXXX I request a manual review of this information due to the complexity of the inaccuracies. I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, SageStream conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, SageStream Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made.

I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports. 
XXXX. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken. 
XXXX. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports. 
XXXX. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information. 
o Sources consulted during the investigation. 
o Documentation reviewed to support verification.

o Verification process and criteria used.

o A timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your investigation. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed.

Additionally, I request a description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disputed information and the contact details of each person consulted regarding this account. Please also provide copies of any documents bearing my signature that establish a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the amount in question.

Failure to correct these inaccuracies within 30 days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Requested Actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed accounts.

2. Remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation.

4. Send a corrected copy of my credit report to my address above.

5. Methods Used : Please describe the specific methods and procedures used to verify the disputed information.

6. Sources Consulted : Provide a list of all sources, including creditors or data furnishers, consulted during the investigation.

7. Documentation Reviewed : Detail any documentation or evidence reviewed to support the verification of the disputed information.

8. Verification Process : Explain how the accuracy of the information was verified and the criteria used for validation.

9. Timeline of Investigation : Outline the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Additional Requests : 1. Procedure Description : Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested. This should include a detailed explanation of how the reinvestigation was conducted and the specific steps taken.

2. Contacts : Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account.

3. Documents Bearing Signature : I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed.

Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. Violations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regulations ________________________________________ Part 2 : Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Opt-Out I also request the following actions to ensure the security and privacy of my consumer data : 1. Place a permanent security freeze on my consumer file to prevent unauthorized access or use of my personal information.

2. Permanently opt me out of all pre-approved credit and insurance offers, marketing campaigns, and data-sharing programs.

Personal Information for Verification : Enclosed are copies of my driver 's license and a utility bill for verification purposes. Please confirm in writing once these actions have been completed or if additional information is required.

________________________________________ Relevant Laws : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Compliance procedures for maximum possible accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681i : Procedures for disputed accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681c : Requirements for information in consumer reports.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : Validation of debt details and original creditor information.

________________________________________ Thank you for your attention to these matters. I look forward to your response within the timeframes mandated by the FCRA. Please contact me at [ Insert Phone ] or [ Insert Email ] if you require further clarification. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX ________________________________________ Make sure to customize the placeholders with your details and attach the necessary documentation when sending this letter. Let me know if you need further refinements!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Institution Involved : OneMain FinancialXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Nature of the Complaint : This complaint addresses OneMain Financials repeated violations, including inaccurate reporting to the credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ), breach of contract, failure to adequately investigate disputes, and adverse actions that have caused financial and reputational harm.

Timeline of Events : 1. XX/XX/XXXX : * OneMain Financial stated they had requested updates to the CRAs for the following information : date of last activity, last payment date, and payment history. However, these updates were either not made or remain inaccurate. Despite providing extensive supporting documentation, including a copy of my drivers license, Social Security card, and highlighted credit reports detailing the errors, OneMain Financial falsely claimed that my correspondence " does not provide sufficient information to investigate your dispute. '' 2. XX/XX/XXXX : * A dispute letter was sent and received by OneMain Financial, signed by XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). No substantive action was taken to resolve the inaccuracies.

3. XX/XX/XXXX : * Another dispute was delivered to OneMain Financial. This correspondence included detailed information regarding the inaccuracies and supporting evidence. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). OneMain Financial failed to adequately respond.

4. XX/XX/XXXX : * I sent an " Intent to Sue '' letter, which included an invoice and outlined their continued violations, inaccurate reporting, and adverse actions. This letter was signed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
5. XX/XX/XXXX : * A pre-arbitration notice was sent, reiterating the ongoing inaccuracies, breach of contract, and adverse actions. OneMain Financial received this notice on XX/XX/XXXX, signed by XXXX XXXX XXXX. ( Tracking Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
Violations : 1. Inaccurate Reporting to CRAs : * OneMain Financial continues to furnish inaccurate information to the CRAs, including incorrect dates of last activity, payment history, and other key account details. This is a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

2. Failure to Investigate Disputes : * Despite receiving all necessary documentation to locate and verify my account, OneMain Financial falsely claimed insufficient information to investigate my disputes. This constitutes willful noncompliance with the FCRA ( 15 USC 1681i ).

3. Breach of Contract : * OneMain Financial breached its agreement by initiating legal action against me before compelling arbitration, as stipulated in our agreement. This breach has caused defamation of character, harassment, and adverse actions.

4. Adverse Actions : * OneMain Financials actions have caused adverse effects, including defamation of character, financial harm, and emotional distress.

Harm Caused : The continued inaccuracies and adverse actions have resulted in : * Denial of credit and financial opportunities. 
* Emotional distress caused by harassment and defamation of character. 
* Financial harm through unnecessary legal proceedings.
