Consumer complaint narrative: My question to Bank of America. -- I have had an account with Bank of America for over 30 years. I recently called to reorder checks and the system said I was a new acct. check order and would not process my order. I have spoken to many B of A employees and NO ONE could answer why this happened -- My check sequence has always been in order and I am currently in check number sequence of XXXX and NEVER has there been a change in sequence since the start. WHAT IS THEIR PROBLEM AND HOW WILL b OF a Resolve it. -- answer -- Hello XXXX XXXX I apologize that our system is giving you trouble. To clarify when you call in to order checks the system thinks your account is new but our customer service team sees your info as existing? That absolutely should not be doing that especially if the account is not new. Can you walk me through how you go about doing the order? Do you call in using a different number than what is attached to your account, do you have a new card, do you have more than one account with us? -- First I went to the local branch and presented the teller with the check reorder slip from my checkbook -- They were unable to help so I came home and called XXXX -the system asked for my acct. number and when I entered my acct. number -- the system said call back with my acct. number even though I had just entered my acct. number? Then I called the XXXX number to place the order -- that system asked for info on my acct. at which time I entered all the info they had asked for -- at which time the system then said because this was a new acct. check order they could not process the order. THIS IS NOT A NEW ACCT. CHECK ORDER -- I have reordered checks MANY times since I have had this acct, many years. I called a different 800 number and was told by someone who IDed herself as XXXX THAT SHE COULD PROCESS THE CHECK REORDER BUT SHE WOULD FIRST HAVE TO ENROLL ME IN THE PREFERRED AWARDS PROGRAM AND I AGREED AND WAS ENROLLED IN THAT PROGRAM -- HOWEVER WHEN I CALLED BACK TO VERIFY THE CHECK REORDER NEVER WENT THROUGH. I DO NOT HAVE MORE THAN ONE ACCT. WITH Bank of America-

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a customer/consumer of the financial institution Synchrony Bank and its subsidiaries/parents/affiliates/etc. 

PRIVACY Title 15 U.S. Code 6801 states, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information, and that the financial institution shall protect against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. Synchrony Bank is a financial institution by definition in this Title, and its failure to abide by privacy laws has both harmed and inconvenienced me. 

I provided opt out instructions to Synchrony Bank on XX/XX/year> via the online messaging center in my accounts portal ( Attachment 1 ). My instructions were not complied with, as evidenced by Attachments 2, 3, and 4, which are consumer reports showing my account information reported after the date of my opt out notice. Synchrony Bank/Sams continued to report my personal information after receiving my opt out notice, which violated my consumer privacy rights. 

12 CFR 1016.7 ( h ) states, " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am now elaborating on my original instruction to eliminate ambiguity. Synchrony Bank does not have my consent to, and shall not, report, share, sell, give, or otherwise transfer my nonpublic personal information, from the date of XX/XX/year>, to a non-affiliated third party or credit reporting agency. The furnishing of my information after that date is unlawful and is required to be removed ; inclusive of, but not limited to, balances, amounts, late payments, status, remarks, comments, highest balance, updated dates, last payment dates, etc. 

FAIR REPORTING Additionally, Synchrony Bank furnished information to credit reporting agencies while the account balance was still in dispute ( as evidenced by Attachments 5 and 6 ), which is a violation of the fair credit reporting 15 USC 1681s-2. Consequent to Synchrony Banks unlawful actions, I was denied when applying for a loan recently ( Attachment 7 ).

15 USC 1681n states, Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00}. Synchrony Bank owes me {$4000.00} in civil damages : {$1000.00} for each month information was furnished to XXXX and XXXX while the balance was in dispute.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX  XXXX. Account # : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX. Account # : XXXX Please remove the following Fraudulent hard inquiries from my credit report. 

XXXX - XX/XX/year> Applicable Legal Basis for Dispute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally request an investigation into the procedures employed by the major credit reporting agenciesXXXX, Equifax, and XXXXregarding the accuracy of information reported on my credit file. I am concerned about certain inaccuracies that I have identified and the subsequent failure of these agencies to provide adequate responses and documentation, which I believe constitutes a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

Background Recently, I submitted complaints to XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX regarding incorrect information reported on my credit reports. Despite my efforts to address these inaccuracies, I have not received satisfactory responses or valid proof of the claims made by these agencies. Most importantly, I have repeatedly requested to review the " Procedures of Accuracy '' that these agencies claim to use to verify the information in my reports. Thus far, I have not received any meaningful information or documentation in response to my requests. 

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) The FCRA outlines specific responsibilities for credit reporting agencies, including the requirement to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Below are specific violations of the FCRA that I believe warrant your investigation : 1. Section 607 ( b ) - Reasonable Procedures : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. I have doubts that XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX have adhered to this requirement in my case, as the inaccuracies I reported have not been corrected nor explained.

2. Section 611 - Procedure in Case of Disputed Accuracy : Upon receiving my dispute, these agencies are mandated to conduct a reasonable investigation of my claims within 30 days. I submitted my dispute to all three agencies, but they have failed to provide the required investigation results or documentation supporting the accuracy of the reported information. Their lack of response is a clear violation of this section.

3. Failure to Validate Debts : When I identified the inaccuracies, I requested that the agencies provide validation of the debts and the procedures they used to verify the informations accuracy. Under the FCRA, they are obligated to provide this information and their failure to do so represents another violation of my consumer rights.

4. Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) - Duty of Furnishers of Information : Any entity that provides information to consumer reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy of that information. If the information provided is found to be inaccurate, the furnishers have a duty to correct it. I am concerned that the agencies are not holding these furnishers accountable for the inaccurate reporting.

5. Lack of Adequate Consumer Responses : The agencies have not provided timely or useful responses to my inquiries, which I believe underlines a broader failure to protect consumer rights as mandated by the FCRA. 

Request for Action Given the collective issues I have faced, I respectfully ask the CFPB to conduct a thorough investigation into the practices of XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX regarding how they handle inaccuracies and disputes. Furthermore, I urge your office to compel these agencies to provide their " Procedures of Accuracy '' and ensure they are compliant with the FCRA requirements. 

As a consumer, I have the right to accurate credit reporting, and the current situation jeopardizes my financial health and fundamental rights. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to your timely response. 



I am writing to you to formally request a copy of the procedure your company followed in order to ensure that the information reporting for account XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX is completely accurate.It 's strange, you did a full investigation to verify the accuracy of this account due to the fact that you continue to report the wrong information. 

It is frightening to think that you did not do as you are governed by the Fair Credit Reporting Act andthat other consumer might be affected Having this type of information on a person'sa credit report is unfortunate and severely damaging, but having incorrect damaging information ona person 's credit report is unacceptable. 

Please forward to me the name of the person you spoke with atINQUIRY, XXXXXXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, INQUIRY, INQUIRY, INQUIRY and the date that you spoke with them. I also want a confirmation of the address and phone number for the company.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am responding to the letter you sent dated about a debt you are trying to collect. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( g ). This claim is being disputed and a debt validation is requested. I also have reason to believe that you are in violation of 15 USC 1692e. False or misleading representations as defined ( 3 ) The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. After the case with XXXX XXXX XXXX, the Consumer Federal Protection Bureaus ( CFPB ) took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX to their illegal debt collection and credit reporting practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect on disputed debts using unlawful collection letters and misrepresentation. The CFPB stated that XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debt that was NOT substantiated after consumers disputed the validity of the debt conducted an investigation and found that XXXX sent collection letters to consumers who DISPUTED the validity or accuracy of their purported debts, even though XXXX had NOT obtained substantiation for the debts. As a debt collection, the CFPB states you are required to have a reasonable basis for assertion that a consumer owes the purported debt if a dispute is submitted. As a result, the CFPB required XXXX XXXX XXXX to pay redress to affected consumer and pay a {$1.00} XXXX penalty to the CFPBs victim relief fund. 
The CFPB outlined a list of requests we, as consumer, can ask for when we are seeking proper validation of debt to ensure you are ethically seeking debt legally. I have requested a proper validation of debt for the past XXXX months YET you have not provided me with the substantiated information the CFPB outlines and you continue to have this alleged account reported on my consumer report? A PROPER validation of debt address EACH item of validation that I am requesting. You can find each request listed below. 
The account in question is listed below : Meridian Financial Services Inc - XXXX - 12 CFR 1006.34 - Notice for validation of debts. - I believe this account to be inaccurate because I do not recall doing business with this company. Your credit report agency is required to investigate my claims and you have yet to provide me with a solid proof of debt validation generally within 30 days. Since you have yet to do this, please remove this account from my consumer report immediately. This account is currently in litigation. Please delete this account from my credit report immediately. 
Please provide me with a proper validation of debt. If you can not provide me with the documentations I am request, please request to have this account permanently remove from my credit report and the debt permanently discharge. 
I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : XXXX of XXXX Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 
Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Please provide verification by line item ( with explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the alleged items was, were the goods/services received, what were the goods/services received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor.

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 
Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 
If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 
The obligation between you and I that allows you to collect on the alleged debt and any transactions between your company that binds me to an agreement to pay your company any money that you claim I owe. 
Proof of photo identification ( i.e., drivers license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) that was presented to you at the time of incurring this alleged debt. 
Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Please show me proof that this debt was actually sold to you. ) The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 
State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 
If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 
If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. 
In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 
Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt. 
I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? 
If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
XXXX of XXXX ( Enclosed is a copy of the list of your licenses. I found this document on the XXXX database. I dont see XXXX  XXXX this list. How are you legally attempting to collect this alleged debt, in a state that youre not licensed in, that you havent properly validated after numerous request- yet still reporting to the credit bureaus which further affects my credit profile and credit score? This sounds to me like Aggravated Identity Theft, per 18 US Code 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft ) If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In hindsight, your agency willing took on this debt willingly that you have not properly validated with me as a LAW ABIDING consumer. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. If a proper validation is not provided, you can not recover this debt to try and collect from me per volenti no fit injuria. 
PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT. 
PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER. 
IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED. 
WITHOUT PREJUDICE XXXX XXXX UCC1-308 CC : ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF XXXX  XXXX XXXX CC : ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF XXXX  XXXX XXXX CC : ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CC : CONSUMER FEDERAL PROTECTION BUREAU CC : FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice of RICO Violation Complaint Against Ally Financial for Unlawful Debt Collection Practices and RICO Violations Complainant Information Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Pennsylvania XXXX Phone Number : ( XXXX ) XXXX Email Address : XXXX Complaint Details Entity Complained About : Ally Financial Complaint Type : Unlawful Debt Collection Practices Nature of Complaint : Fraudulent Debt Contract and Violation of the XXXX XXXX and Corrupt Organizations ( RICO ) Act Summary of Allegations : I am filing this complaint against Ally Financial for engaging in unlawful debt collection practices that violate federal law, including the RICO statute. Ally Financial knowingly participated in a scheme involving fraudulent debt instruments, related to a car purchase in XXXX. These actions constitute a deliberate and egregious violation of my rights as a consumer and federal statutes. 

Specific Allegations XXXX. Fraudulent Debt Instruments Ally Financial has sought to collect a debt based on contracts I allege are fraudulent. These contracts rely on banking practices designed to impose unpayable obligations, thereby creating a predictable cycle of default. 

XXXX. Knowledge of Fraudulent Activity I provided Ally Financial with substantial evidence contesting the debts legitimacy, including affidavits and detailed correspondence. Despite this, they continued their collection efforts, demonstrating willful participation in a fraudulent scheme. 

XXXX. Violation of RICO Statute Ally Financials actions constitute the collection of unlawful debt under 18 U.S.C. 1962 ( c ). Their persistent attempts to enforce a fraudulent contract reflect a pattern of racketeering activity, meeting the legal definition under the RICO Act.

Why the Debt Collection is Unlawful Ally Financials debt collection efforts are unlawful for the following reasons 4. Fabricated Loan and Lack of Lawful Consideration Ally Financial has refused to provide proof of lawful consideration for the loan upon request. Without this proof, it is reasonable to conclude that the alleged loan was fabricated on their balance sheet, meaning no real funds were ever extended to me. As a result, Ally Financial can not demonstrate that they suffered any actual loss and therefore have no legal standing to pursue debt collection or seek a remedy through this process.

5. Fraudulent and Predatory Practices The underlying debt is predicated on usurious banking practices that guarantee default, rendering the debt fraudulent and unenforceable.

6. Disregard for Evidence and Federal Law Despite being provided with clear evidence of the debts invalidity, Ally Financial persisted in its collection efforts, violating federal protections against predatory lending and unfair debt collection practices.

7. Violation of the RICO Statute By continuing to enforce an illegitimate obligation despite awareness of its fraudulent nature, Ally Financial engaged in actions prohibited under RICO.

Relevant Penalties Under RICO Under the RICO Act, individuals or organizations found guilty of racketeering activities face severe penalties, including : A maximum of 20 years in prison for those involved.

Fines up to {$250000.00} or double the amount of the proceeds derived from the criminal activity.

Enhanced sentences in cases of severe or ongoing violations.

These penalties underscore the gravity of Ally Financials actions and highlight the urgent need for enforcement.

Documentation of Evidence I can provide the following evidence upon request : Correspondence with Ally Financial disputing the debt. 
Affidavits challenging the debts validity. 
Documentation submitted to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and other agencies regarding this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 
1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions. 
2. Charge-Off Reporting and Misclassification : A charge-off is a bookkeeping designation used by creditors for tax purposes when they consider a debt uncollectible. Under federal tax law, a charge-off can be treated as a cancellation of debt, which may constitute income to the debtor. However, XXXX XXXX XXXX did not issue a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ) form to me, as required under IRS regulations XXXX to substantiate that the debt was canceled and classified as income. Without this form, their reporting of the charge-off to credit reporting agencies is not only improper but also misleading. Moreover, a charge-off does not represent a valid certificate of indebtedness. A certificate of indebtedness reflects a binding obligation that is enforceable ; a charge-off, by its nature, implies that the debt has been resolved or abandoned by the creditor. Reporting a charge-off to credit bureaus under these circumstances constitutes inaccurate reporting. 
3. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. 
I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : 1. The absence of a 1099-C form to substantiate the charge-off as canceled debt.

2. The improper classification of a charge-off as a certificate of indebtedness.

3. The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative:
Ally Financial Had Repossessed My XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XX/XX/XXXX. I Had An Arbitration Clause In The Contract Which Ally Financial Breached. In Tennessee, the law related to the right to

repossess collateral under the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) is governed by Article 9 of the UCC, specifically UCC 47-9-609. This section outlines the rules and procedures for a creditor to repossess collateral when a debtor defaults on a secured transaction. According to Tennessee 's UCC 47-9-609, a creditor generally has the right to repossess collateral if the debtor has defaulted on the underlying obligation. However, having a lien on the collateral is a key requirement for the creditor to exercise the right to repossess. The creditor must have a security interest in the collateral, typically established through a security agreement or another means allowed under the UCC. Therefore, in Tennessee, to repossess collateral under the UCC, the creditor must have a valid security interest or lien in the collateral as outlined in the UCC rules. It is essential for creditors to follow the proper procedures outlined in the UCC to repossess collateral lawfully and avoid potential legal challenges from debtors. In Particular,
Inclearing deposits played a crucial role in the processing of auto loan payments affecting both lenders & borrowers. My auto home from Ally Financial was {$73000.00} & Ally Financial used the OC application form submitting it to the Federal Reserve Bank requesting {$350000.00}. Within a week and a half they received a check known as an inclearings deposit any amount of {$350000.00} made payable to my name. I Was never told about this particular deposit it seems that the operating circular number 10 appendix 3 of the Federal Reserve has an irrevocable power of attorney associated with it, I believe that the irrevocable power of attorney is unconscionable as a clause in our agreement. However the corporation should have adjusted the balance and reserve the remaining portion of the deposits to me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am demanding immediate clarification regarding the method of verification your bureau uses to confirm the accuracy of disputed items on my credit report. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to know exactly how disputed items are verified. I expect you to provide me with complete transparency about the following : The exact process or method your bureau uses to verify disputed items. 
The identity of the entity/entities responsible for carrying out this verification. 
Any documentation or evidence used to support the accuracy of the disputed items. 
I am fully aware of my rights under the FCRA, and I expect full compliance with this request. If you can not provide verifiable proof for these items.

Consumer complaint narrative: I called XXXX bank on XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) screen shot of date i called is attached, because I had tried to close my account and pay off a balance and I recieved a letter saying I still had a balance. I called and made the statement balance payment of {$120.00} to close the account and be done with CITI bank as they are absolutely abhorrent. The rep I spoke with stated their was a {$0.00} account balance and the account was closed. I was relieved that I could finally terminate my relationship with CITI bank as they have been nothing but trouble and frustration. XX/XX/XXXX, I got several emails stating there was a hit to my XXXX score ( was at XXXX ) I've always had nearly perfect credit, but now there was a hit due an " account being 30 days past due. I checked my XXXX, and any other accounts and all of them had a XXXX balance. Because they have been so horrid to deal with, the thought crossed my mind that it might be CITI bank. Of course it was. It said the statement balance was {$140.00}! I cut up the card in XXXX and have no used it since which means CITI bank LIED when he told me there was XXXX balance when I stated repeatedly I wanted to close the account and not deal with them anymore. When I called again to try and close my account, I got a representative who refused to issue me a statement in writing saying the account was closed and had a XXXX balance. This is in direct violation to THE CREDIT CARD REPORTING ACT of XXXX. When she escalated the call, I got an even worse representative named XXXX Employee # XXXX who also refused to sent a statement to me and just repeated herself over and over saying she was " taking a payment but this did not include fees, interest, new charges '' etc... I had stated about XXXX times that I wanted to never deal with CITI bank XXXX, wanted to close my account, and wanted assurance there would be no need charges ( FEES ) attached to the card as I wasn't using it and cut it up back in XXXX. XXXX then said " so I heard you never want to hear from us again? '' I said yes that was correct after the account was closed, and the balance was paid off. XXXX then put me on hold and came back and said " okay I have removed you from any further communication with CITI bank ''. I knew exactly where she was going with her charade and said " so if you guys tack on more hidden fees to an account I am trying to close, I won't be notified is that correct? '' She said " yes ma'am, that's correct ''. That is not what I was trying to do, she was just playing games, then she told me she didn't like my tone ''. Then she asked me if I wanted her tl reverse the payement? It was obviously apparent XXXX was not interested in resolving anything. So abhorrent I was at a loss for words. I got a reference number for my payment which I used their automated system to make sure my statement remained at a {$0.00} balance, and will continue to do so as their reps can not be trusted. My fico score dropped XXXX points yesterday after dealing with them when it was THEIR rep who told me the account had a XXXX balance and it was closed in XXXX. When I told chayra all of this she stated she had " no idea what was said by who etc ''. That's a complete lie, they have a running log of who talks to what client and what is said. I want my fico score back as this is a blatant abuse of fees, hidden charges, being lied to by CITI bank. I have a right as a consumer to recieve a copy of my statement for records to get piece of mind that I can severe ties with this atrocious company and never deal with them again.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15
U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative: These following accounts do not belong to me and reports were made already. My identity was stolen and I have tried several attempts to get these accounts removed as they do not belong to me. I have asked for proof that they belong to me and it was not given. I have attached an identity theft report with further details. The credit companies are also breaking several laws which I will include in here. Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, open date XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX. Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, open XX/XX/year>. These are XXXX of the same account that dont belong to me. I would like proof that these accounts belong to me from the company reporting them. Account XXXX XXXX, open XX/XX/year>. These accounts do not belong to me and was involved in my identity being stolen. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692g, also known as the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), consumers have the right to request validation of debts. This statute requires that debt collectors provide the debtor with certain information to validate the debt upon request. Specifically, the creditor must provide evidence that the debt is accurate and confirm that it is indeed associated with the consumer in question. If this information can not be provided, the items should be removed immediately.

XXXX XXXX : # XXXX 15 USC 1692c states ( c ) Ceasing communication If a consumer notifies a debt collector in writing that the consumer refuses to pay a debt or that the consumer wishes the debt collector to cease further communication with the consumer, the debt collector shall not communicate further with the consumer with respect to such debt, except- ( 1 ) to advise the consumer that the debt collector 's further efforts are being terminated ; ( 2 ) to notify the consumer that the debt collector or creditor may invoke specified remedies which are ordinarily invoked by such debt collector or creditor ; or ( 3 ) where applicable, to notify the consumer that the debt collector or creditor intends to invoke a specified remedy.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request to Block Fraudulent Information on Credit Report Pursuant to FCRA Section 605B and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ) Complainant : XXXX XXXX Complaint Details : I am submitting this complaint to demand prompt action under Section 605B of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 ( a ). Being a victim of identity theft due to a data breach, I am invoking my rights to have inaccurate information removed from my credit file.

Nature of the Issue : As a result of the data breach and subsequent misuse of my Social Security Number ( SSN ) and other sensitive details, I identified unauthorized accounts and transactions on my credit report. These fraudulent entries have harmed my credit profile, as demonstrated by a recent credit denial from my financial institution. 

The items I am disputing and requesting to be blocked are : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Supporting Documentation : I have included the following documentation to substantiate my dispute : A copy of my original dispute letter sent to XXXX, Equifax and XXXX. 

A copy of my government-issued ID and Social Security card for identity verification.

A copy of my Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report.

Legal Basis for the Request : Under FCRA Section 605B, credit reporting agencies must block the reporting of information linked to identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days after receiving the consumers dispute and accompanying evidence. Additionally, 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) requires these agencies to ensure such data is excluded from the consumers credit report and that furnishers of the fraudulent accounts are notified of the block. 



If further information or action is needed from me to resolve this issue, please inform me right away. 

Thank you for addressing this matter promptly. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: I have been disputing the negative mark on my credit report from XXXX XXXX and all three credit bureaus, The transmission went out in my car and I called XXXX to see if they would be able to fix the transmission and I was denied due to the warranty being over by 1 mile. XXXX knew they sold me a lemon to begin with and for them not be willing to fix the transmission and demand the car payments is not right at all. XXXX says the balance on the vehicle loan is {$13000.00} however to replace the transmission on my own would have cost me over {$4000.00} and I don't have that kind of money and is unable to keep up. I asked what else could be done since I could no longer drive the car since the transmission went out and I could no longer keep up with the payments due to financial hardship. XXXX said there was nothing they could do and allowed the car to sit outside of my house for 3 months on purpose so they can put it on my credit as a repossession and put a negative impact on my credit report. After going back and forth with XXXX I asked for my 1099-C to show the debt has been cancelled on their end and they wrote it off as income. When I finally received the 1099-C it does not have my correct address on it. I called XXXX to get answers they told me that I can put the 1099-C on my taxes however they did not mail me a new 1099-C with my correct address which would cause issues. XXXX told me I still owed the debt and the 1099-C form really doesn't mean anything anymore and it can not be used to remove the negative mark on my credit report and the 1099-C is only for my records. I have never lived at the address listed on the 1099-C. The date of identifiable event on the 1099-C is incorrect ; XXXX has XXXX as XX/XX/XXXX however they came and got the none working vehicle in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is identifiable event code ( G ) meaning XXXX made the decision to discontinue collection to pursue payment. XXXX never changed the address on the 1099-C because I never received an updated one which causes a discrepancy with the credit bureaus when I submitted the 1099-C to XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX and filed disputes XXXX all three credit bureaus told me they spoke to XXXX and XXXX told them not to remove the negative mark and all the information on the 1099-C is accurate and that is not correct. I just checked my credit reports and all three credit bureaus have the XXXX negative mark to fall off XXXX of XXXX and it says Paid Off. Which means they came and got the vehicle in XXXX ; because XXXX will be 7 years and by law the credit bureaus have to remove it from my credit report. Also, since the credit bureaus have Paid off regarding this account it should not be on my credit report.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened my first Sofi savings account on XX/XX/year>. At the time, the interest rate they were offering was 4.9 % ( now 4.0 % ), which was not the highest of anyone else, but still good. The additional incentive, and the reason why I went with Sofi, and not a competitor, was the {$300.00} bonus offered for {$5000.00} or more in direct deposits from employers, if received within 25 days. I have both a full-time, W-2 job and a part-time independent contractor job that pay me on a regular basis. By 10/25/24, I exceeded the {$5000.00} in DD 's within 25 days requirement.

But after the 25 days, Sofi only credited me {$50.00}, which is basically the bonus for anyone who meet the requirements for receiving the {$300.00}. I saw this and thought that it must be a mistake, so I contacted Sofi Customer Service. They said that they had created a case and needed two weeks to investigate my issue. Well, two weeks came and went, and there wasn't any follow-up from Sofi to me whatsoever. So I called in, and was told that the investigation had concluded and that I would not be receiving the {$300.00}. The reason given was that my payments from by contracting work looked more like payments than direct deposits (!!? ). Somehow, the payer 's bank had coded them differently from what Sofi wanted.

But I could prove that these were indeed payments for work performed. So Sofi asked me to send in a check stub equivalent, which I then did. The Accounts Manager who was referred to me then said that she would request an exception to their decision, and that I would see a credit " within 1 to 3 business days. '' Well, those days also came and went, also with no follow-up received of any kind from Sofi. So I called in and learned that the appeal was also denied. Sofi continued to insist that the coding they received from the payer 's banker was all that mattered, and that the fact that they were effectively direct deposits for work performed wasn't sufficient.

I then told them that they were a dishonest and terrible company for doing this, and wasting my time and money. I then moved a large chunk of my account to a competitor who is paying a 5 % interest rate. But I've still kept my account at Sofi, and would appreciate some justice and honesty on my behalf, finally, in the form of Sofi making good on the {$300.00} that they owe me.

Consumer complaint narrative: My lease ( # XXXX ) payment was due XX/XX/year>. I paid it via the Ford Motor Credit website the morning of XX/XX/year>. This morning, I received notice that to avoid a late payment, XXXX was charging me {$270.00} in addition to the monthly lease payment of {$840.00}. When I explained that I made the payment on line the morning of the day it was due, I was advised that it did not process that day so to avoid XXXX reporting my payment as late to the CRAs, they charge the {$270.00} fee. This is pure extortion. They control the payment mechanism. If processing takes several days, when they send out the notice of the payment being due, they should warn customers to process it several days in advance. This smells like a trap to suck an extra charge from the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I looked at my Equifax credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XX/XX/XXXX, I opened an account with Green State Credit Union, which is serviced by Upgrade. Throughout the duration of this account, I managed my payments ; however, due to unforeseen circumstances, I was unable to maintain the required payments, resulting in the account being charged off in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Following the charge-off, I did not receive a copy of the IRS Form 1099-C, which is essential for reporting the cancellation of the debt amounting to {$14000.00} to the IRS. This lack of documentation has created confusion regarding my tax obligations and how to properly report this canceled debt. 

Now, in XXXX, I am facing legal action as the company has initiated a lawsuit against me for the same debt that was previously charged off. Compounding this issue, the charge-off is still being reported on my credit report, further negatively impacting my credit score.

Given these circumstances, I am requesting a copy of the 1099-C to comply with IRS guidelines , as well as verification of the charge-off status of this account. It is crucial for me to clarify my financial standing and understand my obligations regarding this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to address the ongoing inaccuracies on my credit report. Despite previous attempts to dispute the following items, they remain unresolved, significantly impacting my ability to obtain credit. I am entitled to monetary compensation under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 6 ), which requires consumer reporting agencies to notify consumers of the results of reinvestigations within five business days after completion. You failed to correct these errors indicates noncompliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Under the FCRA, if disputed items can not be verified, they must be removed from my report. As per 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( Civil Liability for Negligent Noncompliance ), your agency may be held liable for failing to comply with federal law. Additionally, 15 U.S. Code 1692k holds entities accountable for violations related to debt collection. Any continued failure to address these inaccuracies in a timely manner will result in further legal action. Charge-Off Accounts listed below must be DELETED IMMEDIATELY! du
e to violations of FDCPA Section 807 ( False and Misleading Representations ) and These accounts are falsely reported as charge-offs.

Collection Accounts Collection accounts listed below is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( Permissible Purposes of Consumer Reports ). These must be DELETED in my report immediately.

Unauthorized Inquiries listed below were made without my authorization, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( 1 ) ( A ) ( B ) ( i ) ( 3 ). They must be deleted from my report.

DELETE THIS ACCOUNTS IN MY CREDIT REPORT IMMEDIATELY!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative: My accounts was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, MO. XXXX XXXX XX/XX/2024 Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Regarding Improper Use of My Credit File To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for violations of federal statutes related to the improper use of my credit file, reporting of information without consent, and failure to comply with legal obligations regarding debt reporting and income recognition. 
1. Unauthorized Use and Reporting of Credit Information : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to comply with 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which specifies permissible purposes for obtaining and using consumer credit reports. I never provided written consent for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to report any information to my credit file. According to 16 CFR 313.7, financial institutions must obtain explicit authorization from consumers before sharing nonpublic personal information unless an exception applies, none of which are applicable here. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 6802, financial institutions are required to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of their information-sharing policies and practices, which XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to do. Their actions also appear to violate 15 U.S.C. 6805, which empowers regulatory bodies to enforce these provisions. 
2. Lack of Transparency and Consumer Rights Violations : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has disregarded my consumer rights by failing to provide adequate notice or obtain my written consent before furnishing information to credit reporting agencies. This omission violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ). Their noncompliance with transparency requirements and failure to respect the confidentiality of my personal financial information is concerning. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX practices to determine whether they are in violation of federal laws, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 68026805 ( GLBAs financial privacy rules ) ; 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( FCRAs permissible purposes for credit reporting ) ; 16 CFR 313.7 ( GLBA privacy and opt-out regulations ). Additionally, I request clarification and appropriate remediation regarding : The unauthorized reporting of information to credit bureaus without my explicit written consent. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your assistance in ensuring compliance and protecting my rights as a consumer. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX and XXXX for their failure to address my disputes regarding the inaccurate reporting of timeshare accounts on my consumer credit reports. 

Per my divorce decree, the timeshares listed on my credit reports are to be the sole property of my ex-husband. Specifically, under the section titled ** '' Additional Clauses '' **, the decree states : * '' In regards to timeshares purchased during the marriage, ALL timeshares will become the sole property ex-husband. Wife will be held harmless of any matters regarding these properties. " * Despite multiple disputes submitted to XXXX and XXXX, these timeshares remain inaccurately reported on my credit reports. This misreporting is causing significant harm to my consumer profile and is severely limiting my ability to secure credit and financing opportunities. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I have attached the following supporting documentation to this complaint for your review : 1. A copy of my divorce decree.

2. A copy of my ID.

3. Proof of address.

4. A copy of the disputed account reporting to XXXX and XXXX. 

I respectfully request the CFPB 's assistance in ensuring that these timeshare accounts are promptly removed from my consumer credit reports as they no longer pertain to me under the terms of my divorce decree. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

I have attached a photo of my ID and utility bill which shows my current address and the proper spelling of it.

You are not authorized to report my Social Security Number on my credit report or sell any information containing my Social Security Number to any company. Reporting my Social Security Number on my consumer report arises a safety issue and opens me up to potential identity theft. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system.

So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft.

This is a violation of both 15 U.S. Code 1681b ( 2 ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2. This leads way to civil liability against the credit reporting agency for negligent and willful noncompliance under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which allows for {$1000.00} per violation, for account listed without my expressed written consent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
My account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX was never late! I have had exceptional payment history witH XXXX  XXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment.

This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! 

I demand the late payment reported in to be removed. 

They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law!

15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. 

XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX never sent the periodic statement along with the disclosures from section 1637 ( b ).

I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. 

This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer! 

Delete the late payments from my consumer reports

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I looked at my Equifax credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generally, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

And according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: My accounts was never late! I have had exceptional payment history with XXXX XXXXXXXX and all payments were placed on Autopay. This late payment that is reporting is a result on a systematic error on their end processing my payment. This was clearly a billing error made my the company and is not a reflection of my payment experience which violates USC Code 1681eb. This error has caused severe hard to my reputation, my character, my mode of living and to my family! I demand the late payment reported to be removed/updated. They are not in compliance with the following law. 15 USC 1666b and its requirements set the standards and the guidance for a creditor to treat a payment as late, yet they are reporting a payment as late and they did not comply with the law! 15 USC 1666b ( a ) Time to make payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. I have requested proof that this information was mailed or delivered 21 days before the payment due date and this information was requested in good faith pursuant rule 1002 and It was never provided. This is unfair, illegal, fraudulent, and not equitable to me as a consumer!

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a copy of my credit report that your company publishes and after reviewing it I found a few items on the report that are inaccurate. The accounts in question are listed below WebBank/fingerhut First Premier XXXX XXXX XXXX Please send me copies of the documents that you have in your files as of this date that you used to verify the accuracy of the accounts listed below. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. 1681g I have the right to demand that you disclose to me all of the documents that you have recorded and retained in your file at the time of this request concerning the accounts that you are reporting in my credit report. Please dont respond to my request by saying that these accounts have been verified. Send me copies of the documents that you have in your files that were used to verify them. 

If you do not have any documentation in your files to verify the accuracy of these disputed accounts then please delete them immediately as required under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) ( i ). By publishing these inaccurate and unverified items on my credit report and distributing them to XXXX parties you are damaging my reputation and credit worthiness. 

Under the FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i, all unverified accounts must be promptly deleted. Therefore, if you are unable to provide me with a copy of the verifiable proof that you have on file for each of the accounts listed below within XXXX days of receipt of this letter then you must remove these accounts from my credit report.

Despite these efforts, these fraudulent accounts remain on my report, causing undue stress and harm to my financial standing.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I see that theres inaccurate information reporting on my consumer reporting that I would like removed. I have sent this request several times. Dear Consumer Department : I have recently reviewed a copy of my consumer report and unfortunately it has come to my attention that some of my personal information is incorrect. If you would please be so kind as to delete this inaccurate information from my credit profile within the next XXXX days, I would greatly appreciate it. Ive listed the details on my personal information in which you are inaccurately reporting and must remove right away. 

Please see below : My name is : XXXX XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER NAMES or aliases, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER NAMES or aliases to be retained or reported. If there are any, please DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID which shows the proper and legal spelling of my full name. 

My current address is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER CURRENT ADDRESSES, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER ADDRESSES to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. I have attached a photo of my ID and utility bill which shows my current address and the proper spelling of it. 

You are not authorized to report my Social Security Number on my credit report or sell any information containing my Social Security Number to any company. Reporting my Social Security Number on my consumer report raises a safety issue and opens me up to potential identity theft. Immediately DELETE any and all Social Security Numbers that your company is reporting on my credit report. 

My Birth Date is : XX/XX/1992 I DO NOT have any requisite OTHER DATES OF BIRTH, and I DO NOT desire any OTHER DATES OF BIRTH to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite telephone numbers, and I DO NOT desire any TELEPHONE NUMBERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite employers and I DO NOT desire any EMPLOYERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

I DO NOT have any requisite spouses nor roommates no co-applicants, and I DO NOT desire any TELEPHONE NUMBERS to be retained or reported, if ANY DELETE NOW or produce PROOF of your legitimate AUTHORITY to retain much less report without infringing my consumer rights. 

Thank you, in advance, for honoring my requests. Its my understanding that you have up to XXXX days to follow through on my requests so if I dont receive any updates from you within that time frame, then I know that these inaccuracies must be removed automatically. Once you have removed the inaccurate information, I would like my full completed and corrected credit reporting showing these changes mailed to the CURRENT ADDRESS : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Thank you, Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Credit inquiries on your report that you don't recognize
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax has failed to properly address unauthorized credit inquiries on my credit report. Despite following the appropriate steps to dispute these inquiries, Equifax has failed to take necessary action, provide adequate responses, or remove the unauthorized inquiries from my credit report. 

To dispute these inquiries I disputed online multiple times, I called into their fraud department, and sent all information via certified mail which they stated would be the way to get them removed. Equifax then failed to return the signed receipt confirming they received it. This also raises concerns about whether my documentation was even reviewed or investigated. Within that certified mail was : An FTC Identity Theft Report, A copy of my Social Security card, A copy of my government-issued identification, Proof of my address ( a utility bill ). 

Equifax failed to conduct a thorough investigation into my dispute. I did not receive a clear explanation or a " method of verification '' regarding the inquiries, as required by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The unauthorized inquiries remain on my credit report, negatively impacting my credit.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request to Block and Delete Accounts Due to Identity Theft Pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally notify you that I have become a victim of identity theft as a result of a recent data breachOF EQUIFAX. In accordance with my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you block and permanently delete any fraudulent accounts, inquiries, or information associated with the identity theft from my credit report. I am also attaching proof that I was a victim of the Equifax data breach, and I kindly request that this information be considered as part of my claim. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within FOUR business days. To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Amount : {$0.00} I am also including an FTC Identity Theft Report with the reference number XXXX to further support my claim of identity theft. This report provides additional documentation of the fraudulent activity linked to the Equifax data breach. As mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, upon receiving this identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are required to block and delete any information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Please find enclosed the following documents to support my claim :. I request that you confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with a written statement once the accounts and information have been blocked and deleted, as required by law. Please ensure that I receive an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that you will act quickly to resolve this issue in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate and fraudulent information appearing on my credit report that violates my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These errors are negatively impacting my creditworthiness, and I demand immediate corrective action.

These debts have not been properly validated. Under 1692g, a collection agency must provide validation of the debt within 30 days of my request. I am formally requesting the following : Verification of Debt : Provide written verification showing the origin of the debt.

Itemization of Debt : Include a detailed breakdown of the principal, interest, fees, and other charges, along with an explanation of how the amount was calculated. Proof of My Liability : Provide all documentation proving the debt belongs to me, such as signed contracts, billing statements, or original agreements.

2. Fraudulent Accounts : The accounts listed above do not belong to me. I have never incurred debts with these companies, nor have I signed any agreements or authorized the use of my name.

Any continued reporting or collection of these debts without proper validation constitutes a violation of the FDCPA and FCRA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX FL XXXX To Whom It May Concern, This letter is regarding accounts XXXX  XXXX XXXX, which you claim I owe {$1400.00} as a duplicate collection. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which you claim I owe {$2800.00}, {$3200.00}, and {$5700.00} on XXXX different collection accounts. This is a formal notice that your claim is disputed. I am requesting validation, made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Fair Credit Reporting Act, along with the corresponding local state laws. Please note that I am requesting " validation '' ; that is, competent evidence bearing my signature, showing that I have ( or ever had ) some contractual obligation to pay you. Please also be aware that any negative mark found on my credit reports ( including XXXX, XXXX, and Equifax ) from your company is a violation of the FCRA & FDCPA ; therefore, if you can not validate the debt, you must request that all credit reporting agencies delete the entry. Pending the outcome of my investigation of any evidence that you submit, you are instructed to take no action that could be detrimental to any of my credit reports. 

Failure to respond within XXXX  days of receipt of this certified letter may result in small claims legal action against your company at my local venue. I would be seeking a minimum of {$1000.00} in damages per violation for : - Defamation- Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud- Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( including but not limited to Section 807-8 ) - Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( including but not limited to Section 623-b ) Please Note : This notice is an attempt to correct your records, and any information received from you will be collected as evidence should any further action be necessary. This is a request for information only, and is not a statement, election, or waiver of status. My contact information is as follows : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX FL XXXX Last XXXX of XXXX : XXXX P.S. Please be aware that dependent upon your response, I may be detailing any potential issues with your company via an online public press release, including documentation of any potential small claims action. I am also including a copy of my complaint to the organizations below : CC : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau CC : Attorney General 's Office CC : Better Business Bureau

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Illegal Credit Report Inquiry by XXXX XXXX XXXX  FCRA Violation Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX  for unlawfully accessing my credit report in violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ). On XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX & XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX performed a credit inquiry without my authorization or any permissible purpose as defined by the FCRA. 

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681b, companies are required to have a permissible purposesuch as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer, a court order, or a business transaction that requires access to my credit informationto lawfully pull my credit report. I have no such relationship or outstanding debt with XXXX XXXX XXXX  that would justify this inquiry. 

This unauthorized credit pull has negatively affected my credit score and caused undue stress. As such, I am seeking the following : 1. Statutory Damages : Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681n ( a ), I am requesting statutory damages in the amount of {$1000.00} for willful noncompliance with the FCRA.

2. Actual Damages : I have suffered harm, including emotional distress and potential damage to my credit standing, due to this unlawful inquiry. I reserve the right to seek actual damages in addition to statutory damages. 

Please investigate this violation of my consumer rights and take action against XXXX XXXX XXXX  to prevent future illegal activities. I also request that the unauthorized inquiry be removed from my credit report immediately. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter, and I look forward to your timely response. 

Sincerely

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Every year, Equifax either randomly updates my personal information on the file or merges someone else 's credit report with mine, and I have to dispute them every single time. This time around, Equifax updated my date of birth to an incorrect date, and I was asked to provide a driver 's license to prove that the DOB should be updated. I uploaded my driver 's license as requested, but Equifax declined my dispute and kept asking me to upload my driver 's license without providing any explanation. For the last turn, I even uploaded my passport in addition to my driver 's license, and it was still rejected without any reason. So, I ran into a dead end with the wrong DOB on my profile, and theres no way for me to prove that DOB is incorrect. My personal information on the other 2 credit bureaus is correct, and I never ran into issues, but I currently am not able to fix this issue with Equifax.
