Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report. It shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1691i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information as appropriate, based on the results of the investigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am demanding immediate clarification regarding the method of verification your bureau uses to confirm the accuracy of disputed items on my credit report. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to know exactly how disputed items are verified. I expect you to provide me with complete transparency about the following : The exact process or method your bureau uses to verify disputed items. 
The identity of the entity/entities responsible for carrying out this verification. 
Any documentation or evidence used to support the accuracy of the disputed items. 
I am fully aware of my rights under the FCRA, and I expect full compliance with this request. If you can not provide verifiable proof for these items.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Request to Block and Delete Accounts Due to Identity Theft Pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ) To Whom It May Concern : I am writing to formally notify you that I have become a victim of identity theft as a result of a recent data breachOF EQUIFAX. In accordance with my rights under 15 USC 1681c-2 ( a ), I am requesting that you block and permanently delete any fraudulent accounts, inquiries, or information associated with the identity theft from my credit report. I am also attaching proof that I was a victim of the Equifax data breach, and I kindly request that this information be considered as part of my claim. I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within FOUR business days. To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Amount : {$0.00} I am also including an FTC Identity Theft Report with the reference number XXXX to further support my claim of identity theft. This report provides additional documentation of the fraudulent activity linked to the Equifax data breach. As mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, upon receiving this identity theft report, credit reporting agencies are required to block and delete any information identified as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Please find enclosed the following documents to support my claim :. I request that you confirm receipt of this letter and provide me with a written statement once the accounts and information have been blocked and deleted, as required by law. Please ensure that I receive an updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I trust that you will act quickly to resolve this issue in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, Re : Pre-Arbitration Dispute Resolution Request I am writing to formally initiate the pre-arbitration dispute resolution process as outlined in the arbitration agreement between myself and Equifax. I have encountered unresolved issues with my credit report that I have attempted to address through the dispute process but have not received a satisfactory resolution. 

Despite submitting multiple disputes and providing the necessary documentation to correct inaccuracies on my credit file, I have yet to see any meaningful progress in resolving these matters. Specifically, I am dissatisfied with the ongoing failure to address the discrepancies and the repeated letters stating that my credit profile can not be located, which I believe is unacceptable and does not comply with applicable laws. 

Given that these issues have remained unresolved and in accordance with the arbitration agreement, I am now taking the necessary steps to attempt an amicable resolution before proceeding with arbitration. This letter serves as my formal request to initiate the pre-arbitration process in good faith, and I seek to resolve this matter promptly. 

Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide further instructions on the next steps in this pre-arbitration process. If additional documentation or information is needed to proceed, I am happy to provide it. 

I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of these issues. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX and Equifax are reporting inaccurate information on my credit report. And continue to violate 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION. This erroneous information is ruining my credibility, and I would like it removed entirely from my credit report. List of inaccurate information : the reporting of XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX is inaccurate and must be deleted as INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes the reporting of these accounts Inaccurate. Once again, 15 U.S. Code 8 16815-2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting Information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency If the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the data is inaccurate. Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility. Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by the IRS. Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report the canceled debt as gross Income on your tax return. The IRS Clearly defines a charge-off as Gross or Ordinary Income. INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT, which makes your reporting of this account Inaccurate. Both XXXX XXXX and XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX are inaccurate and must be removed.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am requesting the information regarding the method of verification employed by your bureau to confirm the accuracy of disputed items on my credit report. 

As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), consumers have the right to know how disputed items on their credit reports are verified. Therefore, I kindly request that you provide me with detailed information regarding the following : The specific method or process used by your bureau to verify disputed items. 
The identity of the entity or entities responsible for conducting the verification process. 

Any documentation or evidence used to substantiate the accuracy of the disputed items.

Issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative:
I XXXX XXXX, a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, was on XXXX seeking an editor when XXXX XXXX contacted me and forwarded a list of his credentials, also re-directing me to his website, XXXX He then sent a contract/service agreement. 
Agreement attached. 

XXXX XXXX representing XXXX, signed a contract/ agreement and collected {$3000.00}, advertising under section 5 A. that our collaboration would be from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX. The dates advertised nor the collaboration were provided. I'm attaching the contract/ agreement, emails, and a copy of the actual work schedule performed, verifying the infraction. 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX cashed an Official Check from XXXX XXXX XXXX in the amount of {$1500.00} from the remitter, XXXX XXXX XXXX . This ratified the stipulation in the service agreement under section 5 A.

A prepayment of {$1500.00} ( in US dollars ), representing one-third of the final total Fee for the project, is to be paid by the Client to the Editor as a deposit when this Service Agreement is signed by the Client and returned to the Editor.

Upon receipt of the signed Service Agreement and the deposit, the Editor will book and hold the work dates in his schedule for completing his work on the project.

The dates were not held as per the contract as shown in his own words. 
XXXX XXXX Wed, XX/XX/XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX Hello, XXXX -- The end of XXXX is here -- but Im afraid I got severely sidetracked in the past few weeks with some family matters that encroached on my time -- and I could really use another week or ten days to finish up the editing job for you in the best manner possible, for both the book content and the back cover. I hope that this delay doesnt mess up your plans for the books publication and release in any significant way. My apologies for not meeting the deadline!

ORS 646.638. 1 The Unlawful Trade Practices Act prohibits many practices, most of them involving some form of deception or misrepresentation by the seller, I was contractually led to believe that XXXX XXXX and I would be collaborating solely on my manuscript from XX/XX/XXXX until XX/XX/XXXX. This involved, deception and misrepresentation, by the seller.

An additional prepayment of {$1500.00} ( in US dollars ), representing one-third of the final total Fee for the project, is to be paid as a deposit when the Client delivers to the Editor the full draft of the manuscript ready for editing. This full draft is due to be delivered by the Client to the Editor on or before XX/XX/XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX cashed an additional official check from the 'XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX for the sum of {$1500.00} US dollars from me XXXX XXXX pursuant to this stipulation in the contract agreement.

A final payment of {$1500.00} ( in US dollars ), representing one-third of the final total Fee for the project, is to be paid by the Client within five days after the fully edited manuscript has been delivered by the Editor to the Client, and approved by the Client. This fully edited manuscript is due to be delivered by the Editor to the Client on or before XX/XX/XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX Wed, XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX XXXX Hello XXXX -- Sorry I missed your phone call last evening -- sorry also for this long extended delay on finishing up XXXX XXXX XXXX -- I just got myself way too overbooked with editing projects that need finishing up, plus continued intrusions from other responsibilities -- we had XXXX XXXX XXXX  on the XXXX and my wife and I have needed to help look after the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Plus our churchs pastor had me preach the sermon at our church on the XXXX while he had to be away, and thats something I rarely do, and had to spend a huge amount of time preparing for. HOWEVER I am back at editing XXXX XXXX XXXX this week, and I really hope to be able to finish up by some time next week.

The contract/agreement stipulated under section 3 that a full copyedited and proofread draft was to be delivered on or before XX/XX/XXXX. 
3. DELIVERY AND PROJECT SCHEDULE The schedule for completion of the Editors work is as follows.

The Editor is to deliver to the Client the following content component ( s ) : full copyedited and proofread draft ; scheduled delivery of such component ( s ) by the Editor to the Client is to be on or before XX/XX/XXXX by means of electronic mail in the following format : XXXX XXXX file ( s ). 

RE : XXXX XXXX XXXXfinished EDIT XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX Thanks again, XXXX, for the privilege of working for you on this project, and for your hard work in bringing your story onto the written page, and especially for your faith in the Lord and your knowledge of Gods Word that is so evident in this story.

The statement from the XXXX XXXX XXXX email further confirm that XXXX XXXX was not working exclusively on my manuscript as I was led to believe and purchased under section 5. A in the contract/ agreement. Upon receipt of the signed Service Agreement and the deposit, the Editor will BOOK and HOLD the WORK DATES in his schedule for completing his work on the project. 

The XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX email confirms that what I paid for and we both signed was sixty six days in breach. 

On XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX wrote : Thanks much, XXXX XXXX for getting back to me with your concerns about the edit for your unique and appealing book. So in the attached files ( including the XXXX XXXX XXXX ), I have definitely corrected the things you pointed out that were clearly my mistakes. 
One hundred and ninety days after collecting a retainer for a stipulated deadline, and twelve days after forwarding the manuscript entitled, Finished edit, XXXX XXXX admits in writing that there are mistakes, Plural, that I the author, not the editor, had to point out, which were clearly his fault.

ORS 646.607 reads in part : ( 2 ) Fails to deliver all or any portion of real estate, goods or services as promised, and upon request of the customer, fails to refund any money that has been received from the customer that was for the purchase of the undelivered real estate, goods or services and that is not retained by the seller pursuant to any right, claim or defense asserted in good faith. This subsection does not create a warranty obligation and does not apply to a dispute over the quality of real estate, goods or services delivered to a customer ; I believe that these statements prove that the contract/agreement was breached several times. On XX/XX/XXXX, I forwarded a demand letter to XXXX XXXX for full reimbursement of the {$3000.00} I paid him. Starting on XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX three times, in which XXXX XXXX continued his charade. On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a complaint at the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, in which XXXX XXXX deceived the court into believing that the contract stated that the case had to be heard in Oregon. XX/XX/XXXX, I filed with the Oregon Attorney Generals office.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am filing a formal complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of an account on my credit report, which I am requesting be removed entirely. The account in question is a XXXX account, where I was listed as an authorized user. Below are the account details : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : [ If available, you can include the last XXXX digits of the account number here ] Reported Balance : {$5200.00} Last Reported Date : XX/XX/XXXX Credit Limit : {$2100.00} Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Account Closed : XX/XX/XXXX The issue at hand is that this account was reported as closed with a balance of {$5200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, despite my role as an authorized user and not the primary account holder. Furthermore, the dispute resolved status showing " subscriber disagrees '' is entirely inaccurate. As an authorized user, I do not hold responsibility for the balance, and the statement is misleading. 

I request the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. The account has been inaccurately reported, and its inclusion is harmful to my credit score and financial well-being. 

Legal Basis for Request : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section XXXX ( a ), furnishers of credit information are required to provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. The current reporting of this account violates the FCRA in the following ways : Inaccurate Reporting : The account was reported as a closed account with an outstanding balance. As an authorized user, I have no legal responsibility for the balance, and this should be reflected in the reporting. 

Dispute Status : The " subscriber disagrees '' status is inaccurate and misleading. This indicates a dispute that I did not initiate or resolve, which is a violation of the FCRA 's requirement for accurate information. 

Failure to Correct Information : The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies and furnishers correct any inaccuracies in a timely manner. The failure to accurately report the account as authorized user status rather than primary account holder is a violation of this obligation. 

Due to these violations, I am requesting that this entire account be removed from my credit report. The incorrect reporting of this account has caused significant harm to my credit and financial standing. 

Potential Legal Action : Should this matter not be resolved in a timely manner, I will consider pursuing legal action for damages under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as I have suffered harm due to inaccurate reporting. Under the FCRA, I am entitled to seek compensatory damages, including actual damages, statutory damages, and punitive damages for the failure to accurately report my credit information. 

I will also explore the option of engaging an attorney who specializes in consumer protection law and credit reporting disputes. A law firm such as The Law Offices of XXXX XXXX XXXX, which specializes in credit report disputes, FCRA violations, and consumer protection, can assist with this matter and pursue appropriate legal remedies if necessary.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the accuracy and validity of a charge-off account that has been reported on my consumer report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., I have the right to accurate and complete information in my credit reports. I believe the information regarding this charge-off account is inaccurate and/or incomplete, and I request an immediate investigation into this matter. 

XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXXXXXX XXXX. Account # : XXXX Please remove the following Fraudulent hard inquiries from my credit report. 

XXXX - XX/XX/year> Applicable Legal Basis for Di

spute 1. Verification Requirement ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : - The FCRA mandates that all disputed information be verified within 30 days of a consumers dispute. If the information can not be verified, it must be corrected or deleted.

2. Obligation of Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : - Consumer reporting agencies must ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. The inaccurate or unverifiable information regarding the charge-off account violates this requirement.

3. Re-Aging of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c ) : - The FCRA prohibits re-aging of old debt. If the date of first delinquency is inaccurately reported, the charge-off may appear on my credit report longer than the allowed 7 years.

4. Validation of Debt ( Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : - Under the FDCPA, if the debt is being collected by a third party, I have the right to request validation of the debt, including proof of ownership and the amount owed. If the creditor or collection agency can not validate the debt, it must be removed.

However, they continued to charge interest and late fees on top of the amount that was being disputed while they were investigating the original dispute, so by the time the credit was given for the disputed fees and interest, there was a balance on the account from new late fees and finance changes. An interest charge on XX/XX/XXXX for {$19.00}, another interest charge on XXXX for {$21.00}, a late fee of {$30.00} on XX/XX/XXXX a late fee of {$40.00} on XX/XX/XXXX and a minimum interest charge of {$2.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. I contacted Comenity on XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX to try and resolve this but as of today XX/XX/XXXX the balance on the account is XXXX, this blanace is from fees and interest that were charged on top of the original fees while it was being disputed. All balnces incured from purchases have been paid off. Altough Comenitly credited some fees and interest, they didn't stop the clock on other fees and interest, while the dispute for the original fees was being investigated and they refused to correct their error. They are also reporting to the credit bureaus that I am not paying my credit card bill.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> I noticed XXXX  transactions on my business checking account under the caption of pending transactions that were both fraudulent. I immediately contacted Wells Fargo Bank support department to report this fraud. I was told that they could not help me since the department that handles small business checking accounts was closed. I requested that the agent put a freeze on the account until I would be able to speak to the correct department at XXXX XXXX  the next morning. I was advised by the agent that she could not do it. I asked to speak with her supervisor who basically told me the same thing. At XXXX : ; XXXX XXXX  sharp, I spoke with the correct department & they told me that the money had already been taken out of my account. They advised me to file a complaint with Wells Fargo Bank which I did on the phone with them at that time. The first correspondence that I received back from the bank was a denial of my claim. I contacted the bank again & was told that I could appeal the decision. I immediately appealed the decision & on XX/XX/year> received an answer from Wells Fargo Bank ( letter attached ) which indicated that they credited my account for the amount that was taken by using XXXX but that they could not refund me the money that was taken by wire transfer. They acknowledged in there letter that they knew the both transactions were unauthorized.. I feel that since I had nothing to do with these transactions & that they acknowledged that they were unauthorized, that there security protocol was voilated & they should be responsible for the wire transfer as well.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
On or around the XXXX or XXXX week in XX/XX/XXXX, I contacted the law offices of Moody , Jones & Ingino , P.A. in an effort to try and resolve the debt I owed related to a prior loan with XXXX XXXX. Moody , Jones & Ingino , P.A. is located at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, FL XXXX. Their phone number is XXXX. 

The firm informed me our call was being recorded. I expressed my intention of taking care of this debt and asked if settlement options were available. The representative I spoke with indicated they would settle my debt for {$13000.00}. I asked if she could see if they would consider {$7500.00} instead. The representative said she would check with the attorney and call me back. 

I received a call back the next day and the tone of this representative had completely changed. She informed me that they had done a very thorough research of my case and had discovered that I sold my home in XXXX of this year. She proceeded to lecture me about how I owed this debt and that I had an obligation to pay this and should have done so from the proceeds of the sale of my home. I explained that the property I sold was done through a short sale and that I had not received ANY compensation whatsoever from the sale. I also told her the property was my homestead exempt property where I had lived for 9 years with my young daughter and that at closing, I had completed a homestead affidavit confirming this was our primary residence. I also told the representative that although I still had a head of household exemption from wage garnishment because my daughter is still a dependent, I was still hoping to resolve the debt if possible. The representative informed me I had NOT completed a homestead affidavit ( instead implying I had lied about this ) saying, We know you didnt file one because we would have challenged it in court if you had.. I was very upset by her accusation that I had lied about something very serious and didnt understand why they couldnt have confirmed this on their own and known I was being truthful. I became even more concerned when she told me, Now, we will not only NOT consider a lower amount than {$13000.00}, but the initial offer we made of {$13000.00} is now off the table since you had property proceeds you should have used to pay this debt and you did not pay it. This creditor informed me that as a result of my refusal to pay this debt from the sale of my home and as a result of me lying about having a homestead exempt property ; they would now not settle for any amount less than the original debt of {$20000.00}. This creditor refused to honor a settlement they had offered the previous day and were punishing me because I sold my home ( a homestead exempt property ) and didnt pay them from that sale. The representative continued to threaten me by saying, We will be proceeding with domesticating your final judgment to Georgia and will pursue repayment of this debt there since we know now that you have property there. I do NOT own property in Georgia or anywhere ( again something they know via the public records search she said they did ) and I was very upset that they were now also threatening me with legal action and accusing me of having property they know I dont have. I dont own any real estate since my home was sold in the short sale in XXXX. 

I had an attorney send them a formal letter around XX/XX/XXXX again offering a settlement amount and asking for a copy of the phone recording where these comments and threats were made, but they have refused to provide this recording or honor the previous settlement amount of {$13000.00} they had offered on the prior call. The attorney who wrote this letter was only retained for the purpose of writing that letter. I have not retained an attorney for the abusive and threatening debt collection practices. This creditor is punishing me by clawing back a previous settlement offered. The creditor continues to refuse to provide the phone recording because they know it will prove they violated debt collection practices. The creditor admitted they will no longer offer this settlement because I sold a homestead exempt property. The creditor accused me of lying about having an homestead exempt property and accused me of lying about filing a homestead affidavit. This creditor threatened me with legal action to seize property in Georgia they know I do not have. Please let me know what options I have for holding this creditor accountable for their abusive and threatening practices. 

I am not denying I owe a debt. I was trying to do the right thing by reaching out to this creditor to try and resolve the debt and simply want this creditor to be held accountable for adhering to debt collection practices they well know they are obligated to follow. 

Thank you, XXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: I received several calls from representative claiming to be from Bank of America. This happened on XX/XX/year>. They called at approximately XXXX XXXX. The number they called from is XXXX which is the same phone number is the bank of my debit card. They had all my personal information and they said that they needed to assist me because there was fraud on my account. They needed to transfer my money to a new account in order to avoid my funds to be taken due to fraudulent charges. They asked me to sign in to my account and do a couple things on there that I am not familiar with. I told them I was not familiar and I didnt feel comfortable doing that they sent me notifications and they confirmed my information and their phone number so everything seem legitimate. After I got off the phone with them. I received some emails from Bank of America saying we noticed some transactions on your account. At that point I felt something was wrong and I called the bank. 2 hours after receiving the fraud call I called the bank and told them what happened. I told them I didnt authorize and had no knowledge because I was tricked and fooled into logging into my account. The bank promised to freeze my account and place the transaction on hold. They also said that they would contact the other bank to let them know it was fraud. My account had a fraudulent wire transfer for {$1500.00} placed on hold and my account was frozen. How ever the next day the transaction was allowed to go through without my consent and the funds were stolen and taken from my account. I am a single mom and I do t have much. I dont have money for food or for the holidays. I have never used a wire transfer before and I am so confused as to why the bank would allow the transaction to go through after I explained to them that it was fraud because of the representatives impersonation of the bank and the calls I got directly from their phone number. Bank of America is not being helpful. This is all the money I had to pay my bills and this is extremely stressful and upsetting.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally detail a complaint regarding JP Morgan Chase Bank and its handling of the process to release our land located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX. The delays, lack of communication, and mismanagement throughout this process have caused significant inconvenience, financial loss, and frustration. 

I contacted Chases Land Transactions department on or approximately on XX/XX/year>, when I informed Chase early XXXX that we had an initial closing date of XX/XX/year>. At that time, I was assigned a file number ( XXXX ). On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email from Land Transactions stating it would take five days to review my request. Later that same day, an eight-page packet was emailed to me by the Land Transactions department to complete and return to a contact person named XXXX XXXX XXXX 

While I was relieved to finally have a point of contact, this did not improve the communication or responsiveness. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent XXXX an email ( XXXX ) and the Land Transactions department an email seeking clarification on some verbiage in the eight-page packet. I received no response from either entity. On XX/XX/XXXX, I followed up with another email to check on the status of my earlier inquiry, but again, there was no response. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I emailed XXXX to confirm whether the eight-page packet I sent by fax had been received. I also sent the packet via certified mail with payment of appraisal and processing fees and needed the confirmation they had started the process with the originals. Despite my efforts, I did not receive a response. On XX/XX/XXXX, after receiving confirmation that the documents were delivered by certified mail from my tracking number, I emailed again to inquire about the status but still did not receive a response. Taking into account I sent two live checks with the packet for {$300.00} and {$500.00} dollars. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received an email after several attempts from the Land Transactions department stating that my packet had been received in the mailroom but had not yet been directed to the appropriate department for scanning. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, when I emailed to check on the status again, my email was automatically returned, indicating that my emails were being blocked by the Land Transactions department. 

I waited a few days and emailed again on XX/XX/XXXX, followed by additional emails on XX/XX/XXXX. None of these emails were acknowledged, and I received no response. 

Finally, on XX/XX/XXXX, I received a voice message from XXXX XXXX in the Land Transactions department stating that she was following up on my emails and that I could call her at XXXX or email her at XXXX. When I called the number, there was no option to leave a voicemail. I emailed her instead, only to receive an automated reply stating that XXXX XXXX was out of the office and would not return until XX/XX/XXXX. Her email instructed me to contact either XXXX XXXX or XXXX XXXX XXXX for assistance. 

I attempted to email XXXX XXXX at XXXX, but I received another automated response stating that she would be out of the office until XX/XX/XXXX. I then emailed XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX with my concerns on XX/XX/XXXX. On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a missed call from XXXX XXXX, but when I tried to return the call to his direct number, XXXX, I was unable to speak with him as he was unavailable. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, after continuing to email several times all three Land Transactions contactsXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX finally replied to one of my emails and later called my husband XXXX that afternoon. She followed up with an email summarizing the items we discussed on the phone, which were points we had already confirmed in previous emails. While I appreciated her effort, the conversation did not resolve the ongoing delays. 

It is important to note that the last attempt by any Chase representative to contact me occurred on XX/XX/year>. Since then, no one from Chase has reached out by phone or email to provide updates or follow-ups on the status of my case. 

This matter is time-sensitive, as we had a closing date for the sale of this property with a buyer back in XXXX. Due to the delays caused by Chase, the original buyer for the property withdrew their offer. While this took place, I later received another offer from a different buyer, I am unable to schedule a closing date because of the continued delay and lack of progress in the land release process. 

Chase has failed to provide : A clear update on the status of my submission. 
An appraisal date or timeline for when the appraisal will be completed. 
An estimate for when the land release process will be finalized. 
The lack of communication, transparency, and proactive engagement from Chases Land Transactions department has been unacceptable. Emails often go unanswered, and none of the direct phone numbers provided for their representativesNicole Scurfield ( XXXX ), XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), and XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) have voicemail, further exacerbating the difficulty in reaching someone and obtaining updates. 

As of today, I have no indication from Chase regarding the status of my submission, no communication about the approximate timeline, and no assurance that the process is moving forward. This has caused unnecessary stress, hindered my ability to finalize the sale of the property, and resulted in financial losses. 

I request your assistance in addressing this issue and holding JP Morgan Chase Bank accountable for their inadequate service, lack of communication, and overall mismanagement of this process. 
Account number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Texas XXXX SS # XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information and Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Permanent Opt-Out To : XXXX, ChexSystems, and XXXX Dear Representatives, I am writing to address XXXX separate but related matters : XXXX. A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my XXXX, ChexSystems, and XXXX consumer disclosure reports. 
XXXX. A request for a permanent security freeze and permanent opt-out on my consumer file. 
________________________________________ Part XXXX : Dispute of Inaccurate Information Description : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information contained in my consumer reports from XXXX, ChexSystems, and XXXX. Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
The issues pertain to the following : XXXX. Inaccuracies : Specific inaccuracies in my reports are highlighted in the attached documentation. These inaccuracies affect the accuracy and integrity of my consumer data. 
XXXX. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided. 
Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I identified the following discrepancy that requires immediate correction : Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX. 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX. 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX  Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX  Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX I request a manual review of this information due to the complexity of the inaccuracies. I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX, ChexSystems, and XXXX conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXX, ChexSystems, and XXXX Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : XXXX. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports. 
XXXX. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken. 
XXXX. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports. 
XXXX. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information. 
o Sources consulted during the investigation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX : # XXXX, XXXX : # XXXX has violated my rights.

And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 1681B ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding JP Morgan Chase Bank and its handling of the release process for land located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Texas XXXX. The delays, lack of communication, and mismanagement throughout this process have caused significant inconvenience, financial loss, and undue stress.

In addition to the challenges detailed below, I paid a non-refundable {$500.00} appraisal fee and a non-refundable {$300.00} processing fee, as required by Chase Bank. Despite paying these fees, there has been no meaningful progress or clear communication regarding the status of my case.

Critical Impact : Lost Buyer Due to Delays The most significant consequence of Chase Banks inaction is the loss of the original buyer for the property. We had an agreed-upon closing date of XX/XX/scrub> 2024

, but Chases failure to attend to my application in a timely manner forced us to push back the closing date twice. The buyer eventually withdrew their offer, citing the continued uncertainty and delays. While I have since received another offer from a different buyer, I am unable to proceed with the sale because Chase has still not finalized the land release process. To date, I have no timeline for when this will be completed, nor have I received any updates or clarity from Chase regarding the status of my case. Breach of Duty and Financial Harm As a financial institution, JP Morgan Chase Bank has a fiduciary duty to act with reasonable care and diligence in the performance of its contractual and administrative responsibilities. The delays and lack of transparency in processing my land release request represent a breach of this duty. The resulting financial harm includes : Direct monetary loss : The non-refundable {$500.00} appraisal fee and {$300.00} processing fee have not resulted in any progress or actionable outcomes. Loss of the original buyer : The delays caused by Chase directly led to the withdrawal of the initial buyer, resulting in lost time and potential financial implications due to market conditions. Stress and inconvenience : The prolonged delays, coupled with the lack of communication, have caused significant emotional distress and hindered my ability to resolve this matter efficiently. Summary of Events and Delays [ Retain the summary as outlined earlier, including communication attempts and blocked emails. ] Legal and Regulatory Implications The failure of Chase Bank to communicate effectively and process my request in a timely manner may be in violation of federal and state consumer protection laws, including but not limited to regulations enforced by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency. Under principles of good faith and fair dealing, Chase Bank is obligated to manage customer accounts and related transactions in a manner that does not create unnecessary delays, financial losses, or stress. By failing to meet these obligations, the bank has created a situation of negligence and may be liable for damages arising from these actions. Additionally, the lack of a clear timeline, coupled with blocked communications and unavailability of key representatives, suggests a failure to adhere to regulatory standards of service required of financial institutions. Request for Resolution I respectfully request your assistance in addressing this issue and holding JP Morgan Chase Bank accountable for the following : Failing to provide a clear and timely update on the status of my submission. Not completing the appraisal or providing a timeline for its completion, despite accepting non-refundable fees for the service. Causing the loss of the original buyer for my property due to delays in processing my application. Failing to provide transparency, effective communication, and accountability throughout this process. I further request an evaluation of my eligibility for reimbursement of the non-refundable fees, given that the services promised in exchange for these payments have not been delivered. The delays and mismanagement by JP Morgan Chase Bank have caused significant financial harm, the loss of an original buyer, and undue emotional distress. I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to take immediate action to address this matter and ensure compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against [ Financial Institutions Name ] Regarding Unlawful Account Block Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am writing to formally lodge a complaint against Citibank N.A for their mishandling of my account, repeated refusal to verify my identity despite valid documentation, and misleading responses provided during the complaint resolution process. Below is a detailed account of the situation : Background : On Monday, XX/XX/year>, I attempted to use my ATM card to pay for car repairs, but the transaction was declined with the message account not found, despite sufficient funds in my account. Upon contacting Citibank customer service, I was informed that a block had been placed on my account due to an inability to verify my identity. I was told the issue would be resolved within XXXX hours. However, the block remained active well beyond that timeframe. 

Key Issues : Failure to Verify Identity in Person : On XX/XX/year>, I visited the branch where I had originally opened my account, bringing two forms of valid government-issued identification ( Florida ID card and Social Security card ). Despite presenting these documents and being recognized by the branch manager, the fraud department refused to lift the block, citing their inability to verify my phone number. They insisted on sending a letter with a reference code instead, delaying the resolution process unnecessarily.

Refusal to Accept Adequate Documentation : Upon receiving the reference code and contacting the fraud department, I provided the required information. Nevertheless, I was informed that I now needed to present a sealed court order verifying a name change. I explained that I am a survivor of domestic violence and that releasing this sealed document could compromise my safety. All my identification documents, including my U.S. passport, state ID, and Social Security card, reflect the name on the account, making this additional request unreasonable. 

False Claims Made to CFPB : I previously filed a complaint with the CFPB regarding this matter, under COMPLAINT ID XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. Citibank ] responded to that complaint by falsely claiming that mail sent to my address had been returned and that I needed to visit a branch with proof of name change and address verification. This is untrue, as I successfully received their letter with the reference code and promptly contacted them. I am attaching said letter in the next steps. Despite this, they continued to demand the sealed court order without providing clear, written instructions on their requirements.

Violation of Consumer Rights : Citibank has displayed a lack of transparency and accountability throughout this process. They have imposed unreasonable and inconsistent barriers to verifying my identity, ignored my valid concerns as a domestic violence survivor, and provided conflicting information to both me and the CFPB.

Impact : The block on my account has caused severe inconvenience and financial hardship, as I have been unable to access my funds for essential expenses. The handling of this matter has caused me significant stress and has undermined my trust in Citibank N.A.

Requested Resolution : I request the CFPBs assistance in addressing the following : Immediate Action : Ensure that Citibank N.A. provides clear, consistent instructions on how to resolve this matter and lifts the block on my account without further unreasonable demands.

Release of Funds : Require Citibank N.A. to immediately release my funds in full.

Compensation : Direct Citibank N.A. to compensate me {$1500.00} for the undue stress, inconvenience, and financial hardship caused by their mishandling of this situation.

Accountability : Investigate the misleading and false statements made by Citibank N.A. in response to my initial complaint.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information and Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Permanent Opt-Out To : XXXX XXXX, and ARS Dear Representatives, I am writing to address two separate but related matters : 1. A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my XXXX, XXXX, and ARS consumer disclosure reports.

2. A request for a permanent security freeze and permanent opt-out on my consumer file.

________________________________________ Part 1 : Dispute of Inaccurate Information Description : I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate information contained in my consumer reports from XXXX, XXXX, and ARS. Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

The issues pertain to the following : 1. Inaccuracies : Specific inaccuracies in my reports are highlighted in the attached documentation. These inaccuracies affect the accuracy and integrity of my consumer data.

2. Failure to Validate Debt : As per 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ), there has been a lack of validation for the debts in question. No clear and accurate description of the debts or evidence of contractual obligation has been provided.

Upon reviewing my consumer reports, I identified the following discrepancy that requires immediate correction : Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX. 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX. 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX 
Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name UPSTART XXXX XXXX XXXX 
Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : MIDLANDCRE Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX XXXX Dispute Account XXXX XXXX Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX Dispute Account XXXX : Account Name : XXXX  XXXX Account Number : XXXX Dispute Reason Code : XXXX - Inaccurate Information Explanation : I have never held an account with this number under the name XXXX  XXXX I request a manual review of this information due to the complexity of the inaccuracies. I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX, XXXX, and ARS conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXX, XXXX, and ARS Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports.

2. Provide me with a detailed written statement of the investigation results and any actions taken.

3. Send me an updated copy of my corrected consumer reports.

4. Address the following specific details regarding your investigation : o Methods used to verify the disputed information. 
o Sources consulted during the investigation.

o Documentation reviewed to support verification.

o Verification process and criteria used.

o A timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested, to be provided within fifteen ( 15 ) days of the completion of your investigation. Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed.

Additionally, I request a description of the procedures used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the disputed information and the contact details of each person consulted regarding this account. Please also provide copies of any documents bearing my signature that establish a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the amount in question. 
Failure to correct these inaccuracies within 30 days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Requested Actions : 1. Conduct a thorough investigation of the disputed accounts.

2. Remove the inaccurate information from my credit report.

3. Provide me with a written statement detailing the outcome of your investigation.

4. Send a corrected copy of my credit report to my address above.

5. Methods Used : Please describe the specific methods and procedures used to verify the disputed information.

6. Sources Consulted : Provide a list of all sources, including creditors or data furnishers, consulted during the investigation.

7. Documentation Reviewed : Detail any documentation or evidence reviewed to support the verification of the disputed information.

8. Verification Process : Explain how the accuracy of the information was verified and the criteria used for validation.

9. Timeline of Investigation : Outline the timeline of the investigation, including key dates and actions taken.

Additional Requests : 1. Procedure Description : Be advised that the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information is hereby requested. This should include a detailed explanation of how the reinvestigation was conducted and the specific steps taken.

2. Contacts : Additionally, please provide the name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account.

3. Documents Bearing Signature : I am formally requesting a copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay the exact amount claimed.

Failure to respond satisfactorily within 30 days of receipt of this certified letter may result in a small claims action against your company, seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Defamation 2. Negligent Enablement of Identity Fraud 3. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act 4. Violations of the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau regulations ________________________________________ Part 2 : Request for Permanent Security Freeze and Opt-Out I also request the following actions to ensure the security and privacy of my consumer data : 1. Place a permanent security freeze on my consumer file to prevent unauthorized access or use of my personal information.

2. Permanently opt me out of all pre-approved credit and insurance offers, marketing campaigns, and data-sharing programs.

Personal Information for Verification : Enclosed are copies of my driver 's license and a utility bill for verification purposes. Please confirm in writing once these actions have been completed or if additional information is required.

________________________________________ Relevant Laws : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Compliance procedures for maximum possible accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681i : Procedures for disputed accuracy.

15 U.S.C. 1681c : Requirements for information in consumer reports.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : Validation of debt details and original creditor information.

________________________________________ Thank you for your attention to these matters. I look forward to your response within the timeframes mandated by the FCRA. Please contact me at [ Insert Phone ] or [ Insert Email ] if you require further clarification.

This includes communication via telephone, email, text message, or reporting the account on my consumer credit report. The only communication I permit is via written correspondence mailed to my address solely to confirm the permanent deletion of this account from all records. Furthermore, I am disputing this debt and formally requesting a complete method of verification for this account. I am deeply concerned about the validity and accuracy of the information being reported. Specifically, I demand answers to the following : Details of Investigation : What evidence did your representatives uncover that led them to conclude this account is being reported accurately and legally? Certified Documents Reviewed : What certified documents were obtained to validate this account? Please provide copies. Investigation Communication : Provide a complete copy of all information transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. Communication with Data Furnisher : Did your representatives directly communicate with the party reporting this information? If yes : a. Who was contacted? b. What was their role? c. When was the contact made? d. What was the nature and duration of the conversation? Employee Competency : Provide details about the employee ( s ) involved in the investigation : a.

Name and position. b. Length of employment with your company. c. Training provided to them for handling disputes of this nature. Documentation : Copies of all correspondence, emails, or communication related to the investigation. Proof of the timely procurement of all required certified documents. Delinquency Details : Provide the specific date the delinquency commenced and the expected date of cessation of reporting for this account. I also request that your response include a notarized affidavit attesting to the accuracy and completeness of the information provided. Note that any form-letter or template response will be deemed unacceptable, as my dispute is specific and demands a case-by-case review. If you can not provide ALL of the above information in a timely and complete manner as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection laws, I demand the immediate permanent removal of this account from all records. Case Law Supporting This Dispute XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Established that debt collectors must adhere strictly to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), including rules around permissible communication and disputes. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Emphasizes the importance of accuracy and completeness in consumer reporting and the need for thorough investigation and validation when a consumer disputes information. XXXX vXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Held that debt collectors must conduct meaningful investigations when disputes are raised, and failure to do so can result in liability under the FCRA. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) : Affirmed the right of consumers to hold furnishers liable for failing to investigate disputes accurately and properly. Failure to comply with this notice will result in further action, including complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potential legal action to enforce my rights under federal law. I trust you will handle this matter promptly and in compliance with the law.

Sub-issue: Closing disclosure or other related disclosures
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX of XXXX  I was referred to a lending agent to see if I qualified to by my first home. 
She said I was approved and gave me the name of her friend who is a real estate agent. I already found the house I wanted to put an offer on, but needed an agent to view it. 
After seeing it, I made an offer at the price they were asking {$450.00}, that night the agent called me and said they declined ( even thou they had no other offers and I did offer asking price ), so she suggested we offer {$450.00}, I agreed only if seller paid all closing costs. 

Not being familiar with the whole house purchase process, I assumed between the lender and realtor, they would know what closing costs would total. When I later saw the figure of {$9000.00} I assumed that was the closing costs amount they figured and closing costs meant except for escrow and appraisal fee, I would not have to pay anything at closing. Again, first time home buyer here and I was not walked through any process except the short conversations we had. 

So we start the process ( both lender and realtor knowing my finances, my budget and my limits $ ) Long story short I wound up paying {$8000.00} for a very high rate with no explanation, I also had to come up with over {$4000.00} at cash to close, witch I was not expecting. My lender also went XXXX for the week leading up to closing, she did not return calls or emails to me me or the realtor. 

I reached out to the company she worked with, her supervisor had to take over and close loan. Not only was it rushed through, but at the XXXX hour I felt extreme pressure to sign even thou the terms were not as originally what was agreed upon. I had already given notice of where I was renting and was alos going through a medical issue, so postponing and starting over and loosing my escow money was not an option I could afford. 

My needs as a buyer were not of concern, I felt extremely mislead and I feel it was ethically wrong.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am filing this complaint against Portfolio Recovery for violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), specifically under 15 U.S.C. 1692c regarding improper communication practices. 

Details of the Violation 1. Improper Contact at My Workplace : Portfolio Recovery has repeatedly called my workplace seeking payment for a debt, despite my employers policies prohibiting such communication. Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( a ) ( 3 ), debt collectors are prohibited from contacting consumers at their place of employment if they have reason to know such communication is not allowed. 
2. Continued Communication After Notice : Despite my verbal notification that the debt they are inquiring about is not mine, Portfolio Recovery has continued to contact me, creating unnecessary stress and disruption at my workplace. 

Evidence Attached To support my claims, I have included the following : A record of the calls made to my workplace, including dates and times. 
Statements from colleagues or supervisors confirming these calls and their impact. 
Any other correspondence demonstrating the debt collectors repeated contact despite being informed of the issue. 

Request for Relief I request that the CFPB investigate this matter thoroughly and take appropriate enforcement actions against Portfolio Recovery for these violations. Specifically, I ask that : The debt collector cease all communication with me at my workplace. 
Appropriate penalties be imposed for violating the FDCPA. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please contact me if additional information is required. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to lodge a formal complaint and request an investigation regarding a charged-off account, Account name : GM FINANCIAL XXXX Account number : XXXX inaccurately reported by a creditor. Specifically, the creditor has unlawfully reported a charged-off account while simultaneously reflecting a balance on my credit report. This reporting practice violates my rights under federal law, including the Internal Revenue Code ( Title 26 ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, I have not received a 1099-C from the creditor, which is required when debt is canceled, discharged, or otherwise written off.

Basis for Complaint Failure to Issue 1099-C as Required by IRC 6050P Under the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC 6050P ), a creditor is obligated to issue a Form 1099-C when a debt of {$600.00} or more is canceled or charged off. The absence of a 1099-C creates ambiguity about the legal status of the account. It is a clear indication of noncompliance with federal tax reporting requirements and calls into question the validity of the continued reporting of any balance.

Inconsistent Reporting of a Charged-Off Account By reporting the account as " charged-off '' while still reflecting a balance, the creditor is engaging in inconsistent and inaccurate reporting. A " charge-off '' designation signifies that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible and ceased collection activities. Therefore, any balance reported is misleading and violates the accuracy standards required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). 

Court Precedent : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank, the court held that once a debt is charged off, it can not simultaneously remain active for reporting purposes or accrue interest. This precedent underscores that reporting a charged-off debt with a balance constitutes a misrepresentation of the debt 's legal status and harms the consumers creditworthiness. 

Violations of Law IRC 6050P requires creditors to issue a Form 1099-C for debts deemed canceled, charged-off, or discharged. The failure to comply violates federal tax law.

FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) mandates that information furnished to credit reporting agencies must be accurate and not misleading. The continued reporting of a balance on a charged-off account is inconsistent, inaccurate, and unlawful.

Requested Actions I respectfully request that the CFPB : Investigate the creditors noncompliance with IRC 6050P, particularly the failure to issue a Form 1099-C ; Require the creditor to clarify the legal status of the charged-off account and correct any inaccurate reporting ; Direct the creditor and credit reporting agencies to remove the charged-off account and balance from my credit report ; Enforce compliance with the FCRA and federal tax laws to prevent further violations of my rights.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint against USAA Federal Savings Bank regarding improper credit reporting and their failure to provide adequate notice of a missed payment, resulting in significant damage to my credit score despite my documented history of responsible financial management.

Background of Banking Relationship : I have maintained an active account with USAA since XXXX, consistently demonstrating responsible financial management through perfect payment history. Until this incident, I have never had a missed payment with USAA. 

In XXXX of XXXX, I attempted to set up automatic payments for my USAA credit card account. Despite my belief that autopay was properly established, a payment was missed. Most concerning is USAA 's complete failure to notify me of this missed payment through any communication channel - no mail, email, phone calls, or mobile app notifications were received. I only discovered the delinquency when my card was declined during a transaction on XX/XX/XXXX Upon discovering this issue on XX/XX/XXXX, I made an immediate payment of {$1000.00}, covering both the overdue balance and the next month 's payment Despite my immediate corrective action and long-standing excellent payment history, USAA representatives refused to address the situation appropriately. On XX/XX/XXXX I spoke with XXXX separate USAA agents who declined to remove the negative credit reporting or acknowledge USAA 's failure to provide proper notification. 

This incident directly parallels USAA 's previously documented violations reported by the CFPB in XXXX, specifically : 1. Systemic failure to provide adequate customer notifications 2. Improper handling of credit reporting disputes 3. Failure to honor customer payment arrangements 4. Deceptive practices in account servicing 5. Inadequate customer service response to disputes The consequences of USAA 's actions have been severe : - Credit score drop from XXXX to XXXX - Potential risk of increased interest rates on existing credit accounts- Time and resources spent attempting to resolve this issue I respectfully request the CFPB to investigate USAA 's notification practices and compliance with consumer protection laws. I additionally request that CFPB XXXX USAA to remove the negative credit reporting given their failure to provide proper notice, review USAA 's current customer service practices regarding credit reporting disputes, and examine USAA 's autopay system setup and confirmation procedures. 

This complaint is filed under the Consumer Financial Protection Act of XXXX, which prohibits unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAP ) in consumer financial services. USAA 's actions appear to violate multiple consumer protection regulations, including requirements for proper notice of missed payments and fair credit reporting practices. 

I am prepared to provide any documentation or information required to support this complaint. The failure of USAA to provide proper notification and their subsequent refusal to correct their error has caused significant financial and personal hardship. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response and assistance in resolving this situation.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In relation to complaint ID number : XXXX. 

I am submitting additional evidence and clarification to my initial complaint regarding USAA Federal Savings Banks resequencing of debit transactions. Their practices have manipulated my account balances, creating conditions that could lead to overdraft fees. 

Detailed Evidence of Resequencing 1. Payment Timeline on XX/XX/XXXX : Initial Balance : {$1700.00} ( paycheck deposit of {$1400.00} ). 
Transactions Chronologically Made on XX/XX/XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
XXXX. XXXX Transaction from XX/XX/XXXX : This {$33.00} transaction was pending and repeatedly deducted at various points, artificially reducing my balance multiple times during the day. For example : After the XXXX payment, the XXXX transaction appeared to lower my balance to {$1600.00}. 
After the XXXX XXXX payment, the same {$33.00} was deducted again, lowering my balance to {$1300.00}. 
This pattern continued multiple times, further confusing my balances. 
3. Resequencing on XX/XX/XXXX : The next day, transactions were rearranged, placing larger amounts like the {$650.00} XXXX purchase at the top. This artificially reduced my balance to {$240.00}, followed by XXXX at {$110.00}, XXXX XXXX at {$94.00}, and so on. 
This resequencing disproportionately lowered my balances, creating opportunities for overdraft fees. 

Violation of Consumer Protection Laws USAAs resequencing practices appear to violate : 1. Electronic Fund Transfer Act ( EFTA ) : Protects consumers from deceptive practices related to electronic transactions. 
2. Dodd-Frank Act : Prohibits unfair, deceptive, and abusive practices. 
3. Truth in Savings Act ( TISA ) : Requires accurate disclosure of how transactions affect account balances. 

These practices are deceptive and harmful, manipulating balances to create overdraft conditions.
