Consumer complaint narrative: I had a virtual Applecard with the XXXX XXXX  issued by Goldman Sachs. I only used it to purchase a phone for my son XXXX  years ago and after paying his phone off, I had a {$0.00} balance on that card. I kept the credit limit of almost {$3000.00} open. I had the card stored in my Apple XXXX  and locked the card from any usage from my phone or devices in my house. Then this past XXXX, I get a message from Applecard saying I now had a balance of almost {$3000.00} where the card was maxed out down to the very last penny of my credit limit. I was shocked and quite upset since I did not use that card and its extremely suspicious that the charges were down to the very last penny of my available credit limit. That looks like someone used a bot to hack my Applecard and steal my available credit limit. I immediately called Goldman Sachs and told them what happened. It was put through their dispute team and I was told by everyone I talked to that I will not be held responsible for any unauthorized charges I did not make. The dispute with them went on for months where they removed the charges but then kept putting about {$800.00} back on me when these charges were unauthorized. I closed my Applecard where I did research on this and saw that this same exact thing happened to lots of people where their virtual Applecard got hacked and someone racked up their cards, maxing them out. They also said Goldman Sachs kept putting the charges back on them. Ive had many credit cards and Ive never had any of this happen to my accounts. They notify me of all purchases but I never got any notifications from Applecard. Some of the people posting about this problem said they went through CFPB about this very same problem with Applecard fraud and your organization resolved it for them. Hopefully you will be able to resolve this for me as well. Ive been plagued with Goldman Sachs putting the disputed unauthorized charges back on me when I didnt even use that card and actually had it locked from any use in my wallet app. The representatives I spoke to about this problem kept saying not to worry, I wont be held responsible for any unauthorized charges but they keep putting {$850.00} back on me. Its frustrating.

Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I mailed my payment of {$38.00} ( to pay bill in full ) which was due on XX/XX/year>. My payment posted on XX/XX/year> ( 2 days late-even though it was sent 8 days before the due date ) I received a statement in XXXX stating I owed a late fee of {$29.00}. I called XX/XX/year> and spoke with XXXX about having late fee removed since the account was paid in full. He explained that he could not take care of this and referred me to his supervisor, XXXX. She said they would not remove the late fee. I explained to her that I did not owe this and would not be paying it since the account was paid in full. I then asked her to close my account as I would no longer be doing business with their company. 
On XX/XX/year> I was charged an additional {$29.00} plus interest bringing my new total to {$60.00}. 
On XX/XX/year> I called yet again and spoke with XXXX. I explained how these charges were fraudulent as I paid my account in full and also closed the account. This company has called me multiple times in their attempt to retrieve payments.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Damage caused or loss of personal items in vehicle during the actual repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : XXXX XXXX and XXXX Violations, Request for Return of Belongings, Full Refund of Payments, and Legal Investigation XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Dear Ally Financial, I am writing to formally submit a complaint regarding the repossession of my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and to request immediate action. I believe that both Ally Financial and the dealership are responsible for multiple violations, including violations of the XXXX XXXX and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), as well as improper handling of the repossession and theft of my personal belongings. 

XXXX XXXX Violations and TILA Concerns : Within XXXX weeks of purchasing the vehicle, I notified the dealership that the vehicle was defective and identified it as a lemon. Despite this notification, I received no follow-up or resolution, leaving me feeling helpless and vulnerable. Additionally, I am concerned that the terms of the financing, particularly the high-interest rate, XXXX violate the Truth in Lending Act ( XXXX ), warranting a review of the financial practices surrounding this loan. 

Repossession of Vehicle and Theft of Belongings : My vehicle was repossessed at night, and I have serious concerns about the legality of this repossession. As the lender, it is Ally Financials responsibility to provide evidence that the repossession was legal and conducted in compliance with all relevant laws. Since the repossession occurred at night, I request that you provide clear proof showing that all legal requirements were met.

Furthermore, my personal belongings were left in the vehicle at the time of repossession. I have made multiple attempts to contact the repossession company regarding the return of my property, but I have not received any information. I demand the immediate return of all my belongings.

Request for Immediate Action : Given these issues, I am requesting the following : 1. Immediate return of all personal belongings left in the vehicle at the time of repossession.

2. A full refund of all payments made on the vehicle, including down payments, monthly payments, and any fees paid to Ally Financial, plus interest.

3. A formal investigation into the legality of the repossession, including evidence showing compliance with the law, particularly regarding the nighttime repossession.

4. A review of the vehicles defects under Lemon Law and acknowledgment of Ally Financials responsibility for the defective vehicle and potentially unfair financing terms under TILA.

Next Steps : If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will escalate my complaint to the Attorney Generals office, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and other appropriate authorities. I am also prepared to pursue legal action to hold both Ally Financial and the dealership accountable for their actions. 

I expect a prompt response and resolution to this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
So I lost all my identity documents, so I had to make out a police report. So i've been in the process of ordering all my reports since my Identity Protection Service that I signed up for, showed me that a phone number was listed on a fraud alert, that I did not place. The phone did not even belong to me. So I decided to request all my reports. I have been documenting the date to which I ordered my reports.

So today I got a report that came from telecheck, when I go to looking over the report I notice that last 4 of the social is incorrect. And the last 4 digits of the license number isn't my either. But the report has my Name on it. But I didn't order the report from telecheck. Because when I looked back in my notes, I don't have a date next to them saying when i ordered it. So someone is messing with my information. 

I also want to report that someone has also made a clone of my phone and everything about it including the my number. And I have noticed that my computer is act funny as well and there is web pages and documents that are popping up that doesn't belong to me. So I feel as though someone is intentionally trying to make me out to be a criminal. And it's possibly the same person that has stolen all my Personal identifying documents.

I know for a fact the statement I have made is true because, I came in contact with a person that had one of the phones that keeps popping up as devices signed into my personal account. They have also been changing my personal info about me.

The way I came in contact with this person is because when I ordered a uber. XXXX automatically assigned my pickup location, and it was literally Less then a 10 min walk from my apartment. so instead of cancelling I walked to where it had me being picked up at, I found a guy exactly where i was supposed to be pickup at, sitting. So I make conversation with him and he was waiting for his XXXX. I didn't ask any questions because I didn't want trouble. But I noticed that he is always somewhere while I'm out. So he has been falling me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT I am writing to formally dispute the handling of my Sephora Visa Credit Card account ( ending in XXXX ), specifically concerning the returned payment made on XX/XX/XXXX, and the subsequent imposition of late fees and adverse credit reporting. 

According to your correspondence dated XX/XX/XXXX, my minimum payment was received on the due date but was later returned, resulting in my account becoming past due. This sequence of events has caused late fees, elevated payment requirements, and negative credit reporting, which I believe were improperly imposed.

This situation appears to violate protections provided under the Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ). I reference XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), in which the Third Circuit Court of Appeals ruled in favor of the consumer, emphasizing the creditors obligation to properly investigate and resolve billing disputes. In that case, the court affirmed that creditors must take reasonable actions to ensure billing accuracy and to resolve disputes in good faith. The return of my paymentfor reasons beyond my controland the resulting penalties similarly constitute a potential billing error under the FCBA.

I request the following corrective actions : A comprehensive investigation into why my payment was returned.

Immediate reversal of all late fees and penalties imposed since the XX/XX/XXXX, payment. 

Correction of any negative information reported to credit bureaus as a result of this error.

A detailed written explanation of your findings and the steps you have taken to address this matter.

Under the FCBA, I am entitled to a timely and adequate response. I expect confirmation that my concerns are being investigated within 30 days of receiving. Failure to address these issues appropriately may compel me to escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau or pursue further legal remedies.

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please respond to this letter in writing at the address provided above. If you require further information or documentation, do not hesitate to contact me.

Thank you for your cooperation. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX ] All Rights Reserved Without Prejudice

Consumer complaint narrative:
Credit Control , LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Request for Debt Validation Dear Credit Control , LLC, I am writing to formally dispute an alleged debt that has been reported by your company. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting full validation of this debt, as I have no recollection of any agreement or obligation to pay the amount claimed.

Please provide the following information to validate this debt : 1. The name and address of the original creditor ( XXXX XXXX, if applicable ). 
2. The name on file of the alleged debtor.

3. The alleged account number.

4. The address on file for the alleged debtor.

5. The amount of the alleged debt, including any fees or interest added.

6. The date the alleged debt became payable.

7. The date of the original charge-off or delinquency.

8. Whether this debt was assigned to your company or purchased. If purchased, specify the amount paid for the debt.

9. The commission for the debt if collection efforts are successful.

Additionally, I request copies of the following : 1. The agreement or contract that grants your company the authority to collect this alleged debt.

2. Any signed agreement that I have made with your company or any verifiable proof that I have a contractual obligation to pay this debt.

3. Any other agreement bearing my signature wherein I agreed to pay this debt.

4. All statements for this account while it was active.

5. Any insurance claims made by any creditor regarding this account.

6. Any judgments obtained by any creditor regarding this account.

Please also provide the name and address of your bonding agent in case legal action becomes necessary.

You are required to return this completed form along with copies of all requested information, assignments, or other transfer agreements, which would establish your rights to collect this alleged debt, within 30 calendar days from the date of receipt of this letter.

If you can not provide the requested documentation, I request that the alleged debt be removed from my credit report immediately, as I am exercising my rights under the FDCPA.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Prior to the XXXX XXXX, I was current on all my debt. Due to the pandemic I began to default on my revolving debt and auto loan. Pursuant to the CARES Act, most of my creditors negotiated a settlement payment or provided a forbearance. CitiBank , N.A . choose to charge-off my account after XX/XX/year> and during the pandemic. Several years later, they sold the charged-off debt to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, Illinois, XXXX Dear XXXX, This letter is being sent to you in response to a recent charge of {$2700.00} that was made on my credit report that I do not recognize.

Due to this fact, if any negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by your company or the company that you represent, I will not hesitate in bringing legal action against you and your client for the following : Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, Violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, and Defamation of Character. 
If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity must cease and desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint recorded Notice of Default ( NOD ) without notice or explanation to me, while loan modification is still pending. 
XX/XX/XXXX : Submitted a new loan modification under XXXX direction.

XX/XX/XXXX : Shellpoint denied my loan modification with no clear explanation.

Shellpoint must honor SLSs signed agreement. This refusal to act in good faith violates federal law, threatening my home and familys future. Please intervene to resolve. All I ask is for Shellpoint to honor the approved loan modification so this nightmare ends.

SECOND ATTEMPT, EXERCISING CONSUMER RIGHTS OF12 CFR 1006.34 - Notice for validation of debts. 

To whom it may concern : I am responding to the letter you sent dated about a debt you are trying to collect. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( g ). This claim is being disputed and a debt validation is requested. I also have reason to believe that you are in violation of 15 USC 1692e. False or misleading representations as defined ( 3 ) The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section.After the case with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the Consumer Federal Protection Bureaus ( CFPB ) took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX their illegal debt collection and credit reporting practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect on disputed debts using unlawful collection letters and misrepresentation. The CFPB stated that XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debt that was NOT substantiated after consumers disputed the validity of the debt conducted an investigation and found that XXXX sent collection letters to consumers who DISPUTED the validity or accuracy of their purported debts, even though XXXX had NOT obtained substantiation for the debts. As a debt collection, the CFPB states you are required to have a reasonable basis for assertion that a consumer owes the purported debt if a dispute is submitted. As a result, the CFPB required XXXX XXXX XXXX to pay redress to affected consumer and pay a {$1.00} XXXX penalty to the CFPBs victim relief fund. 

The CFPB outlined a list of requests we, as consumer, can ask for when we are seeking proper validation of debt to ensure you are ethically seeking debt legally. I have requested a proper validation of debt for the past 2-3 months YET you have not provided me with the substantiated information the CFPB outlines and you continue to have this alleged account reported on my consumer report? A PROPER validation of debt address EACH item of validation that I am requesting. You can find each request listed below. 

The account in question is listed below : LVNV FUNDING - XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX - Notice for validation of debts. - PLEASE PROVIDE ME WITH A PROPER VALIDATION OF DEBT. I DO NOT RECALL DOING BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY, SO I AM REQUESTING AN INVESRTIGATION. IF YOU CAN NOT PROVIDE ME WITH SUPPLEMENTAL DOCUMENTATION PROVING THIS DEBT BELONGS TO ME, PLEASE DELETE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CREDIT REPORT. 

Please provide me with a proper validation of debt. If you can not provide me with the documentations I am request, please request to have this account permanently remove from my credit report and the debt permanently discharge. 

I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 

Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Please provide verification by line item ( with explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the alleged items was, were the goods/services received, what were the goods/services received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor.

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 

If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 

The obligation between you and I that allows you to collect on the alleged debt and any transactions between your company that binds me to an agreement to pay your company any money that you claim I owe. 

Proof of photo identification ( i.e., drivers license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) that was presented to you at the time of incurring this alleged debt. 

Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Please show me proof that this debt was actually sold to you. ) The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 

State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 

If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 

If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. 

In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 

Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 

Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 

Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt. 

I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? 

If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

( Enclosed is a copy of the list of your licenses. I found this document on the XXXX database. I dont see XXXX this list. How are you legally attempting to collect this alleged debt, in a state that youre not licensed in, that you havent properly validated after numerous request- yet still reporting to the credit bureaus which further affects my credit profile and credit score? This sounds to me like Aggravated Identity Theft, per 18 US Code 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft ) If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In hindsight, your agency willing took on this debt willingly that you have not properly validated with me as a LAW ABIDING consumer. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. If a proper validation is not provided, you can not recover this debt to try and collect from me per volenti no fit injuria.

PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT.

PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER.

IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to lodge a formal complaint and request an investigation regarding a charged-off account, Account Name : LVNV FUNDING LLC, Account Number : XXXX, inaccurately reported by a creditor. Specifically, the creditor has unlawfully reported a charged-off account while simultaneously reflecting a balance on my credit report. This reporting practice violates my rights under federal law, including the Internal Revenue Code ( Title 26 ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, I have not received a 1099-C from the creditor, which is required when debt is canceled, discharged, or otherwise written off.

Basis for Complaint : Failure to Issue 1099-C as Required by IRC 6050P.

Under the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC 6050P ), a creditor is obligated to issue a Form 1099-C when a debt of {$600.00} or more is canceled or charged off. The absence of a 1099-C creates ambiguity about the legal status of the account. It is a clear indication of noncompliance with federal tax reporting requirements and calls into question the validity of the continued reporting of any balance. 

Inconsistent Reporting of a Charged-Off Account : By reporting the account as " charged-off '' while still reflecting a balance, the creditor is engaging in inconsistent and inaccurate reporting. A " charge-off '' designation signifies that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible and ceased collection activities. Therefore, any balance reported is misleading and violates the accuracy standards required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). 

Court Precedent : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the court held that once a debt is charged off, it can not simultaneously remain active for reporting purposes or accrue interest. This precedent underscores that reporting a charged-off debt with a balance constitutes a misrepresentation of the debt 's legal status and harms the consumers creditworthiness. 

Violations of Law : IRC 6050P requires creditors to issue a Form 1099-C for debts deemed canceled, charged-off, or discharged. The failure to comply violates federal tax law.

FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) mandates that information furnished to credit reporting agencies must be accurate and not misleading. The continued reporting of a balance on a charged-off account is inconsistent, inaccurate, and unlawful.

Requested Actions : I respectfully request that the CFPB : Investigate the creditors noncompliance with IRC 6050P, particularly the failure to i
ssue a Form 1099-C ; Require the creditor to clarify the legal status of the charged-off account and correct any inaccurate reporting ; Direct the creditor and credit reporting agencies to remove the charged-off account and balance from my credit report ; Enforce compliance with the FCRA and federal tax laws to prevent further violations of my rights.

Consumer complaint narrative: The company said they would send a settlement offer letter stating that my payment would mean that my account is then resolved in full. Therefore, defeating the whole purpose of a settlement letter. I spoke with the original lender XXXX XXXX and asked to receive a settlement letter and was told they DO NOT send letters stating that the account would be paid in full if I make a settlement payment. They clearly stated that they would only send a letter AFTER I submit a payment. Again, that leaves me at risk for the company to then pursue the remaining balance. My rights per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act are being violated as I am entitled to receive a proper settlement letter. Both XXXX XXXX and QCS are failing to provide a clear and complete written agreement. I am willing to settle and want to settle but want a full written settlement agreement letter to be provided so that both parties ( XXXX XXXX/QCS and I ) are protected and that there are misunderstandings and miscommunications. I have provided my current address ( as poor efforts from both companies were made ), I have provided my current phone number and numerous phone call attempts, conversations with management and so far both companies have been uncooperative and misleading.

A formal dispute of inaccurate information on my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Clarity Services , Inc consumer disclosure reports.

Upon reviewing my reports, I identified several discrepancies that I believe to be incorrect and require immediate rectification under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

I have attached highlighted copies of my credit report with the incorrect information clearly marked. Please investigate this matter and remove the inaccurate information from my credit report. Notify me in writing of the results of your investigation and any actions taken. 
Under the FCRA, I am entitled to a thorough and transparent investigation of my dispute. I expect a prompt response to this request. If you fail to provide a detailed description of the investigation process, I will consider filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and may seek legal advice to ensure my rights are protected.

12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) : The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has established requirements for the validation of debts. Under this regulation, the debt collector must provide clear and accurate information about the debt, including a detailed description of the nature of the debt and the original creditor. This requirement has not been met in my case. 
Requested Actions : In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I request that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Clarity Services , Inc conduct a thorough investigation of my dispute, correct the inaccuracies, and provide me with an updated copy of my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Clarity Services , Inc. Consumer Disclosure Report once the corrections have been made. 
I respectfully request the following under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : XXXX. Conduct a thorough investigation of this dispute and remove the inaccurate information from my consumer reports.

Failure to correct these inaccuracies within XXXX  days, as required under the FCRA, may result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear American Express Leadership Team, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to respectfully request a review of the late fee and interest charges totaling {$270.00} that were assessed on my XXXX XXXX XXXX ending in XXXX. 

As a long-time American Express customer with an excellent history across multiple accounts, I value the relationship Ive built with your institution. I had enrolled in autopay for this account to ensure timely payments. However, due to a technical issue, the autopay feature did not activate as intended. Compounding this issue, I was away on an extended business trip in XXXX for two months, which limited my ability to monitor the account as closely as I normally would. 

In the current challenging economic environment, where managing cash flow has become increasingly critical, this unexpected and substantial charge has created additional financial strain. As reported by recent data, many individuals and businesses are grappling with tightening budgets and rising costs. A gesture of goodwill by waiving these charges would not only demonstrate American Expresss commitment to long-standing cardmembers but also align with your reputation for customer-first service during times of need. 

I trust that you will find my request reasonable given my history with American Express and the genuine circumstances surrounding this incident. I am confident that a resolution in this matter will further strengthen my loyalty and appreciation for your organization. 

Thank you for your time and understanding. I look forward to your favorable response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Bank of America, Bank Account XXXX XXXX Dear Bank of America, This letter serves as a Formal Notice of Claim regarding a blatant and unacceptable breach of the terms and agreement governing my account with Bank of America. Your institution has flagrantly violated the contractual terms by unlawfully disclosing my personal and private information, including my transaction history, to a non-affiliated third party, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ). 

Basis of the Claim Your actions are not only a breach of contract but also an egregious violation of my privacy rights. Specifically : Bank of Americas False Claims : You have provided me with written documentation asserting that no information was reported to XXXX XXXX This statement is demonstrably false. 

Irrefutable Evidence : I am in possession of a full report from XXXX XXXX XXXX that includes my personal information and transaction history. This proves that your institution has knowingly or negligently provided my private data to a non-affiliated third party in direct contravention of our agreement. 

This unauthorized disclosure is not only a breach of trust but also a severe violation of applicable privacy laws. 

Immediate Demands As a result of your gross misconduct, I am making the following demands : A monetary settlement of {$10000.00}, which reflects a discounted resolution. Be advised that I am entitled by law to {$1000.00} per violation, and this demand is a courtesy to avoid further escalation. 

An immediate written acknowledgment of the breach and a guarantee that such unauthorized disclosures will cease henceforth. 

A detailed explanation of how this breach occurred and what steps Bank of America will take to rectify the situation and prevent recurrence. 

Consequences of Non-Compliance Bank of America has exactly 10 calendar days from the date of this letter to provide a satisfactory written response and a settlement offer. If I do not receive an acceptable resolution within this timeframe, I will take the following actions without further notice : File a lawsuit for breach of contract and violation of privacy rights. 

Pursue additional statutory damages for every violation documented. 

Report this matter to relevant regulatory authorities, including the state attorneys general. 

Let me be clear : the evidence in my possession unequivocally establishes your liability. Any attempt to deny or deflect responsibility will be met with the full weight of legal action. 

Supporting Documentation For reference, I am prepared to provide : Documentation from Bank of America falsely asserting no information was reported to XXXX XXXX 

A full printout from XXXX XXXX XXXX detailing the unauthorized disclosure of my personal data. 

Please direct your response to the address or email provided above. This matter demands your immediate attention and action. I expect a prompt resolution that reflects the seriousness of your breach and adequately compensates for the harm caused.

Consumer complaint narrative: My son had caused damages to an apartment upon move out inspection ; in the amount of {$360.00}. I was a co-signer. The Management agreed to allow me to participate in a payment plan towards settlement. I dropped off the first payment ( {$90.00} ) & written agreement. In the meantime the Management forwarded the entire balance ( {$360.00} ) without giving me credit for the ( 1 ) payment to Collections ( which should have resulted in approximate {$270.00} balance ). I contacted the Collections Debtor & advised them I am disputing the validity of the Debt which is in my Right. The Collections Debtor proceeded to try and COERCE, BULLY, & HARRASS me into Settling to pay more than what I owed ( they said they would settle the account for {$290.00} ) even though I explained and made it clear I was disputing this debt as valid ; therefore, why would they think I would pay {$290.00} to the Collection Debtor if I am telling them I owe {$270.00}. In my opinion this is unfair and unethical business practice and needs to be investigated and action taken against the debt collector

Consumer complaint narrative:
Cease and Desist Letter From : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, CA XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX To : The Bureaus, Inc.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX Subject : Cease and Desist for Violations of FDCPA and Demand for Deletion of Inaccurate Reporting Dear The Bureaus, Inc. , This letter serves as a formal notice to cease and desist from further violations of my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and to address your continued unlawful actions concerning the alleged debt you purchased from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Details of the Alleged Debt : Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Amount Alleged : {$800.00} Account Number : [ Provide account number if applicable ] Violations : Harassment and Violation of FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692d ) : Your repeated reinsertion of this alleged debt into my consumer credit reports, despite prior disputes and removals, constitutes harassment under 15 USC 1692d. Your actions are abusive, causing me significant emotional distress and financial harm.

Failure to Adhere to the Arbitration Clause : By purchasing this debt, you are now bound by the original XXXX XXXX credit card agreement, which includes a binding arbitration clause. Your failure to honor this agreement is a breach of contract and a clear disregard for the terms governing this account. 

Furnishing Inaccurate Information in Violation of the FCRA : Despite your claims, the information you are furnishing to the credit reporting agencies remains inaccurate, misleading, and damaging. On XX/XX/XXXX, you stated that you asked the CRAs to update information, yet the inaccuracies persist, causing significant harm to my reputation and financial standing. 

Harm Caused : Your actions have resulted in : Defamation of Character : Inaccurate reporting has negatively impacted my reputation. 

Emotional Distress : Your continuous violations have caused anxiety and undue stress. 

Financial Harm : Inaccurate reporting and harassment have adversely affected my ability to secure credit and financial opportunities. 

Legal Basis : Your actions violate the following : FDCPA ( 15 USC 1692d ) : Prohibits harassment and abuse in debt collection.

FCRA ( 15 USC 1681 ) : Requires accurate and fair reporting of consumer credit information.

Breach of Contract : By failing to adhere to the arbitration clause of the XXXX XXXX credit card agreement. 

Case law such as XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) confirms that debt XXXX are held to strict compliance with FDCPA requirements, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) underscores the harm caused by inaccurate reporting under the FCRA. 

Demand : To resolve this matter, you must : Immediately Cease and Desist : Stop all collection activities, including reporting this account to consumer reporting agencies. 

Delete the Trade Line : Remove this account from all credit reporting agencies and confirm permanent deletion.

Acknowledge Breach of Contract : Confirm in writing that you will adhere to the arbitration clause moving forward.

Compensation : Pay {$10000.00} for the defamation, emotional distress, and financial harm your actions have caused. 

This demand must be fulfilled within XXXX  days of the date of this letter. Failure to comply will result in arbitration proceedings under the terms of the XXXX XXXX credit card agreement. Please note that initiating arbitration will incur substantial costs for your company, including over {$3000.00} in filing fees, legal expenses, and potential damages. 

Next Steps : You may contact me in writing at the address listed above or via email at XXXX to confirm your compliance. This letter serves as notice of my intent to protect my rights and pursue legal remedies as necessary. 

This communication is sent in good faith and without waiver of any rights, remedies, or defenses available to me under applicable law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
United Auto credit corp have furnished alleged late payments on my XXXX that you identified as late. 
The only way a creditor can treat a payment as late falls under 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) Time to Make Payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date.

For any creditor to treat a payment as late you must prove the following : 1 ) Each Periodic statement ; and 2 ) The information required under 15 USC 1637 ( b ) of this title ; 3 ) was mailed out or delivered ; 4 ) 21 Days before the payment due date please provide the proof that this information was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

Product: Debt collection
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
There were two flags against my registration reported by MCOA ( at direction of XXXX XXXX Police Department for Speed Camera tickets ). 

I paid the two flags and then paid the two tickets to release my registration. Car has been sitting in garage since XX/XX/XXXX due to registration. I called MCOA after waiting for a reasonable time for the flags and tickets to be cleared, but they said that they would not release the flags/tickets from MVA record until other unreported tickets were paid ( as far back as XXXX ). 

I explained to them that as far as MVA records show, if I pay the flags ( which I did ) and those two listed tickets, they would let me renew my registration. The agent was very unprofessional and insisted that MVA did not know of the other outstanding tickets. I asked then, why weren't they addressed or flagged against my previous registrations period and she said that I had to pay them. It didn't seem fair to pay something that I don't recall. I asked her to send me proof of the tickets and she said that I should have ticket notices of the outstanding violations. I told her that I don't recall those tickets and need proof. She said she would send me proof, but instead sent me a list of all tickets she mentioned on the phone without pictures or proof. just a list. I called back and said that i couldn't see or pay them due to a pin number and citation number.

She said that I can pay through her ( each ticket was {$40.00}, but their fee was {$140.00} for each {$40.00} ticket ). Also, on the list were the two tickets that I already paid ( XXXX and XXXX ). Same flag numbers that were paid in XX/XX/XXXX which appeared again recently in XXXX. 

I called XXXX XXXX Police Department and they said that they didn't have record of payment ( as MCOA only accounted for one after I provided receipt, but yet that paid ticket is on my record again and duplicate flagged ). I am not paying twice for same flags.

I think this is retaliation from me requesting MCOA to stop calling me incessantly. They obtained my number after my initial contact and started harassing me with calls. I was planning on paying the tickets, but now feel taking advantage of with this duplicate ticketing/flagging and also, purging old tickets from 6-7 years ago to add to a current collection. 

XXXX couldn't send me copies of original citations and gave me a site to go on. When i went on the site, I needed a citation number and a pin to see the actual ticket which XXXX said they didn't have or MCOA didn't have. 

The fact that they are re-flagging me is what I'm complaining about. 

Also, I saw a glimpse of vehicles that I owned which were not mine on my MVA record ( I don't remember how to get back to that site ). It said that I owned a XXXX XXXX, a XXXX XXXX XXXX with different VIN # ( never had I owned that year. Mine is XXXX ), and a XXXX XXXX XXXX ( which I remember my mom owned when she was alive, and her name is XXXX XXXX and mine is XXXX XXXX ).

Please advise what to do. I am contemplating reaching out to a lawyer, but saw this site.

Thank you.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
To whom it may concern : I am responding to the letter you sent dated about a debt you are trying to collect. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( g ). This claim is being disputed and a debt validation is requested. I also have reason to believe that you are in violation of 15 USC 1692e. False or misleading representations as defined ( 3 ) The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section. After the case with XXXX XXXX XXXX, the Consumer Federal Protection Bureaus ( CFPB ) took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX to their illegal debt collection and credit reporting practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect on disputed debts using unlawful collection letters and misrepresentation. The CFPB stated that XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debt that was NOT substantiated after consumers disputed the validity of the debt conducted an investigation and found that XXXX sent collection letters to consumers who DISPUTED the validity or accuracy of their purported debts, even though XXXX had NOT obtained substantiation for the debts. As a debt collection, the CFPB states you are required to have a reasonable basis for assertion that a consumer owes the purported debt if a dispute is submitted. As a result, the CFPB required XXXX XXXX XXXX to pay redress to affected consumer and pay a {$1.00} XXXX penalty to the CFPBs victim relief fund. 
The CFPB outlined a list of requests we, as consumer, can ask for when we are seeking proper validation of debt to ensure you are ethically seeking debt legally. I have requested a proper validation of debt for the past 2-3 months YET you have not provided me with the substantiated information the CFPB outlines and you continue to have this alleged account reported on my consumer report? A PROPER validation of debt address EACH item of validation that I am requesting. You can find each request listed below. 
The account in question is listed below : MONTEREY COLLECTION SV - XXXX - 12 CFR 1006.34 - Notice for validation of debts - I believe this account to be inaccurate because I do not recall doing business with this company. Your credit report agency is required to investigate my claims and you have yet to provide me with a solid proof of debt validation generally within 30 days. Since you have yet to do this, please remove this account from my consumer report immediately. This account is currently in litigation. Please delete this account from my credit report immediately. 
Please provide me with a proper validation of debt. If you can not provide me with the documentations I am request, please request to have this account permanently remove from my credit report and the debt permanently discharge. 
I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 
Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Please provide verification by line item ( with explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the alleged items was, were the goods/services received, what were the goods/services received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor.

1 of 3 If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 
Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 
If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 
The obligation between you and I that allows you to collect on the alleged debt and any transactions between your company that binds me to an agreement to pay your company any money that you claim I owe. 
Proof of photo identification ( i.e., drivers license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) that was presented to you at the time of incurring this alleged debt. 
Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Please show me proof that this debt was actually sold to you. ) The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 
State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 
If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 
If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. 
In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 
Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt. 
I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? 
If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
( Enclosed is a copy of the list of your licenses. I found this document on the XXXX database. I dont see VIRGINIA XXXX this list. How are you legally attempting to collect this alleged debt, in a state that youre not licensed in, that you havent properly validated after numerous request- yet still reporting to the credit bureaus which further affects my credit profile and credit score? This sounds to me like Aggravated Identity Theft, per 18 US Code 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft ) If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
2 of 3 I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In hindsight, your agency willing took on this debt willingly that you have not properly validated with me as a LAW ABIDING consumer. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. If a proper validation is not provided, you can not recover this debt to try and collect from me per volenti no fit injuria. 
PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT.

PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER.

IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED. 
WITHOUT PREJUDICE XXXX XXXX UCC1-308 CC : ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF VIRGINIA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CONSUMER FEDERAL PROTECTION BUREAU XXXX XXXX FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Request for Correction of Credit Report Information Dear Equifax Customer Service, I am writing to formally request a correction to the information reported on my credit report regarding my XXXX credit card account. I believe there is an inaccuracy concerning the status of this account.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Discover Financial Services [ Discover Address Subject : Request for Investigation and Removal of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Due to Identity Theft Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing regarding an account associated with my name and Social Security number that is inaccurately being reported on my credit report. I have disputed this account with you previously, but you responded by stating that the account information is accurate and belongs to me. I am informing you again that I am a victim of identity theft, and someone unlawfully used my personal information to open this account. Furthermore, they redirected all correspondence to an address that is not mine.

I have attached a copy of the identity theft report for your reference. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, once a consumer notifies a creditor or reporting agency of identity theft and provides documentation, the account must be blocked or removed from credit reporting within four ( 4 ) business days. Despite this legal requirement, the account continues to be inaccurately reported on my credit report. 

Here are the critical points regarding this matter : Fraudulent Account : The address linked to the account is not mine, nor is it listed on my credit report. I have never received, used, or activated a Discover card.

Charged-Off and Written-Off Account : According to my credit report, the account has been charged off and written off. If the debt was indeed written off and Discover claimed a tax deduction for the amount, you would be required by the IRS to provide me with a Form 1099-C. Failure to do so implies that the reporting of a balance owed is inconsistent and a violation of FCRA standards for accurate reporting.

Violation of FCRA : Reporting inaccurate information on my credit report constitutes a violation of the FCRA. This continued reporting of an account I neither opened nor used, combined with the lack of a Form 1099-C, infringes on my rights and could expose Discover to legal liabilities, including damages. 

Unfair Tax Implications : If the debt were written off and considered taxable income, it would be unjust for me to pay taxes on income related to a fraudulent account I did not open or use. 

Under the FCRA, I am requesting the following : That Discover permanently remove and delete this fraudulent account from my credit report. 

That you cease all reporting of this account to any credit reporting agency. 

Written confirmation that you have taken these steps to rectify the issue. 

I trust that Discover will act in good faith to comply with federal laws and correct this error. If no action is taken, I will have no choice but to seek legal recourse to protect my rights and hold Discover accountable for any violations of the FCRA.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XXXX XXXX, XXXX, I was scammed by a company offering me a job. The company is XXXX located in XXXX XXXX, NV. The HR woman I was emailing is XXXX XXXX. I was unknowingly the victim of fraud. I received 2 checks and deposited the checks into my credit union account. The first check received and deposited was on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$4900.00}. The second check received and deposited was on XX/XX/XXXX in the amount of {$4900.00}. A total of {$9900.00}. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I was starting to realize I had been scammed and started trying to get help from my credit union ( Mountain America Credit Union ). On XX/XX/XXXX I met with a credit union representative. He put a hold on my account and ordered an investigative team to look into the fraudulent activity. I contacted XXXX to alert them to scam that was taking part under the company name. I contacted XXXX XXXX, and the CFO of the company. I received no response. I sent a contact general submission to the company on their website. I received a reply from XXXX XXXX ( sales or customer relations ). She simply relayed that I was scammed. I was unpleasantly surprised and disappointed seeing that XXXX is in the business to help their clients fight identify theft and online security fraud. 

When I called the credit union 's customer care team, I was told that they would credit the amounts to my account while they looked into the matter. I was told that they had 3 months to make a decision. I was told that because I knowingly deposited the fake checks, I was most likely not going to be offered any help, because they do not consider the situation fraud. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I filed and submitted complaint with the FBI. 

I called the credit union customer care several times, at least 6 times from XX/XX/XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX to find out the status of the investigation. Each time I called, I talked with a different customer service rep who was not part of the investigative team. I had to repeat my story each time and was was put on a very long hold while the customer service rep reached out to the investigative team. When the rep returned to the line they had no pertinent update information except to tell me they were working on it and provided no updates during ongoing cases. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I received emails from the credit union informing me that the money that was initially credited to my account for the fake checks were being reversed. 

The reason being because I knowingly and freely deposited the checks into my account, I was at fault and the money was not going to be returned. As with all checks I receive I deposit them into my account, as does any objective person who receives a check. 

The credit union 's investigative team did not conduct a thorough in-depth investigation because they never contacted me for information or details or any other information I would expect to be part of an investigation. 

On XX/XX/XXXX I reported the fraud to the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department, XXXX # XXXX. I also called the FBI on XX/XX/XXXX for any updates on my case/report I filed. I was told it is pending and agents are still looking into it. I do not have a case number. 

I am requesting help from Consumer Protection because I am looking for help into the credit union 's handling of the situation and refunding the total of the fake checks {$9900.00}. 

I was told that the Consumer Protection acts to protect credit union members in the same way that the FDIC protects customers of banks. 

When I contacted National Credit Union Association, I was referred to CFPB. 

Thank you. 
XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Oportun.Inc have furnished alleged late payments on my XXXX, XXXX, XXXX that you identified as late. 
The only way a creditor can treat a payment as late falls under 15 U.S. Code 1666b - Timing of payments ( a ) Time to Make Payments A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or

delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. For any creditor to treat a payment as late you must prove the following : 1 ) Each Periodic statement ; and 2 ) The information required under 15 USC 1637 ( b ) of this title ; 3 ) was mailed out or delivered ; 4 ) 21 Days before the payment due date please provide the proof that this information was mailed out or delivered 21 days before the payment due date.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Received bad information about your loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally complain about the persistent errors, delays, and poor customer service I have experienced since my loans were transferred to MOHELA. Despite numerous attempts to resolve my issues, including long call wait times, inconsistent information from representatives, and system errors that have not been corrected, I have not received adequate resolution. This has led to repeated delinquency notices, failed auto-pay enrollments, and confusion about the status of my loans and forbearance. Below is a detailed timeline of my experience with MOHELA. 

XX/XX/XXXX XXXX transfer to MOHELA was completed Signed up for auto pay XX/XX/XXXX Received a letter that my loans were in forbearance. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX min phone call ) Called MOHELA to question and was told that the loans are not actually in forbearance, but the letter was to inform me that they had previously been in forbearance years prior. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX min ) Received a letter that my loans were delinquent. Called to question since I had signed up for auto pay and was told that my auto pay enrollment XXXX not have been activated in time but it also looked like my loans should be in forbearance. The call escalated and a customer expert did clarify that my loans were in forbearance and they would work to update their information. This did require them to override their system and in doing that, they were going to need to cancel my auto pay. I was informed that the forbearance would end on XX/XX/XXXX and my next payment was due on XX/XX/XXXX. The customer service associate I spoke with informed me that I should be sure to enroll in auto pay prior to XX/XX/XXXX to ensure that I do not receive another delinquency notice. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX hr XXXX and XXXX min call ) Attempted to enroll in auto pay as instructed in the call on XX/XX/XXXX. My MOHELA dashboard still stated that my loans were past due and because of that I would not be able to enroll in auto pay. I called MOHELA ( the automated phone system stated that I am delinquent ) to try to get more information about what was happening and what I should do. The customer service representative was not able to answer my questions stating that from all the documentation on their end, I was not delinquent. My call was sent to a supervisor who stated that the reason all of this happened is because of the XXXX plan I am on. When I stated that I did not believe I was on the XXXX plan, she looked at my profile more closely and agreed that I am not on the XXXX plan. She stated that the federal government extended the forbearance period for student loan borrowers recently for a few weeks, maybe until mid XXXX, but she couldnt be sure when it would end. She then placed me on hold to investigate more. Our call was disconnected and I did not receive a call from her, so after waiting for XXXX minutes, I called again and asked to speak with a supervisor. This new supervisor informed me that signing up for auto pay prior to XX/XX/XXXX would likely not allow auto pay enough time to finalize in time for the payment to actually process on XX/XX/XXXX. She also informed me that from her end of the system, I am showing that I am not delinquent and am in forbearance, but when she impersonates me, she sees the same information I am seeing. She stated that I should not make any payments until I am not in forbearance, but she was not able to tell me when my forbearance would end. She did state that she would escalate my ticket in an attempt to resolve the issue more quickly and that she would also personally check on the ticket but that I should not pay until this gets sorted. Due to all of the misinformation I have received, I requested that she document that I would like a supervisor to review the phone calls from the XXXX and XXXX for the purpose of quality assurance and professional development. She did state that she would pass that request on. 

Also spoke with student aid to request I move to an income driven repayment plan in an attempt to seek XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. They stated I needed to submit paperwork to MOHELA. 

XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX min ) Attempted to submit my request for XXXX to MOHELAs online portal and received an error message multiple attempts in a row. 

I then called MOHELA to question why I was receiving this message and was told that because of the federal governments pause on XXXX plans, they are not taking these requests via the online submission platform and that I would need to mail or fax the paperwork if I wanted it submitted. The message to try again seems odd given that they are not taking these documents electronically. 

XX/XX/XXXX My MOHELA dashboard still states that I am delinquent and that I have another payment due on XX/XX/XXXX. 



XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX hour XXXX min call ) Called again to attempt to get this all figured out and ensure that I would not be receiving another letter that I am delinquent on another month of payments and also to ensure this would not be negatively impacting my credit score. 

On my dashboard I noticed that XXXX of my loans is showing in forbearance until XX/XX/XXXX while the other XXXX loans are showing forbearance until XX/XX/XXXX Representative advised that when things get transferred over, some things may not get transferred over from the previous system to the new system that MOHELA is using. I asked if it is correct that they have XXXX different end dates and the representative stated that she can submit a request to have the forbearance on all of the accounts end at the same time. 

The online MOHELA portal is still showing that I am past due on the XXXX loans. The representative stated that because of the high call volume these tickets are taking longer than expected. I was told on XX/XX/XXXX that it would take XXXX business days. Today is day XXXX and it is not fixed yet but was told that it could take another XXXX  days. When I asked what the ticket was actually submitted for ( past due notice or forbearance end date ) the answer was unclear stating it was a forbearance request escalation. 

Call student aid to request that transfer from MOHELA back to XXXX. 

I stated that if none of these issues can be fixed today, I will be filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. Was transferred to a supervisor. 

Supervisor can adjust the end date of the forbearance to match the others on XX/XX/XXXX. Once the forbearance is adjusted, may take XXXX hours to update the past due on my account portal. 
XX/XX/XXXX Notified that my plan is past due/delinquent but I have enrolled in autopay a number of times since XXXX and it seems to not be sticking. Called but they were closed XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX hr XXXX min call ) Called MOHELA to question the delinquent notice. Waited for XXXX hour and XXXX min for my call to be answered. The rep stated that I appear not to be enrolled in auto pay. I informed him that I have XXXX emails from MOHELA on different dates stating that I have enrolled in auto pay ( see below ). He put me on a brief hold to look into this and returned telling me that it looks like all my payments are going to XXXX account. I do not believe that to be true based on the previous payments I have made manually not showing that. When I questioned him on this, he stated he could transfer me to a specialist. The estimated wait time on the call was XXXX min ( at XXXX XXXX ). I clicked the button to request a call back when my turn is up which should have been about XXXX, but as of XXXX XXXX, I still have not received this return call. 






XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX minute outgoing call XXXX minute incoming call ) I called MOHELA at XXXX XXXX  because I never received a call the day prior as I requested on their call que because I could not wait XXXX minutes. The original hold time to have my call answered was XXXX minutes. The representative who answered my call said I would need to speak to a XXXX to have my issue resolved. She transferred me and the wait time was estimated to be XXXX minutes. I elected again to have my call returned in the order it was received. At XXXX I received their call back from an agent named XXXX ID # XXXX. I was informed that their records do not show that I am in auto pay. She stated that XXXX of my XXXX loans are past due and that maybe only loan XXXX was in auto pay. When I questioned if loan XXXX was actually in auto pay, she stated she was not sure. I asked why I would not be in auto pay when I have emails from them from XXXX and XXXX stating I have requested auto pay and it would take XXXX business days to process. She informed me that it actually takes XXXX billing cycles which is not stated anywhere. I asked why the emails say it takes XXXX business days if it actually takes XXXX billing cycles. She told me she didnt know why my emails would state that. I requested to speak to a supervisor. I was put on hold and XXXX returned to the call stating that she verified what she is telling me is accurate with her supervisor. I asked XXXX more times to speak with the supervisor and was told that the supervisor has not accepting this transfer. I then stated that I would have to file a formal complaint then because I was not getting the service I need and asked if the representative had anything she wanted me to put in my complaint. She stated, Sir, you can put whatever you want in that complaint. A moment later she told me she would be transferring me to a supervisor. I was transferred to a resolution XXXX named Precious ID # XXXX who investigated my concerns and informed me that I should be enrolled in auto pay which should have taken effect for the XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX billing dates. She requested a manual repair and told me I would need to call in again in XXXX business days to confirm that this issue has been resolved.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Charged fees or interest you didn't expect
Consumer complaint narrative: As a consumer I am enforcing my basic consumer rights. I have a right to be informed. I have a right to redress. I have requested my security agreement and disclosure. During this consumer credit transaction which makes the principal the original creditor. And the banks the borrower. In accordance with 12 usc 1431. The power and duties of banks.. the principal is owed interest. I XXXX XXXXagent on behalf of the principal/ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Im here to receive all interest owed to the principal. Also in accordance with 15 usc 1605. The finance charge is the sum of all charges. I would like to express and written to receive and retain all services and changes applicable to the principal. In accordance with the truth-in-lending disclosure. After I receive all services and changes to the finance charge. FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) ( a ) Block. Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information. 

in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than XXXX. 

business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( XXXX ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer. 

( XXXX ) a copy of an identity theft report. 

( XXXX ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( XXXX ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. 

( b ) Notification. A consumer reporting agency shall promptly notify the furnisher of information identified by the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section ( XXXX ) that the information may be a result of identity theft. 

( XXXX ) that an identity theft report has been filed. 

( XXXX ) that a block has been requested under this section; and ( XXXX ) of the effective dates of the block. 

( c ) Authority to decline or rescind. 

( XXXX ) In general. A consumer reporting agency may decline to block, or may rescind any block, of information relating to a consumer under this section, if the consumer reporting agency reasonably determines that ( A ) the information was blocked in error, or a block was requested by the consumer in error ; ( B ) the information was blocked, or a block was requested by the consumer, on the basis of a material misrepresentation of fact by the consumer relevant to the request to block ; or ( C ) the consumer obtained possession of goods, services, or money as a result of the blocked transaction or transactions. 

( XXXX ) Notification to consumer. If a block of information is declined or rescinded under this subsection, the affected consumer. 

shall be notified promptly, in the same manner as consumers are notified of the reinsertion of information under section 1681i. 

( a ) ( XXXX ) ( B ) of this title. 

( XXXX ) Significance of block. For purposes of this subsection, if a consumer reporting agency rescinds a block, the presence of information in the file of a consumer prior to the blocking of such information is not evidence of whether the consumer knew. 

or should have known that the consumer obtained possession of any goods, services, or money as a result of the block. 

( d ) Exception for resellers. 

( XXXX ) No reseller file. This section shall not apply to a consumer reporting agency, if the consumer reporting agency ( A ) is a reseller. 

( B ) is not, at the time of the request of the consumer under subsection ( a ) of this section, otherwise furnishing or reselling a consumer report concerning the information identified by the consumer; and ( C ) informs the consumer, by any means, that the consumer may report the identity theft to the Bureau to obtain consumer information regarding identity theft. 

( XXXX ) Reseller with file. The sole obligation of the consumer reporting agency under this section, with regard to any request of a consumer under this section, shall be to block the consumer report maintained by the consumer reporting agency from any subsequent use, if ( A ) the consumer, in accordance with the provisions of subsection ( a ) of this section, identifies, to a consumer reporting agency, information in the file of the consumer that resulted from identity theft ; and ( B ) the consumer reporting agency is a reseller of the identified information. 

( XXXX ) Notice In carrying out its obligation under paragraph ( XXXX ), the reseller shall promptly provide a notice to the consumer of the decision to block the file. Such notice shall contain the name, address, and telephone number of each consumer reporting. 

agency from which the consumer information was obtained for resale. 

( XXXX ) Exception for verification companies. The provisions of this section do not apply to a check services company, acting as such, which issues authorizations for the purpose of approving or processing negatable instruments, electronic fund transfers, or similar methods of payments, except that, beginning XXXX business days after receipt of information described in paragraphs ( XXXX ) through ( XXXX ) of subsection ( a ) of this section, a check services company shall not report to a national consumer reporting agency described in section. 

1681a ( p ) of this title, any information identified in the subject identity theft report as resulting from identity theft. 

( f ) Access to blocked information by law enforcement agencies. No provision of this section shall be construed as requiring a consumer reporting agency to prevent a Federal, State, or local law enforcement agency from accessing blocked information in a consumer file to which the agency could otherwise obtain access under this subchapter. 

Please send me an updated credit report with deletions of the above accounts removed from my credit report with-in XXXX  days. 

Yours truly, XXXX
