Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Discover Financial Services [ Discover Address Subject : Request for Investigation and Removal of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Due to Identity Theft Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing regarding an account associated with my name and Social Security number that is inaccurately being reported on my credit report. I have disputed this account with you previously, but you responded by stating that the account information is accurate and belongs to me. I am informing you again that I am a victim of identity theft, and someone unlawfully used my personal information to open this account. Furthermore, they redirected all correspondence to an address that is not mine.

I have attached a copy of the identity theft report for your reference. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, once a consumer notifies a creditor or reporting agency of identity theft and provides documentation, the account must be blocked or removed from credit reporting within four ( 4 ) business days. Despite this legal requirement, the account continues to be inaccurately reported on my credit report.

Here are the critical points regarding this matter : Fraudulent Account : The address linked to the account is not mine, nor is it listed on my credit report. I have never received, used, or activated a Discover card.

Charged-Off and Written-Off Account : According to my credit report, the account has been charged off and written off. If the debt was indeed written off and Discover claimed a tax deduction for the amount, you would be required by the IRS to provide me with a Form 1099-C. Failure to do so implies that the reporting of a balance owed is inconsistent and a violation of FCRA standards for accurate reporting.

Violation of FCRA : Reporting inaccurate information on my credit report constitutes a violation of the FCRA. This continued reporting of an account I neither opened nor used, combined with the lack of a Form 1099-C, infringes on my rights and could expose Discover to legal liabilities, including damages.

Unfair Tax Implications : If the debt were written off and considered taxable income, it would be unjust for me to pay taxes on income related to a fraudulent account I did not open or use.

Under the FCRA, I am requesting the following : That Discover permanently remove and delete this fraudulent account from my credit report.

That you cease all reporting of this account to any credit reporting agency.

Written confirmation that you have taken these steps to rectify the issue.

I trust that Discover will act in good faith to comply with federal laws and correct this error. If no action is taken, I will have no choice but to seek legal recourse to protect my rights and hold Discover accountable for any violations of the FCRA.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
I received a certified letter from XXXX XXXX stating that my taxes were delinquent and that they had been purchased. At first, I was calm, I figured it had to be a mistake as we are in escrow. I called the mortgage company, who assured me that it had to be a mistake because they can clearly see- theyve been paying XXXX XXXX taxes and even advised me to look at the depletions from my escrow account. I called XXXX XXXX XXXX to try to get to the bottom of this. They assured me that it was not a mistake and that my taxes were delinquent. We ended up discovering that the parcel numbers were different. They attempted to pay parcel number XXXX ( empty lot ) and the check was voided each year without them noticing. 

The mortgage company was very apologetic and put me on a personal call with XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, where he explained to me that the XXXX party that they used messed up and that they would make them pay for it. I asked him at that time what was going to happen since the amount that they had been charging me for my taxes for the last 3 years was {$1100.00} and my actual taxes are {$4600.00} ( my taxes are also too high because a home occupancy exception was never filled out ) - who pays the difference. At that time he told me that they would make the XXXX XXXX pay for it and that if somehow it does end up being the mortgage companys fault- that they would pay for it. They would never make me pay for their mistake. He also informed me that they were calling XXXX XXXX that day and having them pay for the taxes in full via credit card. 

I thought the nightmare was over. Fast forward to the beginning of XXXX. I logged in to make my payment and saw that my mortgage payment increased from {$1100.00} to {$2600.00}. I was expecting a small increase- of $ XXXX but this is more than double. Upon researching it, I realized that they made my escrow account negative {$14000.00}. Immediately, I called and they informed me that it was the difference in what they should have charged me and what they did charge me. I informed them of what the senior VP XXXX XXXX had told me- they told me that the best they could do was to reach out to him and ask for him to give me a call. He had also given me a direct number for him. I called multiple times and he declined to return my call. I contacted my broker and he informed me that he had spoken to XXXX and that someone from the office was going to call me with the findings. 

I received a call a week later from XXXX of their underlings who informed me that they just told me to say- although it is our fault- it is your responsibility to pay the escrow back. They attempted to blame this on the title company- reviewing my closing documents confirmed that it was in fact the mortgage companys fault. My closing documents have the correct parcel number and XXXX XXXX taxes estimate. After we closed they messed up the parcel numbers. The XXXX XXXX offered me a 1 year term to pay it back and called me back a week later to offer me a 5 year term. I ended up getting diagnosed with Bells palsy so I asked to finish the negotiations on XX/XX/XXXX. That day, I agreed to have them move over the extra principal payments weve made to the escrow account as well as the 5 year term to pay back the escrow account. Both of which were their suggestions. They told me they would finalize it and call me back on the XXXX. I have not received word from them so today XX/XX/XXXX I called to find out that on Monday they denied both requests. They could not tell me why the request were denied. They could not tell me why they would offer me an option that they were not authorized to offer me. They informed me that the escrow would remain at the increase of {$1500.00} and that if I failed to pay it by the XXXX, I would be fined a late fee. 

I have contacted multiple other finance companies and have been informed that because of the current inclined interest rates that I should not refinance to attempt to get away from the negligence and incompetence of XXXX. That it would cause me to lose alot more to refinance.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern : I am sending this letter to you in response to a collection notice I received from you on XX/XX/year>. A copy is attached to this letter. 

Please be advised that this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 US Code 1692g that your claim is disputed and validation is requested. I respectfully request that your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you regarding the following account number ( XXXX ) : COLUMBIA DEBT RECOVERY Account Number : XXXX Please provide me with the following : Agreement with the original creditor that authorizes you to collect on this alleged debt and/or verification that this alleged debt was assigned or sold to you. 
The agreement bearing my signature stating that I have agreed to assume the debt Valid copies of the debt agreement stating the amount of the debt and interest charges Proof that the Statute of Limitations in Washington has not expired Complete payment history on this account along with an accounting of all additional charges being assessed Proof that you are licensed to collect in my state ; and Your license numbers and Registered Agent or Agent of Service. 
This will also serve as your legal notice under the federal Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), to cease all communication with me concerning the alleged debt referenced above. Do not contact me, members of my family, employers, or any other third parties regarding this debt. 

This includes all communication by telephone or electronic communications, such as email or texts made by your company, representatives, or agents. If your offices, representatives, or agents attempt communication with me, members of my family, employers, or any other third parties, it will be considered harassment and I will bring this matter before a judge. 

All future communications with me MUST be done in writing via XXXX and sent to the address noted in this letter. 

Your non-compliance with my request will also be construed as an absolute waiver of all claims to enforce the debt against me and your implied agreement to compensate me for court costs and attorney fees if I am forced to bring this matter before a judge. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company: Rowland Avenue Management, Inc. A/KA Columbia Debt Recovery, LLC d/b/a Genesis

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
AMENDMENT OF PREVIOUS FILED COMPLAINT : On Monday, XX/XX/XXXX, gentleman by name of XXXX XXXX contacted me on behalf of XXXX for alleged debt I owe. I didnt answer the first time, so he called again from a different number. I didnt answer again. Then he called my work, my mother & my father. Which to me is harassment. This was all in the span of 15 minutes. I am not sure how he obtained my parents phone numbers. When he called my mother, she answered not knowing. I then spoke to him. He essentially threatened court & other court-related fees if not paid by that day. I explained I am in no place to pay that much in one day. He offered to give me 2 weeks time to pay. He did not verify the agency he was calling from & posed like he was a law firm. I agreed to pay, not knowing my full rights. I also asked him to no longer call my place of employment or family members. Upon researching his so-called firm, the phone numbers he called from nor the name he gave me of the firm, is available anywhere online through a XXXX search . After further research, it appears he was calling from AA Recovery Solutions.

The phone numbers he called from are as followed : ( XXXX ) XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX On voicemail he left, number was XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the validity of a medical collection account listed on my credit report. This letter is submitted in accordance with the provisions of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 USC 1692g ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 USC 1681 ).

Account Information : Creditor Name : [ Name of Medical Provider ] Account Number : [ Account Number ] Date of Service : [ Date of Service ] Amount : $ [ Amount ] I believe that this collection account should be removed from my credit report for the following reasons : 1. Lack of Verification : Pursuant to 15 USC 1692g, I have the right to request verification of this debt. I have not received any written verification of the debt from your agency or the original creditor, XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX. It is my legal right to seek verification of the debt 's validity. 

2. Inaccurate Reporting : The reported debt amount is inaccurate. I have documentation indicating that the amount in question has been disputed with the original medical provider, and an agreement has been reached for a different amount. This discrepancy calls into question the accuracy of the debt as reported by your agency.

3. Statute of Limitations : Please note that the statute of limitations for the collection of this debt may have expired. I request that you provide documentation establishing the date of the last activity on this account to determine whether it falls outside the statute of limitations for collections.

4. Failure to Provide Proper Notice : As required by 15 USC 1692g, your agency is obligated to provide me with a written notice, including the amount of the debt, the name of the creditor, and my rights under the law, within five days of your initial communication. I have not received such notice from your agency.

I kindly request that you investigate and verify the debt in question promptly or provide evidence of the debt 's validity within 30 days of receiving this letter, as required by 15 USC 1692g. Failure to do so may result in a violation of federal law and may necessitate legal action.

Additionally, I would like to bring to your attention the case of Clark v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Case No. [ Case Number ], where the court ruled in favor of the consumer due to the lack of proper debt verification by a collection agency. This case sets a precedent for the importance of verifying the accuracy and validity of debts in compliance with the law. 

I expect your agency to adhere to the legal requirements outlined in this letter and promptly resolve this dispute. Please provide me with a written response, including any supporting documentation, to confirm the resolution of this matter.

Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative: Hello, My name is XXXX XXXX, Consumer, who currently resides at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX which is in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I am writing this complaint because Consumer Adjustment Company , Inc., XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, any of the above-mentioned corporations ' executives, directors, assignees, Officers, affiliates, and nonaffiliated third parties, have violated many Consumer Protection and XXXX  and Privacy Laws. Consumer Adjustment Company , Inc., is furnishing inaccurate, inequitable, negative information that is causing XXXX XXXX, XXXX, severe financial distress, causing him to be unable to extend credit. This account needs to be deleted and permanently removed from the XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX credit file of XXXX XXXX, XXXX.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am responding to the letter you sent dated about a debt you are trying to collect. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( g ). This claim is being disputed and a debt validation is requested. I also have reason to believe that you are in violation of 15 USC 1692e. False or misleading representations as defined ( 3 ) The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the above-named Title and Section.After the case with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the Consumer Federal Protection Bureaus ( CFPB ) took action against XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX their illegal debt collection and credit reporting practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect on disputed debts using unlawful collection letters and misrepresentation. The CFPB stated that XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debt that was NOT substantiated after consumers disputed the validity of the debt conducted an investigation and found that XXXX sent collection letters to consumers who DISPUTED the validity or accuracy of their purported debts, even though XXXX had NOT obtained substantiation for the debts. As a debt collection, the CFPB states you are required to have a reasonable basis for assertion that a consumer owes the purported debt if a dispute is submitted. As a result, the CFPB required XXXX XXXX XXXX to pay redress to affected consumer and pay a {$1.00} XXXX penalty to the CFPBs victim relief fund. 

The CFPB outlined a list of requests we, as consumer, can ask for when we are seeking proper validation of debt to ensure you are ethically seeking debt legally. I have requested a proper validation of debt for the past 2-3 months YET you have not provided me with the substantiated information the CFPB outlines and you continue to have this alleged account reported on my consumer report? A PROPER validation of debt address EACH item of validation that I am requesting. You can find each request listed below. 

The account in question is listed below : Partners Financial Services Inc - 699156 - 12 CFR 1006.34 - Notice for validation of debts. - Please remove this account. You are in direct violation of the FCRA for reporting this account on my credit profile without conduting a proper investigation. Per 15 US Code 1681n - Civil liability for willful noncompliance, as a consumer I have sustained grave damages as a result of your negligence. As a result, I have grounds to sue you for these damages up to {$1000.00}. 

Please provide me with a proper validation of debt. If you can not provide me with the documentations I am request, please request to have this account permanently remove from my credit report and the debt permanently discharge. 

I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 

Complete payment history, the requirement of which has been established by XXXX v XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Please provide verification by line item ( with explanation of each item such as when the purchase took place, how much the alleged items was, were the goods/services received, what were the goods/services received, etc. ) for the entire amount you say I owe obtained directly from the Original Creditor. 

If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 

Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 

If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. 

The obligation between you and I that allows you to collect on the alleged debt and any transactions between your company that binds me to an agreement to pay your company any money that you claim I owe. 

Proof of photo identification ( i.e., drivers license, state identification card, or other government issued identification card ) that was presented to you at the time of incurring this alleged debt. 

Letter of sale or assignment from the original creditor to your company ( Agreement with your client that grants you the authority to collect on this alleged debt. Please show me proof that this debt was actually sold to you. ) The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 

State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 

If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 

If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. 

In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 

Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 

Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 

Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt. 

I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? 

If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

( Enclosed is a copy of the list of your licenses. I found this document on the XXXX database. I dont see XXXX this list. How are you legally attempting to collect this alleged debt, in a state that youre not licensed in, that you havent properly validated after numerous request- yet still reporting to the credit bureaus which further affects my credit profile and credit score? This sounds to me like Aggravated Identity Theft, per 18 US Code 1028A Aggravated Identity Theft ) If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 

I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In hindsight, your agency willing took on this debt willingly that you have not properly validated with me as a LAW ABIDING consumer. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. If a proper validation is not provided, you can not recover this debt to try and collect from me per volenti no fit injuria. 

PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT. 

PLEASE PROVIDE ME WITH PROPER DEBT VALIDATION BASED ON MY REQUESTS IN THE COMPLAINT ABOVE. I AM ASKING FOR A WET SIGNATURE BINDING MYSELF AND YOUR BUSINESS AS WELL AS A CONTRACT THAT I SIGNED AGREEING TO ANY TERMS AND CONDITIONS YOUR COMPANY HAS SET. IF YOU CAN NOT PROVIDE THIS INFORMATION, PLEASE REMOVE THIS ACCOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORT. PLEASE NOTE THAT I AM A LITIGIOUS CONSUMER AND AS A LAW ABIDING CITIZEN I WILL EXERCISE THAT RIGHT. THANK YOU FOR UNDERSTANDING. 

PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER. 

IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED. 

WITHOUT PREJUDICE XXXX XXXX CC : ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF SOUTH CAROLINA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ATTORNEY GENERAL OF THE STATE OF NORTH CAROLINA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CONSUMER FEDERAL PROTECTION BUREAU CC : FEDERAL TRADE COMMISSION

Consumer complaint narrative: CNAC JD Byrider sold me a XXXX  XXXX that broke down the SAME DAY! The vehicle had a warranty and they never were successful in fixing the vehicle. I had the vehicle less than a year. JD Byrider CNAC promised to fix the vehicle and did not after replacement of the motor twice. I was told my CNAC that I could trade the vehicle. When I had a friend take me there to pick out another car I was told mine was missing. After calling the police was told the bank took it. They had the car longer than I did at the shop. They had possession of the vehicle for 4 months while I paid for it and NEVER FIXED IT! Never Ran Properly

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative: On or around XX/XX/XXXX cash app/XXXX XXXX locked me out of my checking /operating account, the initial reason they gave me for doing this was they were unable to verify my identity. After spending an entire day performing numerous steps their customer service Team gave ie, setting up & verifying a new banking account, uploading selfies along with my drivers license to their " square website '' sending banking statements from another banking institution " XXXX XXXXXXXX '' submitting banking transactions from the transfers out of their bank & into my other banking account. I performed numerous of identification steps to no satisfaction of there's. Finally on XX/XX/XXXX when I have had enough of the non sense they were doing I requested closure of the account all of sudden they were no able to access the account & give me permission to make decisions on the account where previously I wasn't allowed any decisions or information about my account in question. After successfully closing the account I inquired if they were going to mail out my account balance to the address on file ( my home address ) the bank representatives I requested this information from all said on a recorded phone & in writing that were refusing to issue the account balance refund to me & that they were not obligated to disclose any additional information to me. They also indicated that they were not liable for refunding me any of my money. I spent an entire day ( see attached documents ) with a supervisor named XXXX giving her a multitude of information identity documents and over being as transparent and compliant as possible to fix the issue at hand. XXXXXXXX XXXX is still refusing to refund my money from the account balance & double down on their position of not being liable to disclose any funds to me. I was shocked at the overall position of this business being I supplied so many documents to authenticate my account, even electronically XXXX a separate bank account to their systems.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX. has previously attempted to collect an alleged debt through various collection agencies but has failed to provide supporting documentation, such as account statements or cardholder agreements, necessary to validate the debt. Without this documentation, I have been unable to determine the legitimacy of the claim or resolve the matter amicably. 

More recently, XXXX filed a lawsuit through the law firm Tenaglia & Hunt, P.A. Despite this legal action, there has been no direct communication or disclosure regarding the details of the alleged debt. The only correspondence I have received has come in the form of unsolicited mail from consumer protection attorneys, which has done little to clarify the issue. 

I believe XXXX failure to provide proper documentation and its subsequent legal action demonstrate an attempt to pressure me into compliance rather than resolve the matter transparently and in good faith. I am submitting this complaint to request that XXXX be required to provide the necessary documentation and work toward a fair resolution of this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Difficulty submitting a dispute or getting information about a dispute over the phone
Consumer complaint narrative:
Its clear as per complaint XXXX with the CFPB my account was closed in retaliation. You guys even said yourself my account was to be reviewed over 2 months before its closure and wasn't due to " error '' even though I made MANY attempts to get updates and to escalate the issue. I paid my bill in whole every month XXXX issues besides PROVEN and agreed upon fraud disputes. I then removed my AU and used my cars up until it was closed by you with XXXX warning and prior to the restrictions. Now I ask for more details it's " classified '' information but if I get another card I can't even use it without fear of an unexpected closure for XXXX reason..would n't it be right to atleadt tell someone their " violations '' so it's not repeated. I was due justly monetary relief and to evade those cost you guys closed my account. I will take this to court I have contacted the treasury and general attorney and this is my last attempt for you to make things right. 

Violations : THE DOCTRINE XXXX ( XXXX  ) XXXX XXXX XXXX. I PRESUME THAT NO PROOF OF THE ALLEGED DEBT, NOR THEREFORE ANY SUCH DEBT, IN FACT THEREFORE EXISTS PURSUANT TO 18 USC 8, L OWE NO DEBT. XXXX XXXXXXXX  IS VIOLATING MY CONSUMER RIGHT TO PRIVACY PURSUANT TO 15 USC 1681-B2 COMPANY HAS NO PERMISSION XXXX XXXX XXXX 15 USC 160468 A CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCY CAN NOT FURNISH AN ACCOUNT WITHOUTOUT MY WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS. Pursuant to 15 USC 1666b A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open-end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose, unless the creditor has adopted reasonable procedures designed to ensure that each periodic statement including the information required by section 1637 ( b ) of this title is mailed or delivered to the consumer not later than 21 days before the payment due date. NONE OF THIS WAS LAWFULLY DONE.

If these laws don't apply to you and if my claims are incorrect please detail how and back your claims with LAW not company policy or I will send an Affidavit of notice to file suit for deformation due to the status of a perfect account now reflecting negitive as " closed by company ''

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Changes in loan terms during or after closing
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally address and document my ongoing issues with Selene Finance regarding the mismanagement of my mortgage loan. Over the course of my interactions with Selene Finance, I have encountered numerous discrepancies and conflicting information that have caused confusion, financial harm, and undue stress for me and my family. 

Key Issues Allegations of Missed Payments and Foreclosure Threats Selene Finance has stated that I was 15 months late on payments, which they claim warrants foreclosure. 
I was informed verbally that this information originated from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
When I contacted XXXX  XXXX XXXX, I was told verbally that I had never missed a payment. This conflicting information has left me confused and uncertain about the validity of Selene Finance 's claims. 
Unexplained Payment Allowance and Loss Mitigation Selene Finance is currently allowing me to make payments of {$1.00} per month, but when I asked for clarification, I did not receive a response.

I was also told verbally that I was under Loss Mitigation with Selene Finance, yet I have no recollection of signing any agreement for this service. 
Furthermore, I was informed that this alleged agreement was signed in XXXX. This is impossible, as I was stationed overseas in XXXX during that time, actively engaged in military operations in the XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
Forbearance and Deferment Issues My mortgage was originally serviced by XXXX  XXXX XXXX, with whom I am still disputing their decision to place my loan into forbearance/deferment during the XXXX pandemic. This was done under coercion, with the threat of foreclosure if I did not comply. 
The only document I recall signing with a clear understanding was with XXXX  XXXX XXXX for a refinance/loan modification. 
Despite my requests to remove the deferment and establish a regular payment plan, Selene Finance continues to impose terms I did not agree to or understand. 
Account Alterations Without Consent Selene Finance has made unexplained alterations to my account, including changes to my loan that they have yet to justify clearly. 
Recently, I was informed that my account was altered due to hurricanes in Florida, yet my disputes predate these events, going back to XX/XX/XXXX. 
In XX/XX/XXXX, I paid {$50000.00} to bring my account to a {$0.00} balance, except for the deferred balance of {$70000.00}. I was instructed to send this deferred balance via money order to a Texas address, but I have not received confirmation that it was received. 
Communication Barriers Selene Finance has acknowledged that they will not send me email correspondence, yet as a military service member, relying solely on postal mail is impractical and inefficient. 
Despite numerous attempts to communicate and clarify my account status, Selene Finance continues to provide vague or contradictory explanations, further complicating the situation. 
Unauthorized Forgery and Document Alteration Selene Finance has altered my monthly statements and provided documents that include forged signatures purporting to be mine. I have not signed any such agreements knowingly or willingly. 
Foreclosure Threats Without Resolution Options I have been given direct orders from Selene Finance that my home will be subject to foreclosure due to nonpayment. However, I have consistently requested that they remove the deferment on my account so that I can make payments. 
Requested Resolutions Clarification of Account Status : Provide a detailed, written explanation of the 15 months of alleged missed payments, including documentation supporting XXXX Finances claims. 
Acknowledgment of Payment : Confirm receipt and application of the {$70000.00} money order sent in XX/XX/XXXX to address the deferred balance. 
Removal of Deferment/Forbearance : Remove any imposed deferment or forbearance to allow for a regular payment structure, as I have requested repeatedly. 
Correction of Account Alterations : Restore my mortgage account to its original terms prior to the unexplained alterations made by Selene Finance. 
Cessation of Foreclosure Actions : Halt all foreclosure-related proceedings until the issues outlined above are resolved in full. 
Transparent Communication : Resume email correspondence and provide clear, written responses to all inquiries to ensure transparency moving forward. 
Investigation of Forged Documents : Investigate and address the unauthorized use of my signature on documents I did not sign or agree to. 
Closing XXXX XXXX Finances actions, including the refusal to provide clear explanations, alteration of my account without consent, and reliance on vague or contradictory policies, have placed my home and financial stability in jeopardy. The lack of transparency and accountability is unacceptable. 

I respectfully request an immediate review of this matter and prompt action to address the issues outlined. I am committed to resolving this dispute but need Selene Finance to act in good faith and with integrity.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It XXXX Concern, I am filing a formal complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of an account on my credit report, which I am requesting be removed entirely. The account in question is a XXXX  account, where I was listed as an authorized user. Below are the account details : Account Name : XXXX  Account Number : [ If available, you can include the last XXXX digits of the account number here ] Reported Balance : {$5200.00} Last Reported Date : XX/XX/XXXX Credit Limit : {$2100.00} Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Account Closed : XX/XX/XXXX The issue at hand is that this account was reported as closed with a balance of {$5200.00} on XX/XX/XXXX, despite my role as an authorized user and not the primary account holder. Furthermore, the dispute resolved status showing " subscriber disagrees '' is entirely inaccurate. As an authorized user, I do not hold responsibility for the balance, and the statement is misleading. 

I request the immediate removal of this account from my credit report. The account has been inaccurately reported, and its inclusion is harmful to my XXXX XXXX and financial well-being. 

Legal Basis for Request : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically Section XXXX ( a ), furnishers of credit information are required to provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies. The current reporting of this account violates the FCRA in the following ways : Inaccurate Reporting : The account was reported as a closed account with an outstanding balance. As an authorized user, I have no legal responsibility for the balance, and this should be reflected in the reporting. 

Dispute Status : The " subscriber disagrees '' status is inaccurate and misleading. This indicates a dispute that I did not initiate or resolve, which is a violation of the FCRA 's requirement for accurate information. 

Failure to Correct Information : The FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies and furnishers correct any inaccuracies in a timely manner. The failure to accurately report the account as authorized user status rather than primary account holder is a violation of this obligation. 

Due to these violations, I am requesting that this entire account be removed from my credit report. The incorrect reporting of this account has caused significant harm to my credit and financial standing. 

Potential Legal Action : Should this matter not be resolved in a timely manner, I will consider pursuing legal action for damages under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as I have suffered harm due to inaccurate reporting. Under the FCRA, I am entitled to seek compensatory damages, including actual damages, statutory damages, and punitive damages for the failure to accurately report my credit information. 

I will also explore the option of engaging an attorney who specializes in consumer protection law and credit reporting disputes. A law firm such as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, which specializes in credit report disputes, FCRA violations, and consumer protection, can assist with this matter and pursue appropriate legal remedies if necessary.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not received from closed account
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX I closed a joint account that had a value of {$31000.00} I had with my deceased father. He had been dead for years and my mother submitted his death certificate to Wells Fargo several times to close his other accounts. I requested the closure of the account and sent them another copy of the death certificate. Wells Fargo closed the account and sent me a check that required his signature. I called and asked for a reissued check. They said they would send it. 
A few weeks go by and I call again for an update and they told me they needed more time to reissue the check. I waited a couple more weeks and called again to ask for an update and they told me they can not reissue checks and there was never a request to reissue checks. I asked why they issued a check that could not be cashed and they insisted there was no problem. I asked them to reissue a check anyway and they said I would need to fill out a lost/stolen check form. 
I received the form and returned it. It was rejected. They sent a new copy and informed me that the form needed to be notarized. This time, the form had my father 's name in the name section mixed in with my name. It appeared to be a typo. I asked them to send me a new form. They insisted it was not a typo and that it would not be rejected by a notary. I brought it to a notary and they refused to sign it ( it was not my name in the form ). I called and asked for them to reissue the form as the name was wrong. I insisted they make sure my name was the only name on it and they refused to comply. Again, insisting that the notary would sign off on it. I asked them to check with their legal department that this was the case and they confirmed. 
I received the 3rd form and it now had a XXXX ' sign in the name and my father 's name on it. The notary rejected it again ( my name does not have a '+ ' in it ). I called again and asked for a form with only my name on it. They refused and said they could send a blank one instead. I asked to change to written communication. At the time they agreed but they responded only briefly via paper mail before returning to direct calls and not responding to mail. I filled out the blank form and notarized it. I noticed they had not sent me any return envelope not return address but luckily I had one of the old ones and I sent it back. 
I called a couple weeks later because I was receiving no response from written communication and no calls. They told me they had received no form. I asked them to check at the address I sent it to and they told me it would take a week to research it. I called a couple weeks later and they insisted they were still working on it. A couple weeks later I call again and they deny the request to research. They claim I never called and there was no form or request to look for the form. I asked for them to send me another form multiple times over the coming months but the forms never arrived.

Multiple times over the course of these exchanges, I asked to be escalated to management or a higher priority. These requests to speak to management were denied and when I requested escalations I had my case moved to a different department that would send me repeated canned responses. They would either call or email saying " your case is closed. We sent you a form '' I would reply " I have not received a form '' and they would reply " we are reopening the case, please give us 3 weeks to investigate the case '' and then they would reply with " your case is closed. Our records show we had sent you a form last time ''. 
Finally after passing a year of this I demanded, formally, that Wells Fargo issue me a check for the money they owe me. They refused to respond. I asked a local lawyer and they tell me there is nothing they can do because Wells Fargo engaged with me primarily via call to make sure I wouldn't have a record. I have many records of communication but not enough for a case. 
I should also mention that they had told me this matter could be " fixed if you went to an in-person branch ''. However there is no branch in my entire state and the closest one is over 10 hour drive. It is doubtful that there would be a fix at an in person branch and I have run out of options. It seems like this bank can rob me and there is nothing I can do.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint About Misleading Foreclosure Reporting by M & T Mortgage Bank Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding misleading and deceptive credit reporting practices by M & T Mortgage Bank. Specifically, they have reported that a foreclosure was initiated on my mortgage account, despite the fact that I paid the mortgage in full and in accordance with the terms of the contract. 

The report from M & T Mortgage Bank stating that foreclosure started is misleading because the contract does not include any provision for reporting such an event if the account was paid as agreed and settled in full. The reporting of a foreclosure, despite the account being paid off, has created significant obstacles in my ability to secure a mortgage from other lenders. These lenders have been unwilling to approve me for a mortgage due to the false foreclosure reporting, forcing me to seek a loan directly from M & T Mortgage Bank, who is aware that the account was paid in full. 

This reporting is not only deceptive but also harmful, as it misrepresents my credit history and falsely implies that I engaged in a short sale or other foreclosure-related actions. This could impact my ability to obtain credit or loans in the future. 

I believe this misreporting is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates accurate and fair reporting by all credit reporting entities. I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and help ensure that M & T Mortgage Bank corrects the false information on my credit reports.

Product: Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Issue: Problem with additional add-on products or services
Consumer complaint narrative:
First off this isnt my first complaint on this same subject, after reviewing the companies response I have realized I shouldve provided more info on my issues with XXXX  XXXX XXXX  and Aqua finance. I am also unhappy with the CFPB for closing my first complaint. 

Some background, I had just moved into my new home, and in process of renovating my old home for my tenants, needless to say I was exhausted. Further more, the water quality at my new home was very hard and metal heavy, giving us digestion problems so I was a little desperate at the time of the signing. I am a night worker that works XXXX hours daily so during the time of any signings I did with Aqua and XXXX  I was not in any rational condition. 
Severe mistake of mine to have let my exhaustion get the best of me, I was rushed into signing paperwork, not realizing I was paying for a severely overpriced system with a ridiculous APR. if I had been more aware I wouldve never agreed to this contract. 
Being busy with work and home renovations I had let time go by. I had forgotten the contacts details. It wasnt until I got home a few weeks later that I saw what XXXX had done. 

The certificate of completion was signed by XXXX XXXX who had missed the problem. It wasnt noticed until I had gotten home a few weeks later. I did not sign the certificate myself because I was unhappy with the results. 
I did not like the installation they did, they ran a cable from the outside of my home to the inside of my home to plug into an outlet. I complained to XXXX  about the installation, I spoke to XXXX XXXX who told me it was the way the company did it and that nothing could be done to change it. I was very unhappy. XXXX offered to have my system inspected for performance which I declined because I saw no use for it since the system was working fine but it was the installation and arrangement of the system I had a problem with. It is affecting the way I arrange my room and its very inconvenient, XXXX XXXX from XXXX said he couldnt offer anything else to help my situation. 
I understand that XXXX provided pictures to Aqua fianc and Cfpb to show the installation, but I have doubts as to what was shown. It doesnt matter if the installation was up to standard, it was not approved by XXXX the customer. And I still strongly believe that the procedure shouldve been discussed first. 

Previously I had also tried to have the system removed but I chose not to since multiple XXXX  XXXX  representatives had told me I was still to pay the loan. Last thing XXXX suggested suggested I took care of the situation with Aqua finance.

Aqua finance was also negligent of my needs. All they did was state that I signed the contract and that I was responsible for paying it off. Typical of any shady business. They ignored my actual issues and They ignored the fact that I didnt sign the certificate of completion. 
I also believe that 3 days is very little time to cancel. I am sure that if it was legal for XXXX  or Aqua finance to do so they wouldve given us NO time. They know what they are doing and they wanted to defraud me since the start. They are XXXX companies that are preying on unsuspecting and exhausted people. 
Last part. I was informed by XXXX that Company XXXX XXXX XXXX had posed as a XXXX parcel on hold notice in the mail to get him to contact them. 
Bad business practice. I mentioned this to XXXX XXXX Aqua finance who did not seem to care. 
Since the day of the contract I have been refusing to pay off the loan. I will notify the credit unions of my situation since I plan to escalate this if the CFPB doesnt help.

I want to provide dates and documents but I am very limited. I have provided a copy of the contract and a picture of the installation detail I have an issue with.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a notification from my bank ( XXXX ) for acct # XXXX of insufficient funds for an amount of {$77.00}, and now the amount has increased since I was not able to transfer money from another account on time to avoid an overdraft fee of {$34.00}, bringing the total amount of the insufficient funds to {$110.00}. 

My complaint is about the confusing emails and confirmations that I received from Capital One that led to the above situation. It begins with the fact of scheduling a payment to my credit card account ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) on XX/XX/XXXX of {$100.00}. After I scheduled the payment, I received an email confirming the payment. On XX/XX/XXXX I received another email confirming that the payment had posted. 

To my surprise on the following Wednesday, XX/XX/XXXX I received another email from Capital one stating that my payment of {$100.00} had been returned due to insufficient funds. Immediately, I checked my XXXX account and I noticed that there was a {$100.00} more in the account than there should be. On the same day, XX/XX/XXXX, I tried again to schedule the payment on the Capital One platform for {$100.00}. 

Next, I received the email confirming that I had scheduled the payment on the same day. Just a little later after I receive that email, I received another email the same day saying your payment has been returned, it listed the previous date that I had tried to schedule, which was on XX/XX/XXXX, but at this point I did not know what to think and was even more confused. 

On that same day, XX/XX/XXXX, I called Capital One and spoke with a customer rep who eventually transferred me to a XXXX customer rep who then acknowledged that the only payment request that they saw from capital one was in XX/XX/XXXX. I never heard from the other customer rep after talking with this XXXX customer rep. I was a bit suspicious if there was any fraud involved, which there has been much lately. 

After speaking with Capital One and XXXX, I assumed that capital one had not properly posted the payment or something had happened in transition and I had also received another email saying that the payment had been returned so I naturally assumed that I needed I transferred {$100.00} from my XXXX  account to my Capital One checking account ( XXXX ). I did the transfer from XXXX  because, at this point, I was confused and I did not trust trying to schedule a payment again on Capital Ones platform. 

The next day on XX/XX/XXXX, I received another email from Capital One stating that the payment had posted. After seeing this and checking this account that the payment had posted I immediately tried to transfer the {$100.00} from my Capital One checking account back to the XXXX  account because I did not have enough to cover {$200.00} in my XXXX  account ( {$100.00} posted + {$100.00} transferred after talking to customer reps of both banks ) nor was I able to transfer the money into the account on time to prevent an overdraft fee because it was Friday. 

Im entirely blaming this overdraft fee of {$34.00} and the insufficient funds of {$77.00} solely on Capital One for their incompetence and confusing emails. Im XXXX XXXX XXXX, but I can read and comprehend and I know that something is not right in the way that this transaction was done this time and I would like for them to pay for the overdraft fee of {$34.00} and whatever else that may occur since the account is still in overdraft mode. I would also like for CFPB to investigate their process of how they inform their customers about payments and scheduling. 

This all couldve been totally avoided if emails wouldve been clear and transactions processed correctly. 

Best regards, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX are all inquiries that I did not and never authorized to run my credit, I have not asked for them to be run my credit and have no business with them. XXXX XXXX XXXX has a collection on my credit report and I have no business, nor have Fraudulent Collection Accounts : The following collection accounts have been inaccurately attributed to me and do not belong to me : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Balances : {$810.00} and {$210.00} The CRAs failure to remove these unauthorized inquiries and fraudulent accounts, despite my disputes, constitutes a violation of the FCRA Legal Violations : Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : The CRAs are obligated to maintain accurate information on consumer reports. Reporting unauthorized inquiries and fraudulent collection accounts is a direct violation of this requirement.

Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) : Ive asked numerous times to remove any address from my Credit report thats only has my ID and Bill addressed that has not been removed. Upon receiving my disputes, the CRAs were required to conduct a reasonable investigation into these items. Instead, they claimed the information was verified without providing supporting documentation or details of their investigation.

Unauthorized Inquiries ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : A credit inquiry must have a permissible purpose. The above-listed inquiries were made without my authorization, and the CRAs have failed to validate their legitimacy.

Impact on Me : These unauthorized inquiries and fraudulent collections have caused significant harm, including : A decline in my credit score.

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative: I have been trying to get my home repaired for two years, with the insurance company eventually paying after the claim went to appraisal. Pennymac has the insurance checks but does not release until it has passed inspection. When it was time for an inspection, they advise I have to request, then wait to be contacted by the 3rd party inspector ( 7 days ), then schedule several days after contacted. I have had several inspections cancelled after I had already taken off work, without notice. When the inspector finally did arrive, he arrived 2 hours early, then left without performing the inspection. I took off work early to meet him, but he refused to come back at the scheduled time, advising I must start the scheduling process over again. He ended up having me take pictures and sent them to Pennymac, with his write up ( from an inspection he did not do ), and Pennymac determined my work was 50 % complete and would issue 50 % of the funds. My house repairs are completed 2 weeks after the scheduled inspection, and I still have not received any funds. I spoke with customer service, again, and they initiated a dispute, freezing even the 50 % payment, making me restart the inspection request over again because they reviewed the previous inspection ( which never happened ), and determined it only 60 %. When asked what the recourse is to have accountability, or to even expedite the final inspection to pay the contractor, they advised that there was none. Now, my repairs will be completed and I will have to pay more than {$75000.00} out of pocket until they can go through the process to get me scheduled.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in hopes of getting some assistance with my account with Vystar. I have been with Vystar for over XXXX  years and have served this country for the last XXXX  years as an XXXX combat veteran. The issue at hand is this, I have been informed by the fraud department that my account will be closed due to multiple payments made in order to assist with a major purchase I am in the process of completing. They did not give me any further information but that the paid transactions would be returned. I tried to explain to them that when a new paying account is added to the account, that it takes XXXX business days to clear the account before a large payment is made ( according to their automated telephonic system ). Therefore, payments could only be made online through an automated system for only {$2000.00} at a time. Please note, I do not reside in Fl and there is no branch here in California. I explained this to the fraud department, which clearly didn't know about this automated service. Otherwise, they would never have asked why I was making payments in {$2000.00} increments. Because of that, they decided that they didn't want to do business with me anymore claiming that the account payment was made from was inaccurate. 

The account was not fraudulent and no security measures were breached in this process as I had the payee on the line verifying and authorizing each payment. I also contacted Vystar the day before to let them know that I was going to be doing cash advances due to the large purchase that needed to be made. When asked to further investigate and prove their case of returned payments, they had no other answer for me than to state that it looked suspicious and fraudulent so they have to close my account. 

I feel thrown away and discarded and I would like my account reinstated immediately. I have filed an XXXX claim in regards to this, contacted the CEO and President of Vystar, the audit committe, and anyone else that need to be involved in this matter. If this is not resolved amicably, I will have no choice but to file a lawsuit against Vystar.

Consumer complaint narrative:
NOT A DUPLICATE COMPLAINT. 

On XX/XX/XXXX Mr Cooper sent a letter to my attorney stating that, " Please note that during the investigation and resolution of your inquiry, written correspondence, such as billing statements and mandatory pre-foreclosure notices, may continue. '' This confirmed that my property was in pre-foreclosure status which would be appropriate under the circumstances and with ongoing investigations of deceptive business practices and other illegal activities that Mr cooper, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX and other entities connected to them engaged in. Yet, in spite of XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX responding to another federal complaint stating that in XXXX they relinquished any and all interest in the loan, Mr Cooper may have transferred title to XXXX XXXX  XXXX and or other entities. Other communications from Mr Cooper and/or their attorneys stated that a foreclosure auction occurred on XX/XX/XXXX. They then provided other information that contradicted that. Due to other deceptive business practices and Mr Cooper contradicting itself in years of communications, a tactic they continue to use to conceal their fraud, my property sits with an expensive temporary power pole and storage unit that I have been responsible for since XXXX when the work on the property had to stop because they began altering and falsifying information regarding work done at the home after it was destroyed in a fire. These fraudulent business practices were used to withhold my insurance proceeds that has been sitting in an escrow account to repair the home for over 10 years. 

The renter/ caretaker of the property has been receiving harassing phone calls from people claiming they own the property but not providing names. Security cameras revealed various people banging on the gates and trying to enter the property. This is a result of Mr Cooper 's actions along with XXXX XXXX XXXX, their realtor and an online auction company that stated the bank requested they list the property ( in spite of ongoing unresolved matters and Mr Cooper sending us a letter acknowledging that it was in a pre-foreclosure status on XX/XX/XXXX ). 


As a result of years of delays due to Mr Cooper and XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX deceptive business practices, the company owning the temporary power pole began a lawsuit against me for over {$20000.00} for payment for the temporary power pole and storage unit that I could not continue to pay on while my home sits uninhabitable from a fire that occurred in XXXX.

Even though I have reported the inaccuracies many times, I can't seem to get assistance.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear XXXX, I write to formally lodge a complaint against Equifax concerning the erroneous and misleading reporting of an account linked to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) on my consumer credit report. 

**Factual Background** : - Equifax has persisted in representing this account as accurate, notwithstanding my successful dispute with XXXX, which culminated in the removal of said account from my credit profile. 
- This inconsistency raises substantial concerns regarding the reliability and validity of Equifax 's verification process. 

**Legal Basis** : - Pursuant to 15 U.S. Code 1681i, consumer reporting agencies are mandated to expeditiously delete any disputed item that has been determined to be inaccurate or unverifiable.

- The conflicting results from the same financial institution signify a potential failure in Equifax compliance with the statutory obligations established under 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ), which necessitate that consumer reporting agencies uphold standards of accuracy and integrity in reporting.

**Impact on Consumer Rights** : The ongoing reporting of this inaccurate account has inflicted significant harm upon my creditworthiness and overall financial well-being. Such conduct contravenes the principles enshrined in the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which underscores the necessity for fairness, impartiality, and consumer privacy. 

**Demand for Remedial Action** : I hereby demand the immediate expungement of this erroneous account from my Equifax credit report. Enclosed, please find pertinent documentation from XXXX that corroborates my assertions. 

I respectfully implore the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to undertake a comprehensive investigation into the practices of Equifax in this matter. I anticipate your prompt and thorough response to address my concerns.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Discover Financial Services [ Discover Address Subject : Request for Investigation and Removal of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Due to Identity Theft Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing regarding an account associated with my name and Social Security number that is inaccurately being reported on my credit report. I have disputed this account with you previously, but you responded by stating that the account information is accurate and belongs to me. I am informing you again that I am a victim of identity theft, and someone unlawfully used my personal information to open this account. Furthermore, they redirected all correspondence to an address that is not mine.

I have attached a copy of the identity theft report for your reference. As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, once a consumer notifies a creditor or reporting agency of identity theft and provides documentation, the account must be blocked or removed from credit reporting within four ( 4 ) business days. Despite this legal requirement, the account continues to be inaccurately reported on my credit report.

Here are the critical points regarding this matter : Fraudulent Account : The address linked to the account is not mine, nor is it listed on my credit report. I have never received, used, or activated a Discover card.

Charged-Off and Written-Off Account : According to my credit report, the account has been charged off and written off. If the debt was indeed written off and Discover claimed a tax deduction for the amount, you would be required by the IRS to provide me with a Form 1099-C. Failure to do so implies that the reporting of a balance owed is inconsistent and a violation of FCRA standards for accurate reporting.

Violation of FCRA : Reporting inaccurate information on my credit report constitutes a violation of the FCRA. This continued reporting of an account I neither opened nor used, combined with the lack of a Form 1099-C, infringes on my rights and could expose Discover to legal liabilities, including damages.

Unfair Tax Implications : If the debt were written off and considered taxable income, it would be unjust for me to pay taxes on income related to a fraudulent account I did not open or use.

Under the FCRA, I am requesting the following : That Discover permanently remove and delete this fraudulent account from my credit report.

That you cease all reporting of this account to any credit reporting agency.

Written confirmation that you have taken these steps to rectify the issue.

I trust that Discover will act in good faith to comply with federal laws and correct this error. If no action is taken, I will have no choice but to seek legal recourse to protect my rights and hold Discover accountable for any violations of the FCRA.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
My credit reports show a reputed collection account XXXX with XXXX XXXX  with different opening dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities. I have never had an account with this company nor any record of any type of first notice of debt including rights to dispute from this company. And if I, by chance, even though I have no recollection nor tangible record, naively spoke with a representative of this company over the phone about this debt, I was not informed by that representative that I had a right to dispute this debt nor a specific timeframe to do so.

15 USC 1692g 809. Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents states that within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector. Https : //www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/receipt definition of the word receipt is- a writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money ; proof, evidence. I have never signed nor received any type of acknowledgement receipt from a mailing service for any mail from this company. I am familiar with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Had I signed a receipt of notice for the proper and legal documentation from this company, I wouldve immediately responded asking for lawful verification of debt or copy of court ordered judgement well within the lawful 30 days allotted. After receiving my response letter with receipt, this company would have to legally cease from collection attempts and remove the account from my credit reports until their proof of verification is sent back to me. This company has reported to my credit reports without observing the FDCPA laws. My credit has been impacted adversely because of this companys irresponsibility.

My credit reports also show that AMERIFINANCIAL SOLUTIONS has provided this alleged account with inaccurate information. The FCRA requires that all data reported from the credit reporting agencies, creditors, or furnishers on a consumer 's report be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY. This means no data can be reported that can't be legally PROVEN to be 100 % accurate. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. My XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX credit reports all show different open dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities for this same exact account. Therefore making this alleged account full of inaccuracies.

This is erroneous and flawed reporting that is listed on my credit reports. Not only did AMERIFINANCIAL SOLUTIONS not follow lawful FDCPA communications protocol, but it has also broken FDCPA False or Misleading Representations protocol as well. A debt collector, in collecting a debt, may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. Specifically, a debt collector may not falsely represent the character, amount, or legal status of the debt, or of any services rendered, or compensation he or she may receive for collecting the debt. A debt collector may not communicate, or threaten to communicate, false credit information or information that should be known to be false, including not identifying disputed debts as such. Each of my 3 credit reports show different information instead of them all showing the exact same information. This is considered a false and misleading representation that this company has submitted to the credit reporting agencies.

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has begun to aggressively litigate companies who continuously violate consumer laws. According to consumerfinance.gov, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) took action against the nations two largest debt buyers and collectors for using deceptive tactics to collect bad debts. The Bureau found that XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX bought debts that were potentially inaccurate, lacking documentation, or unenforceable. Without verifying the debt, the companies collected payments by pressuring consumers with false statements and churning out lawsuits using robo-signed court documents. The CFPB has ordered the companies to overhaul their debt collection and litigation practices and to stop reselling debts to third parties. 
The CFPB found that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debts that they knew, or should have known, were inaccurate or could not legally be enforced based on contractual disclaimers, past practices of debt sellers, or consumer disputes. The companies also filed lawsuits against consumers without having the intent to prove many of the debts, winning the vast majority of the lawsuits by default when consumers failed to defend themselves. These practices violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

The website also stated that XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX threatened and deceived consumers to collect on debts they should have known were inaccurate or had other problems, said CFPB Director XXXX XXXX. Now, the two biggest debt buyers in the market must refund millions and overhaul their practices. We will continue to take action to protect consumers from illegal and obnoxious debt collection practices.

Just as the CFPB took action against the above companies, I am asking the CFPB to take action against this company as well. Please help me get this account removed immediately and conduct an investigation on this company. As a consumer, Im publicly publishing this descriptive complaint on consumerfinance.gov so that others can learn from my experience and so that this government agency can use this information to help work with other violations and complaints from consumers regarding this company. It is not my duty to provide evidence that this alleged debt is not mine. It is the legal obligation of the debt collector to first prove or provide proof of evidence that they can lawfully collect on any alleged debt before a consumer challenges it, accurately report to the credit agencies, and follow all FCRA and FDCPA laws. As of today, they have been very unsuccessful to do so.
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Ray Klein, Inc. dba Professional Credit Service Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, OR XXXX Phone : XXXX Description of the Issue : I am submitting this complaint regarding the unlawful and predatory debt collection practices of Ray Klein , Inc. ( dba Professional Credit Service ), which have violated federal and state consumer protection laws. On XX/XX/2024, Ray Klein , Inc. garnished {$6800.00} from my checking account without proper notice or adherence to Oregon law. This garnishment is tied to a medical debt that is beyond the statute of limitations for collection. 

Key Issues : 1. Improper Garnishment of Funds : The entire balance of {$6800.00} was taken from my account, leaving me with no funds for basic living expenses. This violates Oregon law, which requires at least {$2500.00} to remain in the account.

2. Failure to Provide Notice : I received no advance notice of the garnishment, which left me unable to contest or prepare for the financial impact.

3. Expired Debt : The medical debt in question is from XXXX, and is well past the statute of limitations for collection under Oregon law XXXX 
4. Improper Service : I was never properly served notice of the lawsuit tied to this garnishment. The documents were delivered to an address I no longer resided at, invalidating the service.

5. Harassment : Ray Klein, Inc. made attempts to garnish wages at a job I did not even work at, further highlighting the companys predatory and harassing behavior. They also pressured me for employment information during communications, which I felt was intimidating.

The companys actions are a clear violation of my consumer rights under federal law, including the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and relevant state laws. 

Impact of the Issue : The garnishment has caused severe financial hardship. I was left with no funds to cover essential bills, rent, or basic living expenses for XX/XX/2024. 
I have experienced significant emotional distress, including anxiety and embarrassment, as I had to take time off work to address this issue. 
My family has faced undue strain, particularly after Ray Klein, Inc. improperly attempted to garnish my husbands wages, even though the debt is solely in my name. 

Resolution Sought : I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to : 1. Investigate Ray Klein , Inc. for violations of the FDCPA and other consumer protection laws.

2. Require the company to reimburse the improperly garnished funds immediately.

3. Ensure Ray Klein , Inc. ceases any further collection efforts, including garnishments or wage attempts, on this expired debt.

4. Hold the company accountable for harassment and violations of consumer protections.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I appreciate your help in holding Ray Klein, Inc. accountable and ensuring that consumers are protected from such predatory practices.
