Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Was not notified of investigation status or results
Consumer complaint narrative:
Account XXXX. XXXX Refference ID : XXXX On XX/XX/year>, I sent a dispute letter to Resurgent Capital Services on behalf of LVNV Funding LLC , via certified mail with receipt number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Return Receipt ( green card ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The Return Receipt was received and signed by XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/year>. 

On XX/XX/year>, I received a response letter from Resurgent Capital Services that included an Account Summary Report, which they claimed provided verification of the debt. However, this document was insufficient as it did not include any original signed agreement, proof of assignment, or chain of title to establish that LVNV Funding LLC had the legal right to collect the alleged debt. 

On XX/XX/year>, I sent a follow-up letter via certified mail with receipt number XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, requesting proper validation of the debt. Shortly after, I received another letter from Resurgent Capital Services, dated XX/XX/year>, stating they had initiated a review of my inquiry. 

Despite the debt being under dispute, it continued to be reported on my credit report, which is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( b ) and potentially the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 8 ). These actions have caused harm to my credit profile and may represent deceptive practices. 

I request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and ensure Resurgent Capital Services and LVNV Funding LLC comply with applicable federal laws, cease reporting the debt during the dispute process, and provide proper validation of the debt as required by law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a certified letter ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX to Credit Corp Solutions ( CCS ) requesting Debt Validation and a Cease and Desist under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Ohio XXXX XXXX XXXX, Contract Law, and Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) Article XXXX. My letter specifically requested the following : Complete chain of title and proof of assignment. 
The original contract with all signatures. 
The bill of sale and full purchase agreement. 
Proof of authorization to collect the debt. 

In response, I received a letter from XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX and Quality Assurance XXXX ), dated XX/XX/XXXX, along with the following information : Original Creditor : XXXX Bank XXXX. Account XXXX : XXXX. Current Creditor : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Balance Outstanding : {$980.00}. Reference Number : DT XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX stated that the debt originated from an account with XXXXXXXX XXXX created on or around XX/XX/XXXX, which was allegedly assigned to CCS on or around XX/XX/XXXX. The letter included terms and conditions and account statements. However, it did not include the documentation I specifically requested, such as the original signed contract, proof of assignment, or complete chain of title. There are no signatures from either party, nor did they provide the bill of sale, purchase agreement, or other key documentation required to validate the debt under federal and state laws. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I sent a follow-up letter via certified mail ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) restating my demands for : Complete chain of title and proof of assignment. Bill of sale and full purchase agreement. Assignment of rights and title. Proof of authorization to collect the debt. 

To date, Credit Corp Solutions has not responded to my second letter or provided the requested documentation. Additionally, they continue to report the alleged debt on my credit report while it remains under dispute, which is a violation of the FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ), and may also constitute unfair or deceptive practices under the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692e. These actions have negatively impacted my credit profile and caused undue stress.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the inclusion of bankruptcy records on my credit report under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). As a consumer, I have the right to accurate and verifiable information in my credit file, and I am requesting the immediate removal of the bankruptcy records reported by your agency. 
Disputed Item Details : Public Record Type : Bankruptcy Filing Date : XX/XX/year> Court Name : United States Bankruptcy District of Arizona Reason for Dispute : I have conducted a thorough investigation and obtained the following information : XXXX. Bankruptcy Court Statement : I sent a letter to the U.S. Bankruptcy Court inquiring about the reporting of bankruptcy records. The court confirmed that they do not report any information to credit agencies. They also stated that if someone needs bankruptcy information, they must : o Physically visit the court and pay a fee to retrieve the information, or o Register for a XXXX  account and pay a monthly fee to access records online. 
XXXX. XXXX Confirmation : I contacted XXXX, a common third-party provider for public records, and they confirmed they do not have any of my bankruptcy information in their system. I have enclosed their written confirmation for your review. 
XXXX. Equifax and Credit Report Statements : Upon reviewing my credit reports, both Equifax and XXXX stated that they use a third party to retrieve public records, specifically naming XXXX as their source. However, as mentioned above, XXXX has explicitly confirmed they did not provide any information regarding my bankruptcy, and they provided me with a confirmation letter for proof. 
Given these facts, it is clear that the bankruptcy information on my credit report can not be verified and must be removed. The continued presence of inaccurate information on my credit report violates 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires credit reporting agencies to maintain maximum possible accuracy. Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), unverifiable information must be deleted during the dispute resolution process.

Action Requested : XXXX. Investigate the accuracy of the reported bankruptcy records immediately. 
XXXX. Remove the bankruptcy records from my credit file since they can not be verified by your data provider ( XXXX ). 
XXXX. Provide written confirmation of the investigation results and the actions taken regarding this dispute. 
Enclosures : Correspondence from XXXX confirming the absence of my records in their system Highlighted copies of my credit reports showing the disputed bankruptcy records Failure to Comply : If you fail to verify the accuracy of this information or remove it promptly, I will take the following actions : XXXX. Filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the next step, I will file a complaint with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and then I will file a complaint with my state Attorney Generals office. 
XXXX. Retain legal counsel to file a lawsuit seeking actual, statutory, and punitive damages under 15 U.S. Code 1681n ( willful violations ) and 15 U.S. Code 1681o ( negligent violations ). 
This is a serious matter, and I expect a response within XXXX  days, as required by law. All correspondence should be sent to my address listed above. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address a matter regarding the wrongful withholding of funds and the subsequent false accusation of fraud by fifth third bank. I previously filed a claim against your institution concerning the deposit of a check that was unfairly held and not returned despite assurances to the contrary. Contrary to the representations made by your institution, my account was not closed, and the funds were not returned as promised. 

In addition to these failures, I recently received correspondence from the Department of the Treasury stating that due to my endorsement of the check, I am precluded from filing a claim with them. However, the banks actionsincluding the false allegation of fraud and the unlawful withholding of my fundsconstitute a violation of my rights under various state and federal statutes. 

Violation of the Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) : Under the Uniform Commercial Code, specifically UCC 3-304, a bank is required to honor checks unless there is a valid reason for non-payment, such as a stop payment order or insufficient funds. Your refusal to process the check and return the funds is a direct violation of these provisions. 

False Accusation of Fraud : The false accusation of fraud, without substantiated evidence, may violate state consumer protection laws and could be considered defamation under state tort law. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), the bank has an obligation to conduct fair business practices, and falsely accusing a customer of fraud when no evidence supports such claims constitutes an unlawful business practice. 

Theft and Conversion of Funds : Under state law, the unauthorized retention or withholding of funds that rightfully belong to an account holder constitutes theft or conversion. I request immediate reimbursement of the funds that have been wrongfully withheld and a formal resolution of this matter. 

Despite the Treasurys position on my claim, I am entitled to recover my funds, as the bank has failed to meet its legal obligations and has caused me financial harm by withholding my deposit and making false accusations. I request that you promptly resolve this matter by either refunding my funds or providing a valid explanation and legal basis for the continued withholding. 

Please respond in writing within 3-5 business days. If this matter is not resolved satisfactorily, I will be compelled to pursue further legal remedies, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), my states Attorney Generals office, and exploring civil legal action for recovery of my funds. 


Please see previous report that was closed without any investigation XXXX XXXX XXXX which was completely bias and unfair. My money has been stolen by this bank and must be returned immediately

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, I saw an ad on XXXX for XXXX and decided to buy a few. The seller told me they accepted XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, so I sent the money in three separate transactions. Unfortunately, the seller never sent the items or responded to me after I paid. 

I went to my local Wells Fargo branch to report the issue, and they told me I should file a claim for the transactions. Following their advice, I filed claims for all three payments, providing the details of what happened. 

A few weeks later, I received an email from Wells Fargo saying my account would be closed due to suspicious activity. When I called to ask why, they said it was because I had made multiple claims and that my account was relatively new ( only five months old ). I explained that all the claims were legitimate and related to the same fraudulent seller, but they told me there was nothing they could do and that my account would close on XX/XX/XXXX. 

I dont think this is fair. I followed their advice and acted responsibly to report fraud, but now Im being penalized for it. I have proof that the transactions were all with the same seller and would appreciate it if Wells Fargo would reconsider their decision.

Consumer complaint narrative:

XXXX. Breach of Loan Servicing Agreements : Heartland ECSIs failure to properly manage my deferment and notify me of the loan transfer may breach their contractual obligations as a federal loan servicer. 
Furthermore, Heartland ECSI recently settled a class-action lawsuit ( XXXX XXXX XXXX. v. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) for {$3.00} XXXX regarding their unlawful " pay-to-pay '' fees, which demonstrates a concerning pattern of non-compliance that directly affects me.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Violation of Fair Credit Reporting Act by First Progress Card To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally report a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by First Progress Card. According to the FCRA, specifically Section A, a person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if they know or have reasonable cause to believe the information is inaccurate.

Additionally, under Section B, it states that a person shall not furnish information to any consumer reporting agency if they have been notified by the consumer that specific information is inaccurate, and the information is indeed inaccurate. 

I contacted First Progress Card regarding inaccuracies in my credit reporting. Unfortunately, the representative I spoke with was unhelpful and did not address my concerns adequately. I emphasized that credit card accounts remain on a credit report for seven years and that I have maintained this account in good standing for over a year. Despite this, First Progress Card has not updated my information with all three credit bureaus without correcting the inaccuracies.

I kindly request that your offices investigate this matter and take appropriate action against First Progress Card for their non-compliance with the FCRA. It is essential for consumers to be protected from inaccurate reporting that can negatively impact their creditworthiness.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

Product: Mortgage
Consumer complaint narrative:
For context, the mortgage company " SLS Servicing '' / " NewRez '' / " Shellpoint Mortgage '' is all the same holder of my mortgage- they have changed their brand name three times in three years. After seeing a XXXX rating average review of below XXXX stars of about XXXX reviews, I can understand why they keep changing their name. Reading those reviews, my experience has been consistent with thousands of others who mortgages have unfortunately been acquired by this company. 

In short, I have a traditional mortgage on my home that I purchased about three years ago. 

I have made every single payment on time or early in the exact monthly amount due. Just to make it extra clear, I have never paid a principle-only payment of any kind. They only options the mortgage company provides online are " principal payment '' or " one-time payment '', so of course I always select " one-time payment ''. 

In XXXX of 2024, they took my monthly payment but did not apply it to the principal. Then, we get in this trap cycle each month : -then they say I am late -they add a late fee -they require an additional {$3500.00} payment of my own cash to be " on time '' and not harm my credit -they finally reverse the transaction about 30 days later -they admit it was their fault and waive the fee ( on my recorded line ), they say the problem is fixed, that my payment has been applied as a mortgage payment, and that I do not need to pay the next month 's payment since it is already paid -they do not refund my cash to me -then, starting with the new month, they say I am behind again, as if that {$3500.00} is not applied as a payment after all -they add a late fee... rinse and repeat I finally checked with the company that originated the loan and then sold it. My original loan officer ( who is also the branch manager ) of the original company prior spent many hours reviewing each mortgage transaction line and verified that I had paid an extra payment correctly and should be ahead on payments. 

Even after a month of basic communication where she and I have emailed and communicated with the mortgage company by phone, the mortgage company still has not fixed the issue and has not replied to us. 

At this point, the CFPB and legal recourse are all that remain as potential solutions.

I moved in XX/XX/year>, with a monthly rent of {$390.00}, a deposit of {$200.00}, and a utility deposit of {$120.00}. I enquired about breaking a lease on XX/XX/year>. I was told I need to give a 60-day notice and pay extra one month rent of {$390.00}. It was never in their policy what the charges will be if I break a lease without 60-day notice and I was never informed during my enquiry. I made a miscalculation when I was filling the form for a 60-day notice, I chose XXXX instead of XX/XX/year>. I was informed about the discrepancy but I already bought my ticket with the XX/XX/year> plan. I paid all the charges including extra one month rent ( included in the attached documents and it was titled " lease break fee '' ). Up till this point there was no information about any other charges, until after some weeks, I received an email of being charged {$1000.00} and my {$390.00} was deducted, so I need to pay extra {$690.00}. I initially negotiated and pleaded for a lesser amount in other to keep the house but I stopped when I found out that it was a rip-off. 
My arguments : 1. I was not aware of any extra charges till I left the house and also not included in their policy. 2. My deposit was not refunded. 3. While would a room of $ XXXX monthly require {$1000.00} for a lease break ( outrageous ). 

2. Collection agency did not communicate with me and did not give me enough time before putting it on my credit. I did not have a physical address and a phone number when I moved out of the house, the company ( XXXX ) communicates with me through email. I am curious why the collection agency did not send me an email, informing me of putting it on my credit before doing so. 
My point : I want the collection removed from my credit. 

CONTACTS : XXXX  website : app.livehomeroom, com, phone : XXXX. 
Collection agency is NATIONAL CREDIT SYSTEM, phone : XXXX.

Consumer complaint narrative: I applied for the XXXX XXXX XXXX  card credit card. I was approved. After that I received a email from Barclays which appears to be the bank managing the XXXX credit card. Then I gave them by phone a different address to send the card since I dont get mail on my phisical address which was the address asked on the application. After that they locked my account and asked for additional information. They asked for copies of my drivers license, proof of address and SSN card. They asked that all this documents to be send by mail as my only option. I told them I cant send my personal information by mail cause this is not acceptable cause my personal information can be in risk of getting stolen or lost on the way. Then they keep saying its the only way to activate the card. First of all, the bank should have a way to confirm my SSN information based on the information available publicly. I have over 7 credit cards and none of them ever asked me to send a copy of my SSN by mail. This doesnt sounds like common sense, acceptable and legal. Things got worse when today I received an email from them with an information about my statement. And they are charging me {$99.00} for the annual fee. How I can be charged for the annual fee if I dont even have an active credit card since they dont wan na activate my card cause the only options they give me is sending my personal information by mail. I feel uncomfortable, abused and that I am being disrespected regarding my personal information. In addition to everything, I am being charged unduly for an annual fee for a card that could not even be activated. It seems to me that some banks or credit card companies believe they have the right to request information arbitrarily. There seem to be no limits or rules that clearly define what these companies can or can not do. Whats the responsibility of XXXX XXXX in all this? Whats the responsibilities of XXXX in all this? who will be held accountable for this whole situation?

Consumer complaint narrative:
I was trying to make my credit card payment much before due date as I don't like to carry a balance. 

I'd ~ {$37.00} balance on Amex XXXX XXXX XXXX card and I scheduled a payment on XX/XX/XXXX. The payment was declined due to insufficient funds on XX/XX/XXXX. My pay day is XX/XX/XXXX and I made funds available on XX/XX/XXXX. I got an email saying they will try a couple more times to process the payment and I don't have to do anything. 

I saw that they processed the payment on XX/XX/XXXX. 
But then I also saw they charged a returned payment fee of {$29.00}. This was not mentioned in the email I received - that just said I don't have to do anything and they'd try a couple more times, which they did. 

When I contacted them a couple of times, I was told that there is an automated system that puts the thing and based on account history, the system is declining the waiver. I was told by a supervisor that I don't use the card often and that seems to be a reason why the system is not waiving the charge. The customer service people were nice but they were handicapped by a system that seems biased and making decisions based on how much the card is used. 

My complaints are ( a ) I was charged though I was told I don't have to do anything ( b ) my payment was processed the next day after it was declined ( c ) the charge is high {$29.00} compared to XXXX balance of {$37.00}. ( d ) the system output for waiver is arbitrary and unfair and discriminatory ( XXXX ) I was trying to pay off much early and it is not late payment. 
******************************** This was the email The following payment on your account was recently returned because there were not enough funds in your bank account. 

Payment Amount : {$36.00} We will attempt to process it up to XXXX more times in the next few days. Theres no need for you to make a new payment at this time. 


Please confirm your bank account information and ensure there are sufficient funds in your bank account. 

You may experience purchasing disruptions until this payment clears. 
*************************************************************

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was result of identity theft
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the accuracy and completeness of the information being reported about my XXXX XXXX XXXX account ending in XXXX, including the alleged amount of XXXX, as permitted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ).

This account is inaccurate and associated with identity theft. Specifically : 1. False credit disputes beginning in XX/XX/XXXX have been made in connection with this account, apparently to manipulate the alleged, unverified alleged debt back onto the associated checking account for financial gain.

2. The alleged debt is unknown as to how it occurred, and still unverified at this time of writing. 
3. On my XXXX credit report, the account contains a " Resolved '' Fair Credit Billing Act ( FCBA ) dispute notation, despite me never filing a dispute under FCBA. 
4. On my XXXX credit report, a " Consumer disputes after resolution '' comment has been added, even though no true resolution was reached, as the fake disputes were never adequately investigated by XXXX  XXXX XXXX despite my multiple written requests. 
5. The account is not notated as being in litigation across XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX and XXXX, which it currently is. 
XXXX  XXXX XXXX has not acknowledged suspicious activity related to this account that I did not initiate nor did Blitt and Gaines P.C. their attorneys. Despite this, my attempts to address these issues directly with XXXX  XXXX XXXX and their legal representatives, Blitt and Gaines P.C., have resulted in repeated delays and insufficient action. Blitt and Gaines have agreed to pause legal proceedings pending further investigation, but the negative impact on my credit continues. I have also called three times requesting the last contract on XX/XX/XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, I had under this account. This of which still has not been sent to me, and with the first two requests being past 30 days of not receiving. Also, in the first CFPB complaint I did - XXXX in XXXX the accurate reporting letter sent to me was in error as I never did this dispute on the alleged balance, nor this account directly to XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX , nor have I did a dispute on the alleged balance, and account in XX/XX/XXXX to return all alleged charges to the associated checking account. Twice this year, I have requested a sworn affidavit or declaration in regards to the account both in XX/XX/XXXX via USPS, with tracking numbers to both XXXX  XXXX XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Blitt and Gaines P.C. - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and, XX/XX/XXXX to XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Blitt and Gaines P.C. - XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Both of which past 30 days to date in both requests from both companies after being shirked in regards to the identity theft.

I have enclosed the following documents to substantiate my claims : 1. FTC Identity Theft Report.

2. Police Report and associated case number provided by XXXX  XXXX XXXX that is : XXXX. 
3. Illinois Attorney General Identity Theft Affidavit.

4. Correspondence between myself, XXXX  XXXX XXXX, and Blitt and Gaines P.C.

5. The final checking account statement from XXXX  XXXX XXXX, the last XXXX card statement ( ending in XXXX ), and XXXX  XXXX XXXX notices showing fraudulent disputes on the account. 
XXXX. XXXX dispute information, along with XXXX and XXXX credit reports showing the aforementioned inaccuracies. 
7. A response from the Illinois Attorney General regarding this matter to Blitt and Gaines P.C.

This situation of identity theft has caused significant harm to my reputation and credit health. The failure to investigate and resolve these inaccuracies constitutes negligence under the FCRA.

I request the following actions from your agency : 1. Remove the Resolved FCBA notation and the Consumer disputes after resolution comment from my credit reports, as they are inaccurate and misleading.

2. Update the reports to reflect that I am actively disputing this account on this date of receipt, with supporting documentation provided.

3. Add a notation that this account is associated with identity theft.

4. Add a notation indicating that this account is currently in litigation.

5. The last contract I had with XXXX XXXX XXXX  as I still have not received it yet.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL, XXXX XX/XX/year> Portfolio Recovery Associates, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, VA, XXXX Subject : Request for Debt Validation Dear Portfolio Recovery Associates I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding an alleged debt, referenced as account number [ Account Number, if available ]. This letter serves as my formal request for validation of the debt as outlined in the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. 

Please provide me with the following information to validate the debt : Verification of the Debt : Proof that I am responsible for the debt, including the original creditors name and address. 

Amount Owed : A detailed breakdown of the total amount claimed, including principal, interest, fees, and other charges. 

Documentation : Copies of all documents that support your claim and demonstrate that I am liable for this debt. 

Chain of Ownership : If the debt has been transferred or sold, provide proof of the complete chain of custody, including all assignments, transfers, and sales of the debt. 

Verification of Your Authorization : Proof that your agency has the legal authority to collect this debt in my state.

Until you provide the requested information, I request that you cease all collection activities related to this alleged debt, including reporting it to credit reporting agencies, as required by law.

Please note that this is not a refusal to pay but a request for clarification and validation of the debt. I expect your response within the legally mandated timeframe. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Vehicle loan or lease

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint AgainXXXX Zion Debt Holdings for Illegal Debt Collection Practices To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally file a complaint against Zion Debt Holdings, located at XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX, UT XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, UT XXXX, for engaging in illegal debt collection practices in the state of Delaware. 

I have been contacted by Zion Debt Holdings regarding a debt that they claim I owe. However, I believe this debt is being collected illegally for the following reasons : 1. **Lack of Licensing** : I have reason to believe that Zion Debt Holdings is not properly licensed to collect debts in Delaware. Under Delaware law, all debt collectors must be licensed to operate in the state, and I request that the CFPB investigate their licensing status.

2. **Failure to Validate Debt** : I have requested validation of the debt, including an original contract between myself and Zion Debt Holdings XXXX As per the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am entitled to receive this validation. Despite my requests, I have not received any documentation proving that I owe this debt or that Zion Debt Holdings has the right to collect it. 

3. **Cease and Desist** : I hereby request that Zion Debt Holdings cease all collection activities until they provide the requested validation. If they continue to pursue this debt without providing proof, I will consider this harassment and a violation of my rights under the FDCPA.

4. **Removal from Credit Report** : Additionally, I request that any accounts related to this alleged debt be removed from my credit report. Since I have not received validation of this debt, it should not be reported as accurate or valid.

5. **Legal Action** : I would like to inform you that if this matter is not resolved promptly, I will take legal action against Zion Debt Holdings for their unlawful practices, including but not limited to failure to validate the debt and potential violations of state and federal debt collection laws.

I kindly request that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Zion Debt Holdings to ensure compliance with debt collection laws. Please confirm receipt of this complaint and keep me informed of any actions taken.

Thank you for your attention to this serious matter.

On XX/XX/XXXX, I deposited a check for {$8500.00} to my personal checking account. This check was written to take revenue from a business acct. at a different insitution. I am the sole proprietor of the business and the sole account holder. My funds were unrestricted for a short time, during which I used the funds to pay bills, etc. A few days later, the transactions were back-charged to the acct., and the acct. was restricted. So, now I have outstanding balances that I have the funds to pay, but no means to. I am accruing late charges on these accounts. 

I first contacted XXXX on XXXX. I asked their security team for any information on how this occurred, when this may be resolved, and what else I can to access my funds as quickly as possible. I received no answers. I contacted them again today and received absolutely no new information. I was told the inquiry would be escalated to an agent who can give me more answers, but I have not received any messages.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding LexisNexis Risk Solutions for erroneously reporting an at-fault accident on my consumer report that allegedly occurred in XX/XX/year>. This inaccurate information is negatively impacting my insurance rates, as it has been used by insurers to justify higher premiums. 

I have attempted to dispute this error with LexisNexis, but the dispute process is overly complex, burdensome, and not user-friendly. Despite providing sufficient evidence to demonstrate that this accident should not be attributed to me, LexisNexis has failed to properly investigate and correct the error on my report. 

This incorrect reporting is causing financial harm by inflating my insurance costs, and I am requesting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau 's assistance to compel LexisNexis to correct my consumer report promptly and improve the fairness and accessibility of their dispute resolution process

Product: Student loan
Sub-issue: Problem with forgiveness, cancellation, or discharge
Consumer complaint narrative: I was sent an email from the XXXX and the White House stating that I qualified for early forgiveness if switched to the SAVE plan since my original amount borrowed was under a certain amount ( under $ XXXX plus a year for every $ XXXX over that amount ). I submitted and switched on XX/XX/year> which was acknowledged by XXXX and my servicer ( edfinancial ) I should have been included in the wave of forgiveness in XXXX, however Edfinancial failed to process my application in a timely manner and I was passed over for forgiveness. I had multiple chats with Edfinancial in which they acknowledged they had the application, but it was not processed. Unfortunately, they did not process my application until XXXX and the injunction happened not that long after. So now I have missed out on forgiveness that I should have received. I received a letter from them last week acknowledging they did receive my application on XX/XX/year> but failed to process it until XXXX and that they were retroactively applying a forbearance during that time. Unfortunately that also added additional interest to my balance that was not there previous to this letter. I just want to know what options I have, as I should have had my balance forgiven in the XXXX XXXX  and now instead I am stuck in limbo with the SAVE plan being challenged-especially since I only switched to Save because I was told I would get immediate forgiveness.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Don't agree with the fees charged
Consumer complaint narrative: I am keeping a log of both my monthly payments as well as additional payments I make in between monthly payments. Interest is 6.830 % accruing daily, which I am factoring in and logging each time I make a payment. My monthly payment is {$370.00}. I pay an average of $ XXXX/month. Each month, the balance increases rather than reduces. For example since XXXX, Edfinancial shows my balance {$400.00} more then my ledger of payments. The difference is not the interest because I am calculating the interest daily and including that amount, daily, as noted above. ( How can I be paying {$100.00} MORE per month than my established monthly payment, yet have an increasing balance? If I was not keeping a detailed, personal, daily log of this, I would not have noticed it. But the numbers do not add up and each time I have called, the representatives I have spoken to also could not explain the reasoning in how the money was being applied. They were only able to offer to send me, by snail mail, a copy of the list of all the payments I have made. This does nothing to address the discrepant amounts/balances after the payments have been made. So I have no recourse if the amounts are wrong (?? ) I do not know where their balance number is coming from. It doesnt add up correctly. I want them to explain how the more I pay, the higher my balance gets.
